title: (AllModern) Retail Operations & Visual Specialist
description:
**Operations \& Visual Specialist \- AllModern Stores**



Location: Lynnfield, MA



The pay for this position is $21\-24/hr however, base pay offered may vary depending on location, job\-related knowledge, skills, and experience.



Come join the team that is reinventing home! Wayfair is hiring for our AllModern retail store! If you are looking for rapid growth, constant learning and dynamic challenges, this store might be the future home for your career.

  


**What you’ll do:**


* Provide an authentic, friendly customer experience that exemplifies our Wayfair commitment to relentless customer focus.
* Manage, maintain and monitor stock levels, receive and process merchandise, ensure items are properly stored, and easily located for replenishment on the sales floor.
* Provide coaching and support to Operations/Visual Associates and support their allocated workload efforts as determined by the Store Leader. Depending on the specific work shift, this associate will help open and/or close the store, with keyholder responsibilities.
* Support associates to help drive exceptional customer service and maintain a strong visible presence in the designated work area to drive sales and strong customer service.
* Support Store Leaders to train and develop associates on knowledge of our product, selling, customer service, operations, visual, and other aspects of their roles.
* Along with the Store Manager, provide helpful observation feedback and thoughtful guidance to associates to aid them to adapt and grow.
* Support visual merchandising tasks such as maintaining store’s visual standards, floorsets, window changes, signage placement, lighting installations, basic electrical wiring, wallpapering, etc, as needed
* Utilize sales analytics tools to drive store profitability and growth in a way that supports the success of the overall brand.
* Drive sales in the store by asking great questions to understand customer needs, guiding them through their questions, providing product options (both within store and our endless aisle/online assortment via web and app) that leads to a satisfied customer experience.
* Assist walk\-ins on the sales floor and in the design studio as needed.
* Bring a willingness to share innovative ideas and solutions to continuously improve team operations.
* Engage in a high energy, focused and dynamic work environment where there can be rapid changes in products, promotions, offerings and operations.

  


**What you’ll need:**


* 2\+ years of retail experience; preferably in the home or furnishing space. Interior design , furniture, or home goods experience preferred.
* An ability to read, interpret and execute a sales floor design layout map or basic planogram experience, preferred.
* Basic electrical wiring experience, preferred
* Experience in visual merchandising ( lighting installs, wallpapering, furniture assembly, preferred.
* Passion for great customer service, operational excellence, and efficiency to meet company goals.
* Track record of thriving in a fast paced and changing environment.
* Strong organization, self\-motivation, communication and relationship management skills.
* An ability to handle customer escalations and demonstrate professional maturity


**Physical Requirements:**
--------------------------


* While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to stand, walk, talk and hear. The employee frequently is required to handle, or feel and reach with hands and arms. The employee is occasionally required to sit, regularly climb or balance, and frequently stoop, kneel, crouch, crawl or reach overhead. The employee must regularly, frequently or occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 lbs.
* Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.
* Ability to ascend/descend a ladder (minimum 10ft)
* Ability to use a variety of hand\-held tools,(such as, but not limited to, wire cutter, wire strippers, screwdrivers, hammer, measuring tape, leveler, drill).
* Ability to use basic electrical wiring, associated with lighting installation.

  


**Compensation \& Benefits:**


* Compensation starting at $21\.20 per hour, which increases based on your relevant experience \+ substantial quarterly bonuses
* Medical benefits, financial benefits, and a generous employee discount

title: Retail Asset Protection & Loss Prevention Specialist
description:
**Asset Protection Specialist (Full\-Time) \- Wayfair Stores**



Location: Wilmette, IL



The pay rate of this role is $19\.00/hr


**Overview:**



As an **Asset Protection Specialist**, you’ll play a critical role in ensuring a safe, secure, and welcoming environment for Wayfair associates, customers, and visitors. You will actively monitor and respond to security and safety concerns, providing support during emergencies and maintaining the integrity of Wayfair’s operations. With a focus on professionalism, customer service, and proactive problem\-solving, this role is essential to protecting Wayfair’s people, assets, and reputation. The ideal candidate thrives in a dynamic environment, collaborating with leadership and Wayfair teams to implement safety protocols and deliver peace of mind to everyone who walks through our doors.


**What Does an Asset Protection Specialist Do?**

  

* **Engage and Protect:** Build trust and confidence by greeting visitors, contractors, and employees with a professional and approachable demeanor. Provide assistance and guidance while maintaining a secure environment.
* **Monitor and Respond:** Actively oversee security systems, including CCTV, access control, and alarms, to identify and address potential risks. Respond promptly to incidents, emergencies, or safety concerns, ensuring the safety of all individuals on\-site.
* **Demonstrate Reliability:** Attendance and punctuality are crucial to maintaining a secure environment. Proactively communicate and plan for any unexpected events to ensure consistent coverage and support.
* **Always Be Vigilant:** Approach every shift with a proactive mindset, identifying and addressing potential security risks before they escalate. Maintain detailed records of incidents, daily activities, and safety assessments to support continuous improvement.
* **Provide Safety Expertise:** Leverage your knowledge of all site\-specific policies and security protocols. Implement emergency response procedures and access control systems to ensure compliance with Wayfair’s safety standards. Conduct regular safety assessments and resolve issues promptly.
* **Support Operational Excellence:** Collaborate with the Asset Protection Manager and Lead on investigations, initiatives, and safety training. Assist in maintaining a clean, organized, and secure environment for all.
* **Adapt to a Fast\-Paced Environment:** Thrive in a dynamic setting with rapidly changing priorities, maintaining focus and composure during high\-pressure situations.
* **Deliver Exceptional Service:** Commit to providing a safe and welcoming experience for everyone at Wayfair. Handle sensitive situations with discretion, professionalism, and empathy, ensuring confidentiality and trust.


**What are the Job Requirements?**


* **Asset Protection \& Security Experience:** 1\+ year of experience in asset protection, security, or a related field required. (Experience with access control systems \& CCTV systems is a plus.)
* **Educational Background:** High school diploma or equivalent required.
* **Flexible Availability:** You must be available to work a flexible schedule, including nights, weekends, and some holidays.
* **Customer\-Facing Experience:** 1\+ year of customer service experience in a retail or customer\-facing environment is preferred.
* **Physical Capabilities:** Ability to stand and walk for prolonged periods and lift up to 50 pounds unassisted.
* **Technical Proficiency:** Comfortable using Google Workspace, including Gmail, Google Sheets, and other tools, with the ability to learn and navigate necessary security and operational systems.
* **Core Competencies:** Strong professionalism, independent judgment, and discretion in handling sensitive or confidential situations. Outstanding written and verbal communication skills to effectively document incidents and interact professionally with individuals at all levels.
* **Time Management \& Multitasking:** Proven ability to prioritize tasks, manage multiple responsibilities simultaneously, and maintain focus and accuracy in a fast\-paced environment.


**Additional Physical and Environmental Requirements**:


* Physical Demands
* + Frequent movement including standing, stooping, kneeling, crouching
	+ Occasional lifting, carrying, pushing, and pulling up to 50 lbs
	+ Frequent repetitive motions and coordination
	+ Constant handling, grasping, and communication (talking/hearing)
	+ Ability to ascend/descend stairs and balance
* Working Environment
* + Some exposure to cold, heat, and humidity
	+ Occasional noise and vibrations
	+ Minimal hazards and seasonal temperature changes

**What are the Benefits\*?**


* **Competitive Pay:** Earn competitive compensation with regular opportunities for performance\-based increases.
* **Career Growth:** Access professional development and advancement opportunities to help you grow with us.
* **Health Benefits from Day One:** Medical, dental, and vision insurance coverage starts on your first day.
* **Time to Recharge:** Start accruing paid time off immediately—because work\-life balance matters.
* **401(k) with Company Match:** We’ll match up to 4% to help you plan for your future.
* **Tuition Reimbursement:** Eligible after 6 months of employment—learn, grow, and get support along the way.
* **Wayfair Employee Discount:** Save big on the pieces you love—plus get 10% off at our in\-store restaurant ️.
* **Parental Leave Options:** Choose from paid and unpaid leave plans to support your growing family.
* ✨ \***And So Much More:** We’ve got more good stuff where that came from! Our full\-time roles receive the full benefits package, while part\-time or seasonal team members may have modified offerings. Your recruiter or in\-store team can help with any questions!

**About Wayfair Inc.**



Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry\-leading technology and creative problem\-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If you’re looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then you’ll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking.



No matter who you are, Wayfair is a place you can call home. We value and rely on the collective voices of our employees, customers, community, and suppliers to help guide us as we build a better Wayfair – and world – for all. Every voice, every perspective matters. That’s why we’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, genetic information, or any other legally protected characteristic.

title: Sr. B2B Sales Specialist, Wayfair Stores
description:
**Sr. B2B Sales Specialist, Wayfair Stores**  

  

*The hourly compensation for this role is $24/hr.*  

  

**Overview:**  

  

At Wayfair, we’re transforming the way businesses shop for their spaces—and as an in\-store **B2B Sales Specialist**, you’ll be on the front lines of that mission. This isn’t your typical sales role. You’ll act as a trusted partner to local businesses, helping them discover the power of Wayfair Professional and our in\-store design expertise. Whether it’s a boutique hotel redesign, a new office buildout, or ongoing projects for local contractors, such as Interior Designers, you’ll be their go\-to guide for all things Wayfair.



This role blends sales development, community building, and hands\-on customer support. You’ll grow our professional customer base by connecting with new prospects, activating and growing business from existing accounts, and working closely with in\-store teams to bring large\-scale projects to life. At Wayfair, we believe in hustle *and* heart—and in this role, you’ll find both.



Ready to drive impact, grow your pipeline, and help businesses bring their visions to life? Let’s make it happen.

  

**What Does a B2B Sales Specialist Do?**


* **Grow the B2B Business:** Build relationships with local Wayfair Professional customers—both new and existing—by prospecting, cold calling, and community engagement. Your goal? Drive awareness, increase in\-store program adoption, and help businesses unlock the full potential of the Wayfair Professional Program.
* **Engage Local Wayfair Professional Customers:** Proactively reach out to existing and potential B2B customers in the local market to promote the value of our in\-store experience, encourage visits, and connect them with our Design Specialists. Reengage inactive accounts and uncover new opportunities through tailored outreach and relationship\-building strategies.
* **Prospect Net\-New Customers:** Use online research, walk\-ins, and cold outreach to connect with business owners across industries. You’ll validate enrollment status, pitch program benefits, and help them get started with Wayfair Professional.
* **Build Local Partnerships:** Develop relationships with area business associations, real estate developers, and design industry organizations. Share insights and collaborate with the home office to scale successful partnership models across markets.
* **Coordinate Events:** Partner with store leadership and marketing to host monthly in\-store B2B events and identify opportunities for community engagement that showcase Wayfair’s offerings and expertise.
* ️ **Support B2B Projects In\-Store:** Act as the go\-to B2B expert for store teams and customers alike. You’ll answer program questions, connect customers to the right design and delivery services, and support complex or large\-scale orders.
* **Enable the Team:** Educate associates on B2B tools, benefits, and workflows. Collaborate closely with our instore and virtual Sales teams to ensure a seamless handoff for customers visiting our store from remote channels.

  


**You’ll Thrive in this Role if You Have:**


* **Sales Drive:** 2\-3 years of general sales experience with a proven track record of hitting or exceeding goals—preference in B2B development or trade environments.
* ️ **Retail Know\-How:** 1–2 years of retail experience working with customers, ideally in high\-touch or specialty sales settings.
* **Great Communication:** You’re comfortable building rapport over the phone, in person, or via email. You know how to listen, engage, and follow up like a pro.
* ️ **Organizational Excellence:** You can juggle multiple priorities without dropping the ball—whether it's planning outreach, logging customer notes in Salesforce, or coordinating an event.
* **Strategic Thinking:** You’re proactive in identifying opportunities, digging into data, and thinking three steps ahead to unlock growth.
* **Tech Comfort:** You’re familiar with CRMs (Salesforce), POS systems, and productivity tools like Google Suite.
* **Team Collaboration:** You thrive in a fast\-paced, cross\-functional environment and love partnering with others to drive results.
* **Education:** Bachelor’s degree required.
* **Flexible Availability:** Able to work full\-time, including peak business hours, to support the needs of B2B customers in\-store.
* **Ability to Travel:** You will be required to travel locally as needed to meet with customers, businesses, or partners. Typically this will fall within a 50\-mile radius.

  


**Additional Physical and Environmental Requirements:**


* **Physical Activity:**Frequent standing, walking, and reaching with hands and arms; occasional sitting, climbing, balancing, and crawling.
* **Mobility \& Movement:** Frequent stooping, kneeling, and crouching throughout the day.
* **Lifting Ability:** Must be able to lift and/or move up to 50 lbs regularly.
* **Vision Requirements:** Includes close, distance, color, and peripheral vision; depth perception and the ability to adjust focus.
* ️ **Temperature Flexibility:** Comfortable in environments with varying temperature conditions.
* **Noise Tolerance:** Occasional exposure to moderate noise levels and physical activity.
* + ️ **Safety Awareness:** Minimal exposure to workplace or environmental hazards—must adhere to all safety protocols.

  

**What are the Benefits\*?**


* **Competitive Pay:** Earn competitive compensation, with regular opportunities for performance\-based increases and performance based bonuses.
* **Career Growth:** Access professional development and advancement opportunities to help you grow with us.
* **Health Benefits from Day One:** Medical, dental, and vision insurance coverage starts on your first day.
* **Time to Recharge:** Start accruing paid time off immediately—because work\-life balance matters.
* **401(k) with Company Match:** We’ll match up to 4% to help you plan for your future.
* **Tuition Reimbursement:** Eligible after 6 months of employment—learn, grow, and get support along the way.
* **Wayfair Employee Discount:** Save big on the pieces you love—plus get 10% off at our in\-store restaurant ️.
* **Parental Leave Options:** Choose from paid and unpaid leave plans to support your growing family.
* ✨ **And So Much More:** We’ve got more good stuff where that came from! NOTE: our full\-time roles receive the full benefits package above, while part\-time or seasonal team members may have modified offerings. Your recruiter or in\-store team can help with any questions!

 **About Wayfair Inc.**



Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry\-leading technology and creative problem\-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. title: Wayfair Outlet Assistant Store Manager
description:
**Wayfair Outlet Assistant Store Manager**


**The position is based in Chandler, AZ**



Come join the team that is reinventing home! Wayfair is hiring an Assistant Store Manager for our returns Outlet retail store! If you are looking for rapid growth, constant learning and dynamic challenges, Wayfair’s Outlet store might be the future home for your career.


**What you’ll do:**


* As an authentic brand ambassador for the Wayfair family, lead and create a best in class customer experience by connecting them with the world's biggest and best home online assortment brought to life in our stores.
* Assist the Store Manager in bringing the Wayfair brand family to life by building a high performing customer centric team, and actively linking them in an authentic way to all channels.
* Lead and develop a team of Sales Associates to meet sales goals
* Master our brand story and be able to share our brand with polished communication, personal appearance and professionalism.
* Consistently recruit, hire, and retain a salesforce that delights and inspires our customers while driving sales.
* Build a talent pipeline, both internal and external, to deliver budgeted sales and best in class customer experience
* Build schedules that allow for best in class customer service, meet all operational business requirements and are fair and balanced for associates.
* Maintain leadership presence through effective floor management and resource allocation.
* Identify customers’ needs, and balance with operational requirements to meet customer experience standards.
* Perform opening and closing routines and provide supervision to ensure the store is meeting financial goals and associates are providing best in class service to our customers.
* Foster and instill a culture of accountability and continuous feedback to promote a profitable, positive, and dynamic environment.
* Assist the Store Manager in leading a team to always use good judgment; demonstrate a culture of ethical conduct, security, and compliance.
* Ensure the team feels supported and inspired daily; Treat all personnel internally and externally with respect, empathy, and inclusion.

* Participate in operational store activities as needed: bringing new products to the floor, floor sets, replenishment, substitutions and general store upkeep.

* Identify the most efficient way to complete assigned tasks and asks clarifying questions when appropriate.
* Able to read and comprehend English to ensure your safety and the safety of those working around you.
* Be cross trained in other departments and required to perform additional responsibilities as assigned

* Minimum 6 months of cherry picker experience required. Must be comfortable with heights (40ft)
* Must be comfortable repeatedly lifting up to 75 lbs. unassisted and moving product 150\+ lbs. unassisted or via team lift.
* Must be able to work on warehouse floor 8 hours a day or more.
* Strong, consistent work ethic.
* Comfort with scanning technology.

title: Senior Analyst, WFUS Email Marketing
description:
* **At this time, Wayfair does not provide sponsorship for employment authorization for this position.**


**Senior Analyst, WFUS Email Marketing**



The Wayfair US CRM team is responsible for all email, app push, and SMS communications between Wayfair and our customers. Within this team, the Acquisitions Sr. Analyst role will sit under the WFUS Email team and report to the Email Lead. The role will own our customer acquisition workstream, partnering heavily with our partners on Storefront Martech and Performance Marketing, and be responsible for driving engagement, retention, and reactivation of our new and unengaged customers, primarily through partnering heavily with Creative.



If you have a background in growth or retention marketing, a passion for providing customers with engaging and cutting\-edge creative content, and experience with testing and learning then this is the role for you!


**What You'll Do**



You’ll have 2 primary responsibilities: i) driving email acquisitions and ii) improving our engagement metrics with non\-in\-market customers.


* Own email list size, being responsible for driving our aggressive goal of 10% growth by end of year.
	+ Partner closely with our on\-site PMs to increase acquisition rate through new and improved experiences and ideate and launch creative testing through our new self\-service tool to increase capture rates.
	+ Build an automated dashboard to measure the free channel value by acquisition source and partner with performance marketing teams to optimize their spend towards highest\-value sources.
	+ Lead efforts to reactivate lapsed customers and reduce unsubscribes through creating better and more enjoyable content for our customers.

Be one of 2 analysts focusing on improving our upper\-funnel email marketing, being responsible for driving our goal of 5% increase in free channel traffic by end of year.* Be the sole owner of email performance for our Newly Acquired email segment, identifying gaps in our customer experience and ideating and launching A/B tests to improve that experience.
	+ Partner heavily with Creative to test into new email content, focused on inspiring and building affinity with low\-intent customers, surfacing things like seasonal updates, viral trends, recipes, shopping guides, quizzes, etc.
	+ Take a scrappy, test\-and\-iterate approach to trying new ideas, building out our knowledge playbook of what works and does not work.
	+ Identify and create new targeted audience campaigns to engage niche customers with relevant content.
	+ Find new and improved ways to display our products in a way that is inspirational and brand\-forward.

**What You’ll Need**


* Bachelor’s degree in Business, Economics, the Sciences, or other concentrations with a quantitative focus.
* 4\+ years of experience ideally in a growth or retention marketing role. Experience with email marketing is not required.
* Proven results in taking a data\-driven approach to creating engaging content for customers and/or acquiring new customers.
* Basic SQL and Google Sheets/Excel knowledge.
* An interest in getting inside the head of the customer–to understand how they think, what their needs are, what motivates them–and tailor communications to them to build lasting, long\-term relationships with the brand.
* Experience partnering with Creative teams and performance/growth marketing teams.
* Excellent critical thinking and verbal and written communication skills.
* Ability to independently own and execute on solutions to complex problems.
* Ability to handle multiple priorities, learn quickly, and thrive in a fast\-paced environment.
* A desire to win as a team \- collaborative team player who wants to see themselves and others succeed and thrive.


**This is a hybrid position located in our Boston HQ. M\-Th are in office, Fridays are remote.**

**About Wayfair Inc.**



Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry\-leading technology and creative problem\-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If you’re looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then you’ll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking.

title: GL Inventory Control Associate
description:
***The pay for this position is $20\.00/hr***


We are Wayfair; we deliver a best\-in\-class customer experience in the furniture and home space because of people like you, who are driven, motivated, determined, collaborative, and thrive in a fast\-paced environment. In order to maintain our high level of delivery standards and meet our customer’s needs, the Wayfair Inventory team plays a key role in improving customer satisfaction and driving repeat business. We lead by example and set the standards high. We teach and educate our operations partners in our processes. We’ve been busy building a best\-in\-class logistics network that allows us to delight customers by speeding up deliveries, adding services, maintaining our inventory and reducing damage using our own physical, asset\-based warehouses. We are looking for talented hard\-working individuals to join our growing team – your professional home awaits you at Wayfair

**Shift**

* Wednesday \- Saturday 6:00am \- 4:30pm

**Benefits (Start Day 1!)**

* Referral bonuses
* Overtime hours \& pay
* 401(k) with company match
* Wayfair company discount
* Benefits start day one
* Growth opportunities (Conversions, Promotions, and more!)
* Dozens of discounts and perks with partners

**What You'll Do**  

* Responsible for the integrity and accuracy of all inventories by performing daily audits and maintaining a comprehensive Cycle Count program. Lead by example.
* Maintain accurate inventory levels through daily and monthly cycle counts and annual year\-end physical inventories
* Own the entire life cycle of damaged, misplaced, or missing products from the time the exception is detected to the resolution of the issue
* Collect bad status items, ticket the items, and then release the items back into the inventory once resolved
* Track and report daily to upper management building capacity, building utilization, inventory accuracy and cycle count progress
* Use Warehouse Management Software and Excel to sort through cycle count data
* Additional job duties as assigned

**What You'll Need**

* At least 1 year of experience with cycle counts
* Basic to intermediate computer skills including Outlook, Excel and Word
* Ability to deal with problems involving several concrete variables in standardized situations
* Ability to communicate and work well with people of all levels
* Ability to work well under pressure in fast paced environment
* Warehouse Management Software and data entry experience
* Must be able to work on warehouse floor 8 hours a day or more

title: Senior Associate, Carrier Management
description:
**Carrier Management Senior Associate**



Wayfair is growing leaps and bounds, and we want to ensure our customers have an amazing experience when they receive their items. We’re looking for a thoughtful, curious, data\- and people\-oriented whiz to join our team. You will drive operational excellence and strong processes in our delivery network by leading and managing the performance of a select portfolio of strategic carrier partners.



We are looking for an individual with an entrepreneurial spirit and deep passion for transportation and supply chain to help drive this strategic initiative for the company. This candidate must be able to thrive in an extremely fast\-paced environment. This is a highly visible and exciting role for the company and one that will offer the right candidate an opportunity to reshape one of our core operational functions.


**Who we are:**



The North American Carrier Management team manages all of Wayfair’s transportation and delivery partners across North America. We strive to continually delight our customers by providing the most transparent, reliable, and professional delivery experience in the industry. We believe in repeatable, scalable, data and process driven management while embracing Wayfair’s entrepreneurial creative and fun atmosphere.

  


**What you will do:**


* Forge strong relationships with a portfolio of Small Parcel Carrier Partners understanding their businesses from operations, administration, and finance to drive a best in class customer experience. Work collaboratively with these partners to identify areas for focus and jointly improve their performance.
* Conduct daily/weekly/monthly calls with carrier partners to review key performance indicators
* Travel 10\-15% to meet with carrier partners and fulfillment sites for performance reviews, strategic planning and training.
* Embrace a consulting and partnership mentality to collaborate with carrier partners to thrive within their region.
* Understand and utilize an advanced reporting suite to keep partners updated on multiple key metrics.
* Proactively identify critical markets and work with internal teams to get ahead of performance issues.
* Be a thought leader around operational improvement opportunities.
* Become an expert in multiple modes of transportation, industry best practices, and technology.
* Partner with multiple teams within Wayfair to improve overall operations of the carrier network.

  


**The ideal candidate has:**


* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience.
* Relevant experience in a field that involves using data and working closely with people.
* Experience in logistics, carrier management or transportation operations is a plus, but not required.
* Ability to manage and drive and prioritize projects, while leading cross functional teams and stakeholders.
* Strong interpersonal and relationship building skills. Proven ability to work successfully with and across teams. Able to build relationships and provide concise updates at all levels in the organization.
* Strong leadership ability. A hands\-on analyst and team player that can inspire/mentor staff members.

**About Wayfair Inc.**



Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry\-leading technology and creative problem\-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If you’re looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then you’ll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking.



No matter who you are, Wayfair is a place you can call home. title: Community Events Specialist, Full-Time
description:
Office Location: 3232 Lake Ave Suite 1, Wilmette, IL 60091

  


**Compensation:** $24 per hour

  


**Overview:**

  

As a **Community Event Specialist** for Wayfair Stores, you’ll bring our brand to life through engaging, community\-focused events that drive customer traffic and local awareness. Reporting to the Sr. Manager of People Operations, you’ll lead event execution from supplier demos to community gatherings while ensuring seamless logistics and staffing. Beyond events, you’ll support in\-store promotions, events, and visual merchandising to keep the store environment fresh and inviting. This role is your chance to own how Wayfair connects with customers and communities through memorable experiences.

  


**What Does an Event Specialist Do?**


* **Event Support \& Execution:** Lead and deliver engaging in\-store and external community events that boost brand visibility and drive foot traffic.
* **Logistics Management:** Coordinate setup, breakdown, staffing, and vendor needs to ensure smooth, successful events.
* **Customer Engagement:** Serve as the main contact during events, answering questions and ensuring a positive experience and impression of Wayfair.
* **Promotional Oversight:** Manage distribution and tracking of promotional materials and coupons accurately.
* **Content Creation Instincts:** You should have an eye for visually compelling moments and know what resonates online. You will capture and help create engaging social media content in partnership with the Marketing team. *(If you have examples or a portfolio of previous content or creations, that’s a huge plus!)*
* **Cross\-Functional Collaboration:** Work closely with leadership, store support teams, and People Operations to align event goals with business priorities.
* ️ **In\-Store Support:** Assist with visual merchandising and promotional displays during non\-event periods to keep the store fresh and inviting.
  


**You’ll Thrive in This Role if You Have:**


* **Relevant Experience:** 1\-2 years in event execution, hospitality, community engagement, or customer\-facing roles.
* **Strong Organization:** Skilled at managing event logistics and leading staff from start to finish.
* **Team Leadership:** Experience directing small teams and coordinating vendors during fast\-paced events.
* **Excellent Communication:** Confidence in engaging new and existing customers, partners, and senior leaders with warmth and clarity.
* **Creative Problem\-Solving:** Detail\-oriented with a passion for people, events, and delivering exceptional customer experiences.
* + **Self\-Starter Attitude:** Independent, adaptable, and energized by fast\-moving, high\-impact environments.
* **Expert in “Mobile” Photography:** You’ve got an eye for great shots and know how to make everyday moments pop on camera—using just your phone. Clean, well\-composed, scroll\-stopping photos? *That’s your thing.*
* **Flexible Availability:** Willing to work nights, weekends, and holidays to support event and store needs.
* **Travel Readiness:** Comfortable with up to 50% travel, typically within a 50\-mile radius, to support events and community engagements.
  


**Additional Physical and Environmental Requirements:**


* **Physical Activity:**Frequent standing, walking, and reaching with hands and arms; occasional sitting, climbing, balancing, and crawling.
* **Mobility \& Movement:** Frequent stooping, kneeling, and crouching throughout the day.
* **Lifting Ability:** Must be able to lift and/or move up to 50 lbs regularly.
* **Vision Requirements:** Includes close, distance, color, and peripheral vision; depth perception and the ability to adjust focus.
* ️ **Temperature Flexibility:** Comfortable in environments with varying temperature conditions.
* **Noise Tolerance:** Occasional exposure to moderate noise levels and physical activity.
* + ️ **Safety Awareness:** Minimal exposure to workplace or environmental hazards—must adhere to all safety protocols.

  

**What are the Benefits\*?**


* **Competitive Pay:** Earn competitive compensation with regular opportunities for performance\-based increases.
* **Career Growth:** Access professional development and advancement opportunities to help you grow with us.
* **Health Benefits from Day One:** Medical, dental, and vision insurance coverage starts on your first day.
* **Time to Recharge:** Start accruing paid time off immediately—because work\-life balance matters.
* **401(k) with Company Match:** We’ll match up to 4% to help you plan for your future.
* **Tuition Reimbursement:** Eligible after 6 months of employment—learn, grow, and get support along the way.
* **Wayfair Employee Discount:** Save big on the pieces you love—plus get 10% off at our in\-store restaurant ️.
* **Parental Leave Options:** Choose from paid and unpaid leave plans to support your growing family.
* ✨ **And So Much More:** We’ve got more good stuff where that came from! Our full\-time roles receive the full benefits package, while part\-time or seasonal team members may have modified offerings. Your recruiter or in\-store team can help with any questions!

**About Wayfair Inc.**



Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry\-leading technology and creative problem\-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If you’re looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then you’ll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking.



No matter who you are, Wayfair is a place you can call home. We’re a community of innovators, risk\-takers, and trailblazers who celebrate our differences, and know that our unique perspectives make us stronger, smarter, and well\-positioned for success. We value and rely on the collective voices of our employees, customers, community, and suppliers to help guide us as we build a better Wayfair – and world – for all. Every voice, every perspective matters. That’s why we’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, genetic information, or any other legally protected characteristic.

title: Mattress Sales Specialist
description:
**ROLE:** Mattress Category Sales Specialist

  

**Overview:**  

We are seeking highly motivated sales professionals with a strong technical background to join our category sales team, specializing in the Mattress market. In this role, you'll leverage your expertise to drive exceptional sales results through meaningful customer interactions. Your ability to understand and communicate complex product features will be key in helping customers make informed purchasing decisions and achieve your sales goals. If you love to connect with customers and help them find and purchase amazing products, then Wayfair may be the perfect place for the next steps in your career!  

  

**Quick Highlights:**


* ***Full\-Time Position***
* ***Compensation: $16/hour \+*** *Monthly Bonus* potential
* ***\*Weekends Required\****


**Schedules are subject to change periodically**


***Note:*** **This is a remote Sales specific role, and is NOT Customer Service based.**

  

**What Does a Category Sales Specialist Do?**


* **Grow and Leverage Sales Expertise:** Use your deep product knowledge and strong sales skills to help Wayfair customers navigate purchases within the applicable category.
* **Meet a High Performance Bar:** Meet or exceed your monthly revenue, calls per day targets, and/or other established KPIs in alignment with business expectations.
* **Influence Sales**: Utilize and expand your skills in selling products in a high growth and technical category through creative offerings and impactful initiatives.
* **Engage Customers**: You will communicate with inbound customers as well as outbound follow ups for specialized category sales inquiries, working to create a positive customer experience from start to finish.
* **Adapt to Rapid Change:** Engage in a high\-energy, focused, and dynamic work environment where there can be quick pivots in our products, promotions, offerings, and operations.
* **Collaborate Effectively:** You’ll bring a willingness to share your innovative ideas and solutions to help make Wayfair a first in class customer experience.
* **Continuously Learn**: Grow through Wayfair’s world class training and continuous career development opportunities You’ll be trained on our offerings, software, processes and supplier capabilities.
* **Act as a Brand Ambassador:** Embody the Wayfair People Principles as a North Star in all your work to provide a first class customer experience. Exemplify a positive and professional attitude on a daily basis with customers and your team members.

  


**What are the Requirements?**


* **Sales Experience:** 1 \- 3 years of previous sales experience with demonstrated success in meeting or exceeding KPI’s or performance metrics. (*Previous technical category sales experience is highly preferred.)*
* **Category Knowledge:** sales knowledge, strong business acumen, and ability to use your expertise to assist customers through their purchasing needs.
* **Adaptability:** You must have a willingness to adapt and grow in a fast paced, high growth industry.
* **Technical Proficiency**: Comfort with learning new tools or systems and previous experience with Google, Microsoft office or other email platforms, video conferencing, multiple screens, spreadsheets, etc.
* **Internet Speed Requirements**: Ability to maintain internet speeds of 25mbps (download) and 5\+ (upload) to support voice traffic and HTTPS web traffic. You must be hardwired, no wifi permitted.
* **Training:** Wayfair wants to ensure your success, this is why our sales training is 100% mandatory. We are unable to accommodate any absences, time off, or tardiness during this initial time frame.
* **Private Workspace:** This is a work from home position where you will be working virtually. A private and dedicated workspace free of any distractions (roommates, children, spouses, pets, etc.) or noise (radio, tv, etc.) Wayfair will provide the equipment needed.
* **Education:** Bachelor’s degree or college diploma equivalent is **preferred,** but not required.
* **Effective Communications:** Strong command of written and verbal communications to drive your performance.
* **Multitasking Ability**: Capable of handling multiple conversations or customers simultaneously while maintaining an excellent customer experience.

  

  

**What are the Benefits?**


* **Insurance**: Wayfair offers Health, Dental, and Vision Insurances starting on Day 1!
* **Time Off Options:** You will start accruing PTO immediately, 7 paid federal holidays, 1 floating holiday, paid/unpaid parental leave options, and more.
* **401(k)**: Wayfair offers 401k savings with company match up to 4%.
* **Employee Discount**: You’ll receive a dynamic Wayfair discount for use on items you wish to purchase for your own space.
* **Bonuses:** There will be bonus incentives based on performance against sales metrics
* **Sales Contests**: SPIFFs and contests for additional earning potential
* **Tuition Reimbursement:** Full\-Time Employees who have worked at Wayfair for at least six months are eligible to receive tuition reimbursement for pre\-approved courses from an accredited, post\-secondary institution up to a maximum of $5,250 per year.
* **Referral Bonus:** Know great talent? Wayfair offers a referral bonus for each of your eligible referrals that are hired ($500 per eligible referral)
* **Collaborative and Inclusive Environment**: Enjoy a collaborative work environment and team culture.

 **About Wayfair Inc.**



Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry\-leading technology and creative problem\-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If you’re looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then you’ll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking.



No matter who you are, Wayfair is a place you can call home. We’re a community of innovators, risk\-takers, and trailblazers who celebrate our differences, and know that our unique perspectives make us stronger, smarter, and well\-positioned for success. We value and rely on the collective voices of our employees, customers, community, and suppliers to help guide us as we build a better Wayfair – and world – for all. Every voice, every perspective matters. That’s why we’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, genetic information, or any other legally protected characteristic.



Your personal data is processed in accordance with our Candidate Privacy Notice (https://www.wayfair.com/careers/privacy). If you have any questions or wish to exercise your rights under applicable privacy and data protection laws, please contact us at dataprotectionofficer@wayfair.com.

title: Bath and Kitchen Sales Department Supervisor
description:
**Brief Overview of Position**



Perigold, the destination for luxury home, is opening its first physical retail stores, first\-of\-their\-kind luxury retail destinations of 20\-30K square feet, with the best products in all styles and from across our catalog including furniture, decor, housewares, and home improvement categories. Come be a part of it! We are looking for a Sales Department Supervisor who will lead a sales team of product specialists for a major Department within the store. This role will work closely with the in\-store Design team and report directly into the Assistant Store Manager \- Sales. If you are passionate about luxury and/or design, looking for rapid growth, and thrive on constant learning and dynamic challenges, this might be the perfect fit for you.

  


**What you’ll do**


* Maintain luxury experience standards by providing an authentic, inviting guest experience that exemplifies our commitment to customer satisfaction and passion for luxury design.
* Collaborate with General Contractors on bath and kitchen design implementation in client spaces.
* Understand and deliver on the compatibility of appliances within client spaces.
* Work with the Assistant Store Manager \- Sales to attract, hire, coach, and retain top\-performing talent for the Sales team, in alignment with business priorities and cultural norms.
* With direct reports, be a strong visible presence in the designated work area to drive sales and strong guest service.
* Provide brand and product information to support guest purchase inquiries.
* Support store leaders in development and execution of training to build product specialist team knowledge of our product, selling, guest service, operations, visual, and other aspects of their roles. .
* Deliver against individual and team sales and service KPIs, productivity standards and store goals.
* Collaborate with the Design team, generating and referring leads as appropriate or supporting product inquiries coming from the design process.
* Lead the use of design tools, CRM software and client accounts for consistent guest experience and record keeping.
* Master selling essentials, sales analytics tools, and other training resources to educate the team on our wide array of product assortment.
* Manage and monitor stock levels, merchandise adjacencies, presentations, signing, and assortment in all departments to ensure the sales\-floor is adequately stocked. Maintain visual standards of the store, per home office directive.
* Work with the Guest Experience team to ensure the store meets visual, replenishment, cleanliness, safety and back of house standards during floor leadership shifts.
* Engage in a high energy and dynamic work environment where there can be rapid changes in products, promotions, offerings and operations.
* Perform key holder and Manager On Duty duties.

  


**What you’ll need**


*Experience \& Qualifications*

* 2\-5 years experience motivating a team to achieve sales goals (preferably as a store Leader or Trainer)
* Experience in Bath \& Kitchen design/sales.
* Understanding of luxury plumbing and bathroom design.
* Experience with appliance fitting and specifications.
* Passion for great customer service and a drive to exceed sales targets.
* Strong organization, self\-motivation, communication and relationship management skills
* An ability to handle customer escalations and demonstrate professional maturity.
* Ability to learn details of a vast product catalog.
* Demonstrated ability to work within a team sales environment.
* Technical acumen to learn necessary software; proficiency in Google Suites and/or Microsoft Office applications preferred.
* Track record of thriving in a fast paced and changing environment, with an ability to adapt and grow.
* Flexibility availability (including mornings, nights, weekends, some holidays).

***Physical Demands***
----------------------


* While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to stand, walk, talk and hear. The employee frequently is required to handle, or feel and reach with hands and arms. The employee is occasionally required to sit; regularly climb or balance; and frequently stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must regularly, frequently or occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 lbs
* Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.

  


**Compensation \& Benefits**


* Compensation starting at $xx.xx per hour, which increases based on your relevant experience \+ substantial quarterly bonuses
* Medical benefits, financial benefits, and a generous employee discount

  


**About Perigold**



Perigold is the destination for luxury home. Established in 2017, Perigold offers an unmatched selection of the world’s best design brands, with unique pieces for every style and space. The brand offers the highest quality pieces for home, backed by a quality guarantee and expert concierge support. They also offer free white\-glove delivery and 30\-day returns on most items. Headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts, Perigold is part of the Wayfair Inc. (NYSE:W) brand portfolio.

  



Your personal data is processed in accordance with our Candidate Privacy Notice (https://www.wayfair.com/careers/privacy). If you have any questions or wish to exercise your rights under applicable privacy and data protection laws, please contact us at dataprotectionofficer@wayfair.com.

  


**Assistance for Individuals with Disabilities**



Wayfair is fully committed to providing equal opportunities for all individuals, including individuals with disabilities. As part of this commitment, Wayfair will make reasonable accommodations to the known physical or mental limitations of qualified individuals with disabilities, unless doing so would impose an undue hardship on business operations. If you require a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

  


**Need Assistance?**



For more information about applying for a career at Wayfair, visit our FAQ page here.


**Compensation \& Benefits**


* Compensation starting at $23\.00 per hour
* Medical benefits, financial benefits, and a generous employee discount

 **About Wayfair Inc.**



Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry\-leading technology and creative problem\-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. Every voice, every perspective matters. That’s why we’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer. title: Analytics Manager, Speed & Reliability
description:
**Must be ONSITE in Boston, MA (Monday \- Thursday)**


***You must be authorized to work in the United States without visa sponsorship by Wayfair now or in the future.***



The **Global Promise \& Speed** team is seeking a highly analytical, action\-oriented, and collaborative Manager to help drive improvements across Wayfair’s delivery network. In this role, you will transform complex business challenges into actionable insights and data\-driven solutions that influence key operational outcomes. The ideal candidate is equally comfortable with deep data analysis and stakeholder engagement, capable of crafting a compelling narrative from both quantitative and qualitative inputs.



The **Global Promise and Speed** team within Transportation \& Delivery is responsible for improving the actual speed of Wayfair’s delivery to customers while ensuring that orders arrive on time. To do so, we leverage an end\-to\-end view of the supply chain and an intensive handling of data to identify key opportunity areas, build business cases, and work with partners in Operations on implementation. Further, we work closely with Tech teams to design and deploy new capabilities that evolve our capabilities and improve our ability to deliver Speed cost\-efficiently.


**What You'll Do**


* Manage a team of analyst(s) to lead improvements in the speed of our large parcel network, both in North America and the UK.
* Leverage a deep understanding of Wayfair’s supply chain network to design new initiatives aimed at improving our speed and/or capabilities.
* Perform analysis across large data sets to gain performance insights, highlight operational opportunities, and develop targeted action plans.
* Leverage critical thinking and data handling to examine and challenge existing practices, identify opportunities for improvement, and gain buy\-in from stakeholders on proposals.
* Collaborate with cross\-functional partners in Operations and Tech to support the rollout of new operational initiatives and/or tech capabilities.
* Build dashboards to translate large data sets into driving insights and action.
* Monitor KPIs and assess how we’re making progress against business objectives.


**What You'll Need**


* Master's and/or Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Supply Chain, Data Analytics, or similar quantitative fields.
* Advanced experience with GBQ or SQL, Microsoft Excel or Google Sheets, and data visualization tools such as Google Data Studio (Looker, Tableau, or PowerBI).
* Strong communication, and proven ability to work with cross functional partners to advance projects or objectives.
* Experience in managing an analytical team to drive business outcomes.
* High attention to detail and thorough attention to data integrity to deliver trusted insights.
* Ability to navigate an environment of continuous improvement working through ambiguity in a fast\-paced environment.
* Experience in Supply Chain and/or E\-Commerce is a plus.

  


**An Important Note about Wayfair's In\-Office Policy:** All Boston\-based interns, Co\-ops, and corporate employees will be in office in a hybrid capacity. Employees will work in the office on designated days, Monday \- Thursday, and work remotely Friday.


**Massachusetts Applicants**: I understand that it is unlawful in Massachusetts to require or administer a lie detector test as a condition of employment or continued employment. An employer who violates this law shall be subject to criminal penalties and civil liability.


***At this time, Wayfair will not sponsor applicants for employment authorization for this position for the following work visas: F1\-OPT, STEM OPT EAD, H\-1B, H\-1B1, E\-3, O\-1, J\-1, or TN.***

title: Tax Senior Associate
description:
*This position is a hybrid in\-office role that works out of our Headquarters in Boston, MA (this role is not a virtual / remote position).*



Wayfair’s Finance group is looking for a Tax Senior Associate to join our tax team! This role will be part of the global tax team within the Wayfair Finance Department, and it will be based on our Boston office. This role is an excellent opportunity for a professional with a strong foundation in federal and state tax compliance to contribute to the tax function. The successful candidate will play a key role in the team, gaining exposure to many areas of tax.



The Tax team at Wayfair is responsible for the global corporate tax and transfer pricing compliance, strategically planning to minimize tax burdens, and diligently managing associated risks. Reporting directly to the Senior Tax Manager, the Tax Senior Associate will be responsible for state and federal tax returns and extension filings, preparing income tax provisions, and assisting with tax audits. Members of this team work closely with various other teams and departments and this role requires someone who has strong tax technical knowledge and good communication skills. This role will give exposure to different areas of tax, and if you are someone with a passion for tax and learning, this could be the role for you!


**What You'll Do**


* Prepare and manage U.S. federal and state income tax filings and estimated payments, ensuring compliance with evolving tax laws and deadlines.
* Assist in the preparation of quarterly and annual income tax provisions in accordance with ASC 740, supporting timely and accurate financial reporting.
* Support income tax audits by preparing documentation, responding to inquiries, and coordinating with external advisors and auditors.
* Partner with internal stakeholders and external auditors to ensure compliance with Sarbanes\-Oxley (SOX) requirements and maintain accurate, audit\-ready tax records.
* Contribute to ad\-hoc tax projects, including research and analysis of tax law changes, business initiatives, and cross\-functional planning efforts.
* Leverage technology and automation tools to improve tax processes and enhance operational efficiency in a dynamic, high\-growth environment.


**What You'll Need**


* A bachelor’s degree in commerce, accounting, taxation or a related field.
* 4\+ years’ experience in public or private accounting, working in the tax department.
* Experience with federal and state tax compliance with a strong technical background.
* Experience working with ONESOURCE tax provision software, or an equivalent tax provision software system.
* Masters in taxation or CPA is preferred but not required.


**Benefits \& Perks**


* Full health benefits available (Medical, Dental, Vision, HSA/FSA) on day one for eligible employees.
* No\-cost access to 2nd.MD, a virtual expert medical consultation and navigation service.
* Global Traveler Health Insurance through GeoBlue.
* 24/7 access to mental, financial, physical and emotional wellbeing support, plus an enhanced offering of therapy and coaching.
* Automatic enrollment into Basic Life and Accidental Death \& Disability Insurance.
* 401(k) matching with immediate vesting.
* Paid Parental Leave, Surrogacy \& Adoption Reimbursement and Caregiver Services.
* Tuition Reimbursement.
* Wayfair Employee Discount.
* Gym/Fitness Discounts (including Peloton, Wellhub and varying regional memberships).
* Exclusive access to thousands of perks \& discounts through BenefitHub.
* Yearly match up to $500 for personal donations made by employees to registered 501(c)(3\) nonprofits.

**About Wayfair Inc.**



Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry\-leading technology and creative problem\-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. No matter who you are, Wayfair is a place you can call home. title: Machine Learning Engineer III
description:
**Who We Are:**



Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for home goods. To deliver an exceptional customer experience at scale, we rely heavily on machine learning and AI systems that power everything from delivery date prediction to multi\-modal systems for visual diagnostics to agentic workflow automation.



As an ML Engineer within the Supply Chain and Retail Tech AI org, you’ll be at the forefront of transforming Wayfair Supply Chain and Support operations by developing robust, reliable and production\-grade ML and AI systems. You will work closely with ML scientists to launch highly impactful and scalable ML models leveraging modern MLOps best practice and tools. You will drive significant business impact by designing and building complex Multi\-modal and Agentic AI systems that are revolutionizing the way the industry operates.



Here are some of the key projects our team works on:


* Vision\-LLM: Gen AI model for automating visual diagnostics and resolution for product refund
* Customer Service Co\-Pilot and Agentic workflow automation: Blog
* Delivery Date Prediction: Scalable Quantile Regression model that balances faster promise vs reliability: Blog
* Personalization: Uplift model for predicting the effectiveness of different customer service policy


**What You’ll Do:**


* Build and own ML production systems for both real\-time and batch inference, ensuring scalability, reliability, observability, and low latency.
* Lead ML service integration with partner systems by establishing ownership boundaries, API contracts, clear SLAs, and fallback mechanisms
* Architect and build complex multi\-modal and Agentic AI systems by leveraging the latest advancement in LLM
* Collaborate with ML Scientists to build reusable and scalable production\-grade training code and pipelines using modern MLOps practices and infrastructure (GCP and open source)


**We Are a Match Because You Have:**


* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related technical field or equivalent practical experience
* 5\+ years of relevant industry experience, preferably including previous experience in ML infrastructure or AI/ML engineering
* Strong programming skills in Python and experience with production\-quality codebases
* Experience with cloud platforms (preferably GCP), containerization (Docker), orchestration (Kubernetes), and CI/CD workflows. Familiarity with monitoring and observability tools (e.g., Datadog).
* Able to work autonomously in cross\-functional teams, communicate clearly with ML scientists and software engineers, and balance engineering quality with business impact. Comfortable leading technical discussions and driving alignment without formal authority.


**Nice to Have:**


* Proven experience deploying and integrating ML/AI models into production systems
* Familiarity with MLOps and AIOps practices and tools (e.g. data pipeline, model orchestration, feature store)
* Experience building RAG and agentic AI systems


**Why You will Love Working With Us**


* Fun team outings like kayaking the Charles and Boda Borg,
* Early adopters of new technology within Wayfair
* Hackathons to explore new ideas
* Time Off:
* + Paid Holidays
	+ Paid Time Off (PTO)
* Health \& Wellness:
* + Full Health Benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision, HSA/FSA)
	+ Life Insurance
	+ Disability Protection (Short Term \& Long Term Disability)
	+ Global Wellbeing: Gym/Fitness discounts (including US Peloton, Global ClassPass, and various regional gym memberships)
	+ Mental Health Support (Global Mental Health, Global Wayhealthy Recordings)
	+ Caregiver Services
* Financial Growth \& Security:
* + 401K Matching (Employee Matching Program)
	+ Tuition Reimbursement
	+ Financial Health Education (Knowledge of Financial Education \- KOFE)
	+ Tax Advantaged Accounts
* Family Support:
* + Family Planning Support
	+ Parental Leave
	+ Global Surrogacy \& Adoption Policy

* + Rewards \& Recognition
	+ Global Employee Anniversary Awards
	+ Paid Volunteer Work
* Unique Perks:
* + Employee Discount
	+ U.S. Bluebikes Membership
	+ Global Pod Outings
* Work/Life Balance:
* + Emphasizing a supportive \& flexible work environment that encourages a balance between personal and professional commitments

*Candidates for this position are to be based, or plan to relocate to Boston, and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements. Our teams are onsite in our Boston office Tuesday\-Thursday, and remote Monday and Friday.*

title: Machine Learning Scientist III
description:
**Who We Are:**



Wayfair is an online retail platform with the mission to enable everyone to live in a home they love. To do this, Wayfair builds and leverages cutting\-edge Machine Learning and AI products and we are looking for talented individuals to join us. You will join the Supply Chain and Retail Tech AI org within its Service, Supply Chain and Fraud AI team.. You will be part of a cross\-functional, collaborative team driving development of world\-class ML systems that drive real\-world impact.

* Delivery Date Prediction: Scalable Quantile Regression model that balances faster promise vs reliability (Blog)

* Vision\-LLM: Gen AI model for automating visual diagnostics and resolution for product refund

* Drive significant business impact by designing, building, and deploying large\-scale machine learning models balancing short\- and long\-term value

* Mentor junior ML Scientists

* Hands\-on experience deploying machine learning solutions into production.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills with an ability to influence cross\-functional teams and leadership

* Familiarity with GCP (or AWS, Azure), MLOps (feature store, MLflow etc) and orchestration tools (Kubeflow, Airflow)

title: Maintenance Mechanic 1
description:
***The pay for this position is $30\.25/hr***

  


We are Wayfair; we deliver a best\-in\-class customer experience in the furniture and home space because of people like you, who are driven, determined, collaborative, and thrive in a fast\-paced environment. In order to maintain our high level of delivery standards and meet our customer’s needs, the Wayfair Distribution team plays a key role in improving customer satisfaction and driving repeat business. We’ve been busy building a best\-in\-class logistics network that allows us to delight customers by speeding up deliveries, adding services, and reducing damage using our own physical, asset\-based warehouses. We are looking for talented hard\-working individuals to join our growing team – your professional home awaits you at Wayfair!



The Maintenance Mechanic I will be a highly self\-motivated, customer\-centric, team player which possesses basic carpentry, mechanical, electrical and janitorial experience to assist in day to day operations.


**Shift**


* Wed \- Sat. 6AM \- 4:30PM


**Benefits (Start Day 1!)**


* $2/hr Shift differential for hours worked between 6:00pm \- 6:00am
* Referral bonuses
* Overtime hours \& pay
* 401(k)
* Wayfair company discount
* Benefits start day one
* Growth opportunities (Conversions, Promotions, and more!)

 **What You’ll Do**


* Work with supervision to troubleshoot basic conveyor material handling systems, electrical, plumbing, mechanical, and fire protection systems
* Responsible for projects related to facilities as directed by the Supervisor
* Work regularly on aerial platform lifts, boom/snorkel lift, and powered industrial trucks (reach, order picker, stand up, pallet runners, stock chaser, etc.)
* Complete work orders, records, logs and other written or computer\-based documents
* Responsible for keeping and maintaining tools, supplies, and a clean, organized work area

  


**What You’ll Need**


* Minimum 1 year experience in industrial maintenance or relevant certification(s)
* Experience with basic carpentry including painting, drywall, cleaning and basic maintenance
* Proficient using hand \& power tools and electrical testing equipment including PLC systems
* Proficient using computer systems and CMMS software
* Experienced safely using warehouse equipment such as order pickers, pallet jacks, forklifts and aerial lifts
* Will be required to wear applicable personal protective equipment including arc flash protection and safety shoes
* Ability to regularly bend, lift, stretch, crawl and reach, engage in full manual dexterity in both hands and wrists and stand and walk for long periods
* Must be comfortable repeatedly lifting up to 75 lbs unassisted
* Ability to access all areas of the building by climbing ladders and gangways safely and without limitation
* Ability to work in a non\-climate controlled environment that can be noisy and have a low lighting levels
* Follow all company safety policies, procedures, and guidelines
* Ability to work independently, as part of a team and take direction
* Must be a safety conscious, motivated, detail oriented, self\-starter with a positive attitude
* Must be flexible on working hours and willing to work scheduled \& unscheduled overtime

title: Seasonal Transportation Specialist
description:
***The pay for this position is $22\.25/hr***  

  



We are Wayfair; we deliver a best\-in\-class customer experience in the furniture and home space because of people like you, who are driven, determined, collaborative, and thrive in a fast\-paced environment. In order to maintain our high level of delivery standards and meet our customer’s needs, the Wayfair Distribution team plays a key role in improving customer satisfaction and driving repeat business. We’ve been busy building a best\-in\-class logistics network that allows us to delight customers by speeding up deliveries, adding services, and reducing damage using our own physical, asset\-based warehouses. We are looking for talented hard\-working individuals to join our growing team – your professional home awaits you at Wayfair!



Transportation Specialists are responsible for inventory fidelity and back\-end warehouse support. Transportation Specialists ensure that POs are in their proper inventory states, leading to streamlined scheduling and delivery. Transportation Specialists are also responsible for reconciling exceptions, reverse logistics, and driver paperwork.


**Shift:** Tuesday \- Friday 6:00am \- 4:00pm and Saturday 6:00am \- 7:00am


**Benefits (Start Day 1!)**


* $1\.50/hr Shift differential for hours worked between 6:00pm \- 6:00am
* Referral bonuses
* Overtime hours \& pay
* 401(k) with company match with company match
* Wayfair company discount
* Growth opportunities (Conversions, Promotions, and more!)


**What You'll Do**


* Use Wayfair inventory systems and tools to ensure "perfect" orders run smoothly from receipt at the terminal to dispatching for delivery
* Identify exceptions such as damage, short shipments, mis shipments, overweight/oversized cartons, etc., and reconcile these issues, engaging Customer Service and other partner teams as needed
* Inventory freight returning after a missed or refused delivery, escalating reports of missing freight to terminal leadership
* Set up schedules for outgoing freight (returns, liquidation, donation, disposal) and maintain relationships with reverse logistics carriers
* Print any necessary paperwork for delivery teams, correcting any errors
* Write and distribute an "end of shift" report to all terminal staff and any necessary partner teams
* Provide feedback on processes and tools
* Support Customer Service and other partner teams in efforts to maintain high customer satisfaction


**What You'll Need**


* 2\+ years of relevant experience in a similar role
* Ability to lift 75\+ lbs to assist the warehouse team as needed
* Strong written and verbal communication skills with a strong customer\-centric approach
* Ability to multitask and navigate through various systems and tools
* Well organized and detail oriented
* Comfort with Microsoft Office and learning new technologies
* Proactive in identifying opportunities for improvement and driving solutions
* Experienced in Logistics or Transportation
* BA/BS preferred

title: Terminal Manager
description:
*The salary range for this position is $91,875 \- $101,325\* however, base pay offered may vary depending on location, job\-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Restricted stock units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the position offered.*



We are looking for a talented and driven Home Delivery Operations Terminal Manager to join us and lead our Kent Delivery Operations. You will lead a team of Supervisors, Associates/Specialists, and Driver Partners serving our customers in your delivery area.



We’ve been busy building a best\-in\-class logistics network that allows us to delight customers by speeding up deliveries, adding specialized services, and reducing damage.



Home Delivery Site Leader is a fantastic spot to start your Wayfair journey. We have ambitious plans for over the next 5 years, so opportunities for growth will be plentiful for those who want them!


**What You’ll Do**


* Assume full responsibility for the safety, customer experience, employee experience, quality, and cost of your Home Delivery Operation Terminal \- this is your site \- get excited to Be an Owner
* Provide inspirational leadership and guidance to your team of Wayfair Warehouse and Wayfair Transportation employees, inclusive of leaders and frontline staff
* Build a partnership with our Delivery Partners ensuring your operation has the needed outbound capacity and provides an exceptional home delivery customer experience
* Drive results for your building across a comprehensive and balanced set of performance metrics (e.g., Safety, Customer, Employee, Quality, Cost)
* Develop your people by relentlessly focusing on skill development and career pathing
* Collaborate with several core stakeholders and ensure your building has what it needs to be successful (e.g., Safety, Talent Mgt, Talent Acquisition, Transportation, Training, Workforce Planning, Technology, to name a few…)
* Champion change for your team \- we are always improving and we move fast


**What You'll Need**


* Ownership mentality and motivation to build the best team
* Strong leadership skills and ability to collaborate effectively with cross functional teams
* Ability to proactively identify opportunities and implement solutions; lean/six sigma a plus
* Comfort with delivery routing technologies/strategies and warehouse management systems
* Comfort with raw data sets as well as creating simple but useful templates in google sheets
* BA/BS in management, administration, supply chain, or customer service.
* 5\+ years working experience in fulfillment, distribution, home delivery or transportation
* Bilingual is a plus

* $2/hr Shift differential for hours worked between 6:00pm \- 6:00am
* Referral bonuses
* Overtime hours \& pay
* 401(k)
* Wayfair company discount
* Benefits start day one
* Growth opportunities (Conversions, Promotions, and more!)


**What You’ll Do**


* Work independently without supervision to troubleshoot all conveyor material handling systems, electrical, plumbing, mechanical, and fire protection systems
* Develop and execute plans to accomplish departmental and operational goals
* Design, layout, and reconfiguration of existing systems as necessary
* Utilize CMMS system to create, maintain and validate team’s work schedule and workflow
* Work regularly on aerial platform lifts, boom/snorkel lifts, and powered industrial trucks (reach, order picker, stand up, pallet runners, stock chaser, etc.)
* Mentor team members by motivating, providing guidance and direct feedback to help them achieve their goals, improve individual performance and seek out training opportunities on more technical functions
* Develop and maintain good working relationships across all levels of the organization
* Responsible for keeping and maintaining tools, supplies, and a clean, organized work area
* Will perform emergency repairs in high pressure circumstances

  


**What You’ll Need**

  



* Minimum 5\+ years experience in industrial maintenance and/or combined certification(s)
* Ability to lead, mentor and train team members
* Proficient reading and comprehending electrical schematics and using associated tools such as volt/ohm meter, etc. (120,240,480VAC, 24VDC)
* Ability to install, maintain, \& troubleshoot relay logic, ladder diagrams, control components, photo eyes, motor starters, relays, limit switches, proximity sensors, timers, solenoids, servo drives, frequency inverters, linear drives, and encoders
* Proficient using hand \& power tools and electrical testing equipment
* Advanced understanding of HMIs and PLC systems including verifying inputs and outputs and controls
* Experienced safely using warehouse equipment such as order pickers, pallet jacks, forklifts and aerial lifts
* Proficient using computer systems and CMMS software
* Will be required to wear applicable personal protective equipment including arc flash protection and safety shoes
* Ability to regularly bend, lift, stretch, crawl and reach, engage in full manual dexterity in both hands and wrists and stand and walk for long periods
* Must be comfortable repeatedly lifting up to 75 lbs unassisted
* Ability to access all areas of the building by climbing ladders and gangways safely and without limitation
* Ability to work in a non\-climate controlled environment that can be noisy and have a low lighting levels
* Follow all company safety policies, procedures, and guidelines
* Ability to work independently, as part of a team and take directions
* Must be a safety conscious, motivated, detail oriented, self\-starter with a positive attitude
* Must be flexible on working hours and willing to work scheduled \& unscheduled overtime


**Assistance for Individuals with Disabilities**  

Wayfair is fully committed to providing equal opportunities for all individuals, including individuals with disabilities. As part of this commitment, Wayfair will make reasonable accommodations to the known physical or mental limitations of qualified individuals with disabilities, unless doing so would impose an undue hardship on business operations. Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home.
