title: Signage Print Production Coordinator
description:
*This is a full\-time position (40 hours/week) based in our Boston office. Attendance in\-office is required Monday \- Thursday, Friday is WFH optional.*

  


**Who We Are:**



The Wayfair Visual Merchandising team is a multi\-talented group of strategic and innovative thinkers across many disciplines, partnering closely with cross functional leaders to catapult Wayfair into the leading destination for all things home by developing engaging advertising campaigns, next\-in\-class consumer experiences, and scalable brand systems.

  


**Job Description:**



Wayfair is seeking an experienced **Signage Print Production Coordinator** to join our team. The role will contribute to all aspects of the end to end creative development and production process supporting our Wayfair physical retail operations. This role includes many of the traditional aspects of experiential and event production, including interacting with a stable of external fabricators, juggling tight timelines, balancing budgets, and coordinating with field employees on delivery and installation. The Signage Print Production Coordinator must collaborate and partner closely with our creative, marketing and Physical Retail teams.



The ideal candidate will have a track record of success in retail print production or similar production, project management or production operations, and will demonstrate an ability to confidently manage a process and influence diverse teams to meet deadlines and collaborate toward a common goal. A strong operational orientation is key to success in this role, as is a keen eye for efficiency and a passion for process improvement.



Physical Retail is a new and growing team at Wayfair, so the Signage Print Production Coordinator will need to collaborate with all partner teams, championing the process up front, rolling it out across the teams, and continuing to optimize and pivot as we grow and scale. It will require flexibility and a scrappy, roll up the sleeves mentality to build out this new capability from the ground up. You’ll coordinate and deliver projects that support our existing stores’ seasonal floor sets in addition to projects that support Wayfair’s scaling expansion in Physical Retail. This role will focus on Wayfair and their Standalone Brands (SAB): AllModern, Birch Lane, Joss \& Main and Perigold.

  


**What You'll Do**:


*Primary responsibilities include, but are not limited to:*


* Develop and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders including: Visual Presentation, Brand Creative, Creative Operations, Marketing and Store Operations
* Facilitate excellent print production management as it relates to: time, cost and communication, ensuring vendor output matches Wayfair’s quality and service expectations
* Prioritize and complete multiple projects within competing deadlines with high level of organizational skills
* Review project financials: purchasing, billing and reconciliation; escalating budget risks in a timely and efficient manner.
* Maintain and update the vendor/supplier database and department budget (specific to visual creative services) and support execution and submission of purchase orders, invoices, etc.
* Monitor delivery and implementation of projects with Installation Manager within our Mock Store Locations or Physical Retail stores.
* Maintain and update communications to store teams accurately and adjust as needed.
* Support New Store Openings with launch kits and supplies.
* Project types such as: in\-store presentation displays, decorative props, non\-branded and branded elements and supplies are within the scope of this role.


**What You'll Need:**



Communication is key and you should be comfortable working in a fast\-paced technology and data\-driven business environment.



We are looking for individuals who have a proven track record in owning and driving major businesses/initiatives, managing teams and developing functions in environments such as:


* Print and Signage production \- including paper, cardstock, vinyl and dye sub
* Project Management
* Retail \- Big Box / Specialty
* Seasoned Retail Associate, with exposure to production experience
* Exposure to vendor management process
* Strong attention to detail and proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously
* Able to work efficiently and effectively within a dynamic, fast\-paced environment that’s constantly changing as Wayfair’s Physical Retail organization and fleet scales
* Proficiency to prioritize and manage multiple projects or tasks, with high adaptability to change if required
* Ability to unpack and simplify complex projects in an ambiguous and changing environment
* Evidence of “scrappy startup execution” and a “get it done” attitude when time is tight and stakes are high
* Ability to problem solve and pivot to the needs of the growing business
* Exceptional written, visual and verbal cross\-functional communication skills
* Affinity for and success networking within a large and growing organization
* 2\-3 years exposure to cross functional teams

* Exposure to print production and associated applications, Adobe Suite

title: Warehouse General Maintenance
description:
***The pay for this position is $24\.50/hr***

  

We are Wayfair; we deliver a best\-in\-class customer experience in the furniture and home space because of people like you, who are driven, determined, collaborative, and thrive in a fast\-paced environment. In order to maintain our high level of delivery standards and meet our customer’s needs, the Wayfair Distribution team plays a key role in improving customer satisfaction and driving repeat business. We’ve been busy building a best\-in\-class logistics network that allows us to delight customers by speeding up deliveries, adding services, and reducing damage using our own physical, asset\-based warehouses. We are looking for talented hard\-working individuals to join our growing team – your professional home awaits you at Wayfair!


The General Maintenance Laborer will be a highly self\-motivated, customer\-centric team player who supports the daily upkeep and safety of the facility. This role will operate key equipment, assist with basic maintenance tasks, and be responsible for maintaining a clean and orderly work environment.

**Shift**

* Sun\-Wed 7:00AM\-5:30PM


Benefits (Start Day 1!)  

$2/hr Shift differential for hours worked between 6:00pm \- 6:00am  

Referral bonuses  

Overtime hours \& pay  

401(k)  

Wayfair company discount  

Benefits start day one  

Growth opportunities (Conversions, Promotions, and more!)**What You’ll Do**

* Maintain and operate battery changing station including removal and replacement of lift batteries (at applicable sites)
* Operates floor sweeper / scrubber to maintain facility floor
* General building maintenance including but not limited to plumbing, carpentry and painting
* Dispose of hazardous materials in accordance with established OSHA and Wayfair safety policies and procedures
* Conduct daily/weekly preventative maintenance and completes daily log sheet
* Perform pre\-operation checklist and verify all safety devices are functional at all times
* Maintain a clean and safe work area
* Complete work orders, records, logs and other written or computer\-based documents
* Perform other job\-related duties as directed by Manager/Supervisor
* Maintain a good attendance record

**What You’ll Need**

* Recommended by current reporting manager
* High School Diploma or Equivalent is a plus
* Strong mechanical aptitude and basic carpentry and maintenance experience including carpentry, painting, plumbing
* Experience safely using warehouse equipment such as order pickers, pallet jacks, forklifts and aerial lifts
* Proficient using hand and power tools and computers to perform required duties
* Previous battery charger/changer experience is a plus
* Must be flexible on working hours and willing to work scheduled \& unscheduled overtime
* Ability to regularly bend, lift, stretch, crawl and reach, engage in full manual dexterity in both hands and wrists and stand and walk for long periods
* Must be comfortable repeatedly lifting up to 75 lbs unassisted
* Ability to access all areas of the building by climbing ladders and gangways safely and without limitation
* Ability to work in a non\-climate controlled environment that can be noisy and unlit
* Follow all company safety policies, procedures, and guidelines
* Ability to work independently, as part of a team and take direction
* Must be a safety conscious, motivated, detail oriented, self\-starter with a positive attitude

Wayfair is fully committed to providing equal opportunities for all individuals, including individuals with disabilities. title: Wayfair Outlet Seasonal Sales Associate (Part Time)
description:
**Wayfair Outlet Seasonal Sales Associate**
===========================================


Come join the team that is reinventing home! Wayfair is hiring a Sales Associate for our returns Outlet retail store! If you are looking for rapid growth, constant learning and dynamic challenges, Wayfair’s Outlet store might be the future home for your career.
=====================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

  


**Starting Rate: $16\.00 per hour** **Hours**: 20 hours per week
***Store hours:***

Monday \- Saturday: 10am \- 8pm

Sunday: 11AM\-7PM  

**Benefits to building a HOME for your career with Wayfair:**

* Growth opportunities (Conversions, Promotions, and more!)
* Wayfair company discount
* PTO
* Holiday pay
* 401(k) with company match
* Referral bonuses


**What you’ll do:**
* As an authentic brand ambassador for the Wayfair family, lead and create a best in class customer experience by connecting them with the world's biggest and best home online assortment brought to life in our stores.
* Greet customers as they walk in the store
* Assist at the cash wrap as needed
* Participate in operational aspects of the store, including receiving and replenishment
* Exemplify a positive and professional attitude
* Engage in a high energy, focused and dynamic work environment
* Support launch efforts with set\-up responsibilities such as unloading trucks, moving and unpacking boxes, building furniture, stocking shelves and cleaning
* Perform other duties as assigned by the shift supervisor
* Follow all company policies and Wayfair standards

  


**Criteria:**
* Customer service experience preferred, but open to entry\-level
* Passion for great customer service and a drive to exceed sales targets


* Strong organization, self\-motivation, communication and relationship management skills.


* Comfortable working in a fast paced and changing environment
* Technical acumen to learn necessary software
* Associates are expected to have availability to meet the needs of the business.
* All employees will be expected to represent the brand through polished communication, personal appearance and professionalism

  


**Essential Functions:**
* Excellent verbal communication skills
* Excellent active listening skills
* Excellent sales and customer service skills
* Ability to anticipate customers' needs
* Technical acumen to learn necessary software and systems
* Ability to process information and merchandise through a computer system and POS register system


**Physical Requirements:**
--------------------------



* While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to stand, walk, talk and hear. The employee frequently is required to handle, or feel and reach with hands and arms The employee is occasionally required to sit; regularly climb or balance; and frequently stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee **must regularly, frequently or occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 lbs**
* Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus

  


**Working Hours:**

At Wayfair and our family of brands, we strive to provide our employees with a work schedule that protects their work/life balance and takes their scheduling preferences into consideration. Please understand due to the nature of the retail industry, your shift schedule will vary. However, we will work to provide you with your schedule a minimum of 2 weeks in advance, and you will have the opportunity to trade with teammates as needed.

Our store hours are Monday \- Saturday: 10am \- 8pm \& Sunday 11am \- 7pm. Employee shifts may include two hours before or after store hours.

  

Employment/promotion to this role will be contingent on successful completion of a background check. **Assistance for Individuals with Disabilities**

title: Sr. Manager, Digital Merchandising, Perigold
description:
*The salary range (or base pay) for this position is $149,000\-161,000 however, base pay offered may vary depending on location, job\-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Restricted stock units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the position offered.*


*This position is a hybrid in\-office role that works out of our Headquarters in Boston, MA (this role is not a virtual / remote position). 4 days in office/ 1 day WFH*



The Perigold Merchandising Lead role (Sr Manager) is responsible for setting and executing on the vision of best\-in\-class merchandising for Perigold. They will partner closely with STO leads across Category Management, Marketing, Merchandising, Operations and Storefront to identify opportunities for merchandising optimization and utilize the team of associates, analysts and offshore resources to directly improve the Perigold merchandising experience, through e.g. scalable catalog cleanups, merchandising lever optimizations and automation, dashboard creation and alerting setup, and partnering on new go\-to\-market content.


**About Perigold**: Perigold is the destination for luxury home. Established in 2017, Perigold offers an unmatched selection of the world’s best design brands with unique pieces for every style and space. The brand offers the highest quality pieces for your home, backed by a quality guarantee and expert concierge support. Headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts, Perigold is part of the Wayfair Inc. (NYSE:W) brand portfolio.


**What You’ll Do:**


* Own merchandising metrics for the PG catalog and onsite experience, including complete SKU %, assortment reporting, catalog health, merchandising productivity.
* Build and execute on 12\-18 month roadmap.
* Identify opportunities for scalable optimization of the catalog \& experience, working with direct reports and offshore resources to improve coverage metrics.
* Partner closely with merchandising teams on nuanced merchandising needed by customer type, category or platform.
* Manage a team of 5 associates and analysts, identifying opportunities for team development throughout the roadmap and promoting collaboration within the team.
* Manage offshore resources and optimize workflows to get optimal benefit from cost.
* Work cross\-functionally with category management and marketing to solve Perigold\-wide problems, including collaborating on assortment optimization, go\-to\-market content, site navigation and supplier management.
* Build out business reporting needs and prioritize within the Merchandising analytics community.


**What You’ll Need:**


* 7\+ years of experience or 1\+ years post MBA experience preferred.
* 2\+ years management experience preferred.
* Bachelor's Degree required.
* Strong analytical orientation, capable of leveraging data to dissect complex problems, formulate testable hypotheses, rigorously verify those hypotheses through data analysis, and ultimately develop and implement well\-supported recommendations.
* A keen eye for premium product presentation, understanding the nuances of visual merchandising and branding that elevate the perceived value of products.
* Senior presence coupled with strong communication skills, capable of articulating ideas clearly and persuasively.
* Exceptional stakeholder management skills, adept at building and maintaining positive relationships across teams and levels, effectively managing expectations, and driving collaborative outcomes.

**About Wayfair Inc.**



Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry\-leading technology and creative problem\-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If you’re looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then you’ll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking.



No matter who you are, Wayfair is a place you can call home. We’re a community of innovators, risk\-takers, and trailblazers who celebrate our differences, and know that our unique perspectives make us stronger, smarter, and well\-positioned for success. We value and rely on the collective voices of our employees, customers, community, and suppliers to help guide us as we build a better Wayfair – and world – for all. Every voice, every perspective matters. That’s why we’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer. title: Operations Industrial Engineer
description:
**This role is an onsite position based out of one of our Final Mile Centers in Norton, MA or Linden, NJ.**



The Operations Industrial Engineer plays a vital role in staffing, planning, and achieving site(s) specific goals across Wayfair. They partner with others to ensure timely and cost efficient processing of the orders.


**What You'll Do**


* You will create weekly and daily operating plans for site(s) and resolve variances between plan, actuals, and goals. Responsible for site plans at this cadence to align with Site leadership and network priorities.
* You will monitor plans and work in process backlogs to consider impacts of future planning and staffing
* You will provide input to strategic shift planning at the site to ensure the building is staffed according to short\-mid\-long term volume projections
* Coordinate with local site operations and central planning teams to analyze historical data and forecast demand for that site
* Manage and interpret the analyses of daily, weekly, and monthly reporting of site performance via Key Performance Indicators (Service Level Commitments)
* You will be able to engage at shift level, in real time to make proactive changes to support execution of the daily operations plan
* You’ll be responsible for facilitating problem solving efforts when goals are not met based on current inputs to daily plan \- i.e. Attrition, Absenteeism, Productivity
* You will support site operations team by optimizing staffing requirements for the site specific daily plan
* You will build a strong relationship with the site operations team to ensure proper execution of the daily level capacity / throughput plan through education in visibility to data and constant communication
* Communicate with cross\-functional leadership
* Work in close collaboration with Network Planning, Field Industrial Engineering, Process Definition and Standards Excellence to enable performance management improvements


**What You'll Need**


* 2\+ years relevant experience in supply chain
* Excellent communication skills \- Able to guide and influence peers and leaders across levels and organization. Disseminate information effectively.
* Technical aptitude in multiple systems; understanding of Google Suite, Data Visualization platforms, basic SQL/GBQ.
* Preferred Bachelor’s Degree in a quantitative field (engineering, economics, math, and statistics), business or equivalent
* Basic and working knowledge of Six Sigma tools and Lean techniques; process focused, organized and able to assess change management requirements
* Strong understanding in the use of technical/statistical tools to drive process improvements
* You must be authorized to work in the United States without visa sponsorship by Wayfair now or in the future.

title: Product Designer II
description:
*This is a hybrid\-onsite role. Employees are expected to be in our Boston, MA office Tuesdays\-Thursday, and work remotely Mondays and Fridays.*


**Who We Are**



Wayfair believes everyone deserves a home they love, and that furnishing your home should be a source of fun, not anxiety. Our product team plays a crucial role in making this vision a reality for millions of people around the world. Partnering with engineering, analytics, and business partners across Wayfair, our product team ensures that we’re building technology that solves important customer problems in elegant, scalable, measurable ways. We have a modern tech stack including sophisticated capabilities around AI, data science, multivariate testing, and personalization. We’re a highly collaborative, supportive team that values learning, psychological safety, and intentional career development.

  

As a Product Designer II, you will be directly impacting the home shopping journey—making it easy for Wayfair customers to bring their home vision to life. You’ll be asked to flex into key customer experiences within the shopping funnel such as Wayfair’s product listing, product details pages while thinking holistically across the entire shopping funnel.


**What You’ll Do:**


* Utilize design thinking principles to build engaging customer experiences which solve goals with elegant simplicity.
* Collaborate with product managers, developers, and other experienced designers to execute design concepts that deliver on brand goals, business goals, and are technically feasible to implement.
* Align with multiple teams to create cross\-functional and user\-centric design solutions.
* Drive a sense of urgency in the team to deliver work, emphasizing the use of lean tools and techniques to more rapidly deliver work.
* Day\-to\-day work will consist of a combination of design execution, and design operations management.
* Contribute to the improvement of our cross\-team collaboration Design processes, advocating best practices and innovative solutions between Product, Design, and Engineering teams embracing Agile methodologies.
* Demonstrate strong administration and communication skills. Be a strategist who can take a step back on overarching goals and opportunities, while also acting as a product practitioner who can meticulously work alongside their teams with domain knowledge and design prowess.

  

**We Are a Match Because You Have:**


* 3\+ years of professional UX experience.
* The ability to deliver high\-fidelity design work autonomously.
* Strong understanding of design processes; knowledge of what is possible and what will be hard to achieve and/or implement in a digital environment.
* Communication and Interpersonal Skills: You should be able to effectively present and explain ideas, while also being open\-minded and willing to consider new perspectives that may shape your solutions.
* Problem\-solving \& Critical thinking: Framing design challenges and generating solutions based on user needs and business goals.
* Visual \& interaction design: Understanding of layout, typography, spacing, and creating a strong visual hierarchy. Ability to design intuitive and user\-friendly interfaces.
* User research: You have a solid understanding of basic research principles and methodologies, and have a proven track record of independently conducting user research while selecting appropriate methodologies to inform your design.
* Expertise in producing relevant deliverables, including detailed site maps, user flows/task flows, user journeys,, high\-fidelity UI mocks, annotations, and prototypes that represent interaction recommendations, etc.
* An online portfolio of case studies that demonstrates unfailing advocacy for the user, highlighting: e\-commerce design work, enterprise design work, data\-driven approaches, and strategic thinking.

  


**Massachusetts Applicants**: I understand that it is unlawful in Massachusetts to require or administer a lie detector test as a condition of employment or continued employment. An employer who violates this law shall be subject to criminal penalties and civil liability.

**About Wayfair Inc.**



Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Through our commitment to industry\-leading technology and creative problem\-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. * You will provide input to strategic shift planning at the site to ensure the building is staffed according to short\-mid\-long term volume projections
* Coordinate with local site operations and central planning teams to analyze historical data and forecast demand for that site
* Manage and interpret the analyses of daily, weekly, and monthly reporting of site performance via Key Performance Indicators (Service Level Commitments)
* You will be able to engage at shift level, in real time to make proactive changes to support execution of the daily operations plan
* You’ll be responsible for facilitating problem solving efforts when goals are not met based on current inputs to daily plan \- i.e. Attrition, Absenteeism, Productivity
* You will support site operations team by optimizing staffing requirements for the site specific daily plan
* You will build a strong relationship with the site operations team to ensure proper execution of the daily level capacity / throughput plan through education in visibility to data and constant communication
* Communicate with cross\-functional leadership
* Work in close collaboration with Network Planning, Field Industrial Engineering, Process Definition and Standards Excellence to enable performance management improvements


**What You'll Need**


* 2\+ years relevant experience in supply chain
* Excellent communication skills \- Able to guide and influence peers and leaders across levels and organization. Disseminate information effectively.
* Technical aptitude in multiple systems; understanding of Google Suite, Data Visualization platforms, basic SQL/GBQ.
* Preferred Bachelor’s Degree in a quantitative field (engineering, economics, math, and statistics), business or equivalent
* Basic and working knowledge of Six Sigma tools and Lean techniques; process focused, organized and able to assess change management requirements
* Strong understanding in the use of technical/statistical tools to drive process improvements
* You must be authorized to work in the United States without visa sponsorship by Wayfair now or in the future.

**Find your place in the Wayborhood! Click** **here** **to stay informed on upcoming warehouse leadership opportunities.**

**Massachusetts Applicants:** I understand that it is unlawful in Massachusetts to require or administer a lie detector test as a condition of employment or continued employment. An employer who violates this law shall be subject to criminal penalties and civil liability.

title: HDO Team Lead 1
description:
***The pay for this position is $20\.75/hr***  

  



We are Wayfair; we deliver a best\-in\-class customer experience in the furniture and home space because of people like you, who are driven, determined, collaborative, and thrive in a fast\-paced environment. In order to maintain our high level of delivery standards and meet our customer’s needs, the Wayfair Distribution team plays a key role in improving customer satisfaction and driving repeat business. We’ve been busy building a best\-in\-class logistics network that allows us to delight customers by speeding up deliveries, adding services, and reducing damage using our own physical, asset\-based warehouses. We are looking for talented hard\-working individuals to join our growing team – your professional home awaits you at Wayfair!

 **Shift**


* Mon \- Fri 7AM \- 3:30PM

 **Benefits (Start Day 1!)**


* $1\.50/hr Shift differential for hours worked between 6:00pm \- 6:00am
* Referral bonuses
* Overtime hours \& pay
* 401(k)
* Wayfair company discount
* Benefits start day one
* Growth opportunities (Conversions, Promotions, and more!)

  


**What You'll Do**


* The Warehouse Team Lead will assist your supervisor with managing and overseeing all functions of the warehouse, and ensuring smooth operations of all activities
* Lead the receiving department and ensure the functions are used correctly
* Delegate and assign work to keep a 100% fill rate
* Help manage the inventory and conduct necessary training within the department
* Ensure the proper use and accountability of tools
* Ensure hours and functions are recorded correctly (e.g. Time clocks)
* Be responsible for answering email and verbal questions in a timely manner
* Keep product moving and oversee the cleanliness of the department. This includes daily trash compacting
* Additional responsibilities as assigned


**What You’ll Need**


* Working understanding of WMS system.
* Leadership and motivational skills, and the ability to make decisions with little to no guidance based on policies or common sense
* This is a floor position, and will involve physically moving/processing products in addition to leading a team of warehouse associates
* Must be comfortable repeatedly lifting up to 75 pounds unassisted and maneuvering product 150\+ pounds unassisted or via team lift
* Experienced in more than one department. Work areas include: receiving, inventory control, pick, pack, ship and return of product
* Experience with composing and replying to emails
* Power Equipment experience – Must be able to operate or willing to be trained on Powered Industrial Truck Operations (PITO)
* Experience with creating and updating systems such as trouble tickets
* 2\+ years working experience. Must have excellent attendance
* Understanding of High Jump is a plus
* Able to read and comprehend English to ensure your safety and the safety of those working around you

description:

We are Wayfair; we deliver a best\-in\-class customer experience in the furniture and home space because of people like you, who are driven, determined, collaborative, and thrive in a fast\-paced environment. title: Furniture Repair Technician
description:
The starting pay for this position is $37\.82/hour.  

We are Wayfair; we deliver a best\-in\-class customer experience in the furniture and home space because of people like you, who are driven, determined, collaborative, and thrive in a fast\-paced environment. In order to maintain our high level of delivery standards and meet our customer’s needs, the Wayfair Distribution team plays a key role in improving customer satisfaction and driving repeat business. We’ve been busy building a best\-in\-class logistics network that allows us to delight customers by speeding up deliveries, adding services, and reducing damage using our own physical, asset\-based warehouses. We are looking for talented hard\-working individuals to join our growing team – your professional home awaits you at Wayfair! **Shift**
Tuesday \- Saturday 7:00 am \- 3:30 pm **Wayfair Benefits**
Referral bonus
401(k) with company match
Wayfair company discount
Growth opportunities (Conversions, Promotions, and more!) **What You'll Do*** Work independentlyto evaluate damages and defects of items and determine if items can be repaired. Make any required adjustments to items ahead of delivery and ensure item is in perfect condition to be delivered to the customer
* Prioritize and execute on daily, weekly, and monthly tasks (repairs) to ensure completion in a effective and timely manner
* Accurately reports outcomes of work in progress, completed, \& past due work
* Monitors inventory, and orders replacement parts and complete installs as needed
* Ask clarifying questions when appropriate
* Administer appropriate repair methods for various product types including, but not limited to:
* + Evaluate each piece of furniture to determine the type of wood and/or upholstery repairs, parts, and materials needed to complete the job
	+ Case Goods: Burn\-ins, refinishing, joinery, match colors, and simulate wood grain
	+ Refinishes and patches damaged furniture including paint, stain, enamel or lacquers; mixes paints and stains to match existing finish
	+ Repairs, replaces and rebuilds damaged wood, leather or upholstery furniture or mechanical parts
	+ Operates tools such as power drills, sanders, saws, and other tools required for repair
* Use scan technology to document pertinent carton level information, including condition, quantity, warehouse location and detail repair completed
* Provide direct input into the existing user tools and make recommendations for improvements based on expertise \& experience
* Be a vocal contributor on the team
* Contribute to the building and development of training materials for applicable functions
* Must understand that this role will require you to work cooperatively with others, adjust to change, be a reliable team member, and work with other towards a common goal

 **What You'll Need*** At least 5\+ years prior experience in furniture repair/construction
* Advanced understanding of repairing wood items including: color and stain matching, damage/defect repair
* Ability to use power and hand tools as needed
* Advanced understanding of repairing upholstery and multiple fabric types a plus
* High attention to detail and prioritizes quality to deliver a perfect item to the customer.
* Must be comfortable lifting up to 75 lbs. unassisted and moving product 150\+ lbs. unassisted or via team lift
* Must be able to work on warehouse floor 8 hours a day or more
* Strong, consistent work ethic and ability to manage time effectively
* Comfort with scanning technology.
* Able to read and comprehend English to ensure your safety and the safety of those working around you.
* Must be at least 18 years of age.
* Certification in Furniture Repair/Restoration, preferred

 **Safety**
The safety of employees remains our \#1 priority and is at the heart of every decision made. We have taken a variety of steps to ensure that Wayfair is one of the safest places to work by:* Providing Guidelines to help employees maintain proper social distancing
* Providing and requiring suitable PPE such as masks, gloves, and safety vests.
* Increased sanitizing stations, as well as, improved professional sanitization of each facility.
* Team stretches at the start of each shift \- if you've come to flex your muscles, you first have to stretch them!

title: Warehouse IT Manager
description:
**Who We Are \[Employee Tech]**



Wayfair.com is a leader in the e\-commerce space for all things home. Our platforms support millions of people searching every day for the perfect item, and provide a unique purchase and delivery experience. Here at Wayfair, data drives everything that we do. Come help us continue to build innovative solutions, leading up to our next $10B in revenue!



Employee Tech at Wayfair is responsible for providing technology services and support for all Wayfairians globally. Our goal is to enable employee productivity through collaboration and innovation to help our employees provide our customers with a home that they love! We’re looking to grow our Warehouse IT team by bringing on a talented individual who wants exposure to our broad desktop computing tech stack and complex technical warehouse infrastructure.

  


**What You'll Do**


* Delegate tasks and provide clear direction to a team of 4 \+ engineers
* You will act as a point of ticket and systems outage escalation for engineers
* Manage IT Projects and platform updates, changes, and deployments
* Track progress, timelines and challenges and communicate them to project stakeholders
* You will handle unknown challenges, roadblocks, and dependencies effectively
* Communicate with Warehouse Management relevant IT changes affecting business practices, workflow, and SOPs for warehouse employees.
* Assist in developing, maintaining, and communicating all new or updated processes, procedures, and other relevant operational information to Engineers
* Develop and set short term and strategic goals for area of responsibility
* You will review and thoughtfully critique your team’s work regularly, providing actionable feedback and helpful suggestions.
* Ensure operational efficiency for our desktop computing and technical warehouse infrastructure
* Collaborate across cross functional engineering and business teams to solve high impact incidents with a sense of urgency by providing quality and accurate Information

  


**What You'll Need**


* 5\+ years of experience in people management
* Track record of success in developing relationships with stakeholders, working collaboratively and leveraging influence to drive multi\-departmental projects.
* Graduated from a 4\-year college or BA/BS degree from university in relevant field or equivalent experience
* Excellent interpersonal and team building skills
* A mindset to solve problems with analytical, creative, and innovative approach
* Warehouse Fulfillment Center/Distribution Center IT support experience a plus
* SQL knowledge a plus
* Prior warehouse operations/warehouse management system(WMS) experience a plus
* Ability to work on\-site in a 24/7 Warehouse environment to assist in supporting physical hardware/infrastructure when needed

title: Global Safety & Security Intelligence Specialist
description:
***This hybrid position will be based in our Boston office Monday\- Thursday, with remote flexibility on Fridays.***



We are Wayfair. We deliver a best\-in\-class customer experience in the furniture and home space because of people like you, who are driven, determined, collaborative, and thrive in a fast\-paced environment. We are looking for a talented GSOC analyst to join our newly formed Global Corporate Security Team. This is an incredible and unique opportunity to join a rapidly growing eCommerce company and to help build a department from the ground up – your professional home awaits you at Wayfair!



The GSOC analyst will be responsible for the daily operations of the GSOC and providing support to applicable stakeholders in the event of an incident or crisis. This individual will be part of a dynamic corporate security team whose mission is to provide world class support to our partners. This person will work on building and expanding the GSOC to 24/7 operations in the future and supporting the Corporate Security Team at Wayfair. This person will report to the GSOC Supervisor.


**What You’ll Do**


* Perform daily functions of the GSOC by monitoring alarms, access control, CCTV, and key events that may impact Wayfair’s operations and assets, providing periodic and timely reports.
* Review, analyze, and escalate issues to help mitigate global threats to Wayfair’s employees, property, and partners.
* Conduct open\-source intelligence (OSINT) collection and analysis to support situational awareness, incident response, and threat assessments.
* Draft and refine briefing documents and situational reports, incorporating feedback to ensure clarity, actionability, and strategic relevance.
* Evaluate and improve the structure and impact of internal reporting products to align with leadership needs.
* Dispatch and coordinate responses to incidents or crisis events that occur or could potentially impact Wayfair’s operations.
* Maintain detailed records of communications and events, including incident tracking and case management.
* Manage and handle sensitive incidents while maintaining confidentiality.
* Collaborate with global partners to identify security risks and develop mitigation strategies.


**What You’ll Need**


* 2\+ years of experience working in a security function, preferably in an operations or control center setting (either government or private sector).
* Bachelor’s Degree preferred.
* Ability to multitask in a fast\-paced work environment, think through problems, and make sound decisions under pressure.
* Must have the ability to communicate both written and orally with applicable stakeholders and represent Wayfair to external parties such as law enforcement.
* Excellent organizational and time management skills.
* Strong decision\-making ability during both crisis and non\-crisis situations.
* Ability to work in a flexible scheduling environment and support 24/7 operation as needed.


**Benefits \& Perks:**


* Full health benefits available (Medical, Dental, Vision, HSA/FSA) on day one for eligible employees.
* No\-cost access to 2nd.MD, a virtual expert medical consultation and navigation service.
* Global Traveler Health Insurance through GeoBlue.
* 24/7 access to mental, financial, physical and emotional wellbeing support, plus an enhanced offering of therapy and coaching.
* Automatic enrollment into Basic Life and Accidental Death \& Disability Insurance.
* 401(k) matching with immediate vesting.
* Paid Parental Leave, Surrogacy \& Adoption Reimbursement and Caregiver Services.
* Tuition Reimbursement.
* Wayfair Employee Discount.
* Gym/Fitness Discounts (including Peloton, Wellhub and varying regional memberships).
* Exclusive access to thousands of perks \& discounts through BenefitHub.
* Yearly match up to $500 for personal donations made by employees to registered 501(c)(3\) nonprofits.

**About Wayfair Inc.**



Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry\-leading technology and creative problem\-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. title: Community Marketing Senior Associate
description:
*This is a full\-time (40 hours/week) salaried role based in Wilmette, IL. The position requires in office presence Monday through Friday, with flexibility to accommodate in\-store or off\-site events as needed.*


*The salary range for this position is $79,325 \- $87,875, however base pay offered may vary depending on location, job\-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Restricted stock units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the position offered.*


**Role Description:**



The Physical Retail team at Wayfair is responsible for creating and executing a robust playbook to drive traffic to our expanding retail footprint, and enable the omnichannel shopping experience for customers.



The Wayfair Physical Retail Marketing team is looking for a Community Marketing Senior Associate to drive the community marketing and activation strategy for our first large\-format Wayfair store in Wilmette, IL. This individual will lead the development and execution of a community engagement strategy that acquires new customers and drives traffic to the store. This will be achieved through strategies that include in\-store and local programming, community partnerships, and digital amplification via social media and other outlets.



The Senior Marketing Associate will be based out of the Chicago\-area, but report to the Home Office Physical Retail Marketing team in Boston. They will also partner cross functionally with other members of the field team and work regularly with other Home Office teams to drive the community strategy and deliver results against it. The ideal candidate thrives in an entrepreneurial environment and is energized by creating (and executing) new strategies and initiatives. They are both creative and analytical with a passion for serving the customer, connecting with the community, and being part of a high\-performing team.


**Core Responsibilities**


* Community Marketing Strategy
* + Partner with Home Office to develop and deliver community marketing roadmap, playbook, seasonal strategies, and execution
	+ Proactively identify, vet, and recommend local opportunities that drive our business and objectives forward, including forecasting and analyzing its impact
	+ Develop and execute local social media strategy and content calendar in partnership with Home Office channel leads
	+ Analyze and recap activities, inclusive of results, learnings, strategic recommendations, customer feedback, etc.
* In\-Store Programming
* + Partner with Home Office and local field management to develop an in\-store event calendar that balances the brand’s go\-to\-market priorities with local community priorities and nuances. Initially targeting 1\-2 in\-store events/month with room to grow.
	+ Provide on\-location support to execute in\-store events, property activations, installations, and ad hoc opportunities
* Community Engagement
* + Identify and develop relationships with key community partners to generate awareness of Wayfair’s new store and suite of products. Partner with Home Office to build community engagement calendar of events
	+ Source and strategically participate in local events to build Wayfair’s presence within the community
	+ Plan and execute community outreach to drive awareness of key promotions and initiatives
	+ Support local hiring initiatives on an ad hoc basis
	+ Support community outreach efforts
* “Always On” Activities
* + Partner with Home Office Marketing and Creative teams to manage the store’s Instagram account, including capturing and posting content
	+ Manage the store’s local online presence including Google, Yelp, Bing listings (photos, hours), and website pages (photos, hours, event calendar)
	+ Budget management, reporting, and forecasting
	+ Inventory management of in\-store marketing materials (marketing kit, swag, handouts, catalog inventory, printed coupons)
	+ Support new store openings as they occur
	+ Ad hoc projects and store support as required

**Qualifications:**


**Required**


* Demonstrated success developing and executing community marketing strategies, including forecasting impact/costs, manipulating data to analyze results, and making strategic recommendations
* Ability to drive results and effectively collaborate within a matrixed environment
* Superb project and time management skills, including the ability to work on multiple projects at once with a variety of partners and stakeholders
* Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to influence cross\-functional stakeholders \- Effective presentation skills are a must (both developing materials and presenting them, e.g. recap decks)
* Connection to local community and a pulse on what’s relevant for our customer demographic
* Excellent communication skills and comfort with media appearances, representing the brand, contacting community leaders, hosting events, etc.
* Schedule flexibility to attend on\-site activations outside of core working hours as needed
* Ability to transport and set\-up materials that support community activations, e.g. tabling presentations
* Budget management and forecasting


**Preferred:**


* 10\+ years in field marketing, experiential marketing, or communications; Retail experience a plus
* Working knowledge of Google Suite tools (Docs, Slides, Sheets, Calendar) or its equivalent
* Working knowledge (or an appetite to learn) reporting tools like Looker
* Working knowledge of retail math (e.g. traffic, conversion, UPT, AOV, etc.) and customer marketing metrics (e.g. customer acquisition, retention, frequency, etc.)


**Physical Requirements:**


* Ability to sit or stand for long periods of time
* Lifting and carrying objects over 30 lbs may be required

 **About Wayfair Inc.**



Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry\-leading technology and creative problem\-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If you’re looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then you’ll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking.



No matter who you are, Wayfair is a place you can call home. We’re a community of innovators, risk\-takers, and trailblazers who celebrate our differences, and know that our unique perspectives make us stronger, smarter, and well\-positioned for success. We value and rely on the collective voices of our employees, customers, community, and suppliers to help guide us as we build a better Wayfair – and world – for all. Every voice, every perspective matters. That’s why we’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, genetic information, or any other legally protected characteristic.

description:

We are Wayfair; we deliver a best\-in\-class customer experience in the furniture and home space because of people like you, who are driven, determined, collaborative, and thrive in a fast\-paced environment. In order to maintain our high level of delivery standards and meet our customer’s needs, the Wayfair Distribution team plays a key role in improving customer satisfaction and driving repeat business. We’ve been busy building a best\-in\-class logistics network that allows us to delight customers by speeding up deliveries, adding services, and reducing damage using our own physical, asset\-based warehouses. * Experience with composing and replying to emails
* Power Equipment experience – Must be able to operate or willing to be trained on Powered Industrial Truck Operations (PITO)
* Experience with creating and updating systems such as trouble tickets

* Understanding of High Jump is a plus

title: Manager, Profit Management & Pricing - Wayfair Canada
description:
**Manager, Profit Management \& Pricing**


**About the Role**  

We are seeking a strategic and results\-driven **Manager** for our **Profit Management and Pricing team** for Wayfair Canada. This role is pivotal in ensuring the long\-term profitability of our business in the region by developing and executing effective pricing and investment strategies. Based in our Boston office, you will work on a four\-member team (with 1\-2 analyst direct reports) and collaborate with cross\-functional teams to drive optimal financial performance.


### **Key Responsibilities**


* Pricing and Profit Margin Optimization: Develop and implement pricing strategies to achieve optimal long\-term profit margins for the Canada market. Utilize levers such as promotional pricing and investment strategies to balance customer acquisition and profitability.
* Strategic Planning and Forecasting: Partner with Finance to lead profitability planning and forecasting efforts, ensuring alignment with business objectives. Contribute to scenario modeling to guide strategic decision making.
* Business Performance Monitoring and Problem Solving: Tackle ambiguous challenges to generate solutions that deliver measurable impacts in profitability, customer satisfaction, and operational efficiency. Partner with the Business Trends team to monitor and evaluate overall performance, opportunities, and risks.
* Data Analysis: Work with large datasets using advanced analytical tools (SQL, GBQ, R, Python) to perform analyses, identify trends and business insights, and develop reports to drive decisions across different Commercial functions.
* Cross\-Functional Leadership and Collaboration: Be a voice of the Canadian business, working closely with Finance, Marketing, Supplier Partnerships and Operations teams to align on broader business goals, prioritize opportunities and drive action. Partner with engineering and analytics teams to enhance pricing tools and systems.
* Team Leadership: Formally and informally lead analysts on the team, fostering a culture of excellence and innovation.

### **What We’re Looking For**


* Proven Experience: 5\+ years of experience in pricing, finance, or a related field, with a strong track record of driving profitability and leading teams.
* Analytical Expertise: Exceptional quantitative and analytical skills, with the ability to distill complex data into actionable insights.
* Technical Skills:
* + Proficiency in data analysis tools (e.g., SQL, GBQ, Excel) and desire to roll\-up sleeves alongside highly technical analysts to guide, review and improve code.
	+ Experience with pricing or financial modeling tools is desirable.
* Strong Business Acumen: Ability to understand how various parts of the business interact; can identify and approach problems from a customer or supplier perspective.
* Leadership Skills: Demonstrated success in formally or informally leading and mentoring other analysts.
* Stakeholder Management: Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with experience working across diverse teams and levels of an organization.
* Industry Knowledge: Familiarity with e\-commerce, retail, or consumer goods is a plus.


**This is a hybrid position located in our Boston HQ. M \- Th are in office and Friday's are remote.**

**About Wayfair Inc.**



Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry\-leading technology and creative problem\-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. title: Associate Director, Analytics and Profit Management - Specialty Retail Brands
description:
**About the Role**  

We are seeking a strategic and results\-driven **Associate Director** to lead our **Analytics and Profit Management function** for Wayfair’s Specialty Retail Brands: AllModern, Joss \& Main, Birch Lane, and Perigold. This role is pivotal in ensuring the long\-term profitability of our business by developing and executing effective pricing and investment strategies while also providing centralized leadership of key analytics functions. Based in our Boston office, you will oversee a team of three talented analysts with dotted line responsibilities for 5\-6 additional individuals across partner functions (Promotions, Finance, Supplier Analytics, Business Trends, Operations, Merchandising Operations).


### **Key Responsibilities**


* **Pricing and Profit Margin Optimization:**
* + Develop and implement pricing strategies to achieve optimal long\-term profit margins for the Specialty Retail Market.
	+ Utilize levers such as margin setting, promotional pricing, and investment strategies to balance customer acquisition and profitability.
	+ Drive specialty pricing initiatives to align with supplier and market dynamics.
* **Strategic Planning and Forecasting:**
* + Partner with the Finance team to lead profitability planning and forecasting efforts, ensuring alignment with business objectives.
	+ Contribute to scenario modeling and sensitivity analyses to guide strategic decision\-making.
* **Analytics Agenda Setting and Leadership:**
* + Decide the key business performance problems that need to be solved for the SRBs; Define end\-to\-end performance analytics roadmap, outlining the metrics and analyses needed to support strategic decision\-making.
	+ Establish functional KPIs and frameworks to facilitate progress, tracking and trade\-off decision\-making.
	+ Leverage analytics and SRB business context to drive decisions while advancing a cohesive SRB strategy. Decisions include, but are not limited to, catalog curation \+ assortment strategy, promo strategy and event curation, supplier WSC sourcing / opportunity identification, exclusivity goals and opportunities.
* **Cross\-Functional Leadership and Collaboration:**
* + Be the voice of the SRB business, working closely with Finance, Marketing, Merchant, and Supplier Partnerships teams to align on broader business goals, prioritize opportunities and drive action.
	+ Partner with engineering and analytics teams to enhance pricing tools and systems for improved efficiency and accuracy.
* **Business Performance Monitoring:**
* + Collaborate with the Business Trends team to monitor and evaluate overall business performance, identifying risks and opportunities.
	+ Develop actionable insights from pricing performance metrics to drive continuous improvement.
* **Team Leadership:**
* + Lead and develop a high\-performing team of analysts, both directly and through dotted line relationships, fostering a culture of excellence and innovation.
	+ Set clear goals, provide regular feedback, and enable professional growth within the team.

### **What We’re Looking For**


* **Proven Experience:**
* + 10\+ years of experience in pricing, finance, or a related field, with a strong track record of driving profitability and leading teams.
* **Analytical Expertise:**
* + Exceptional quantitative and analytical skills, with the ability to distill complex data into actionable insights.
* **Strategic Vision:**
* + Strong strategic thinking and problem\-solving skills, with the ability to navigate complex business challenges and drive results.
* **Leadership Skills:**
* + Demonstrated success in leading and developing teams, fostering a collaborative and inclusive environment.
* **Stakeholder Management:**
* + Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with experience working across diverse teams and levels of an organization.
* **Industry Knowledge:**
* + Familiarity with e\-commerce, retail, or consumer goods is a plus.
* **Technical Skills:**
* + Proficiency in data analysis tools (e.g., SQL, GBQ, Excel) and desire to roll\-up sleeves alongside highly technical analysts to guide, review and improve code.
	+ Experience with pricing or financial modeling tools is desirable.

Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry\-leading technology and creative problem\-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If you’re looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then you’ll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking.

title: Part Time Associate, Back of House Retail Operations
description:
**Part Time Associate,** **Logistics \& Inventory**



Location: 3232 Lake Ave Suite 1, Wilmette, IL 60091



Compensation for this role starts at $17/hour.


**Overview:**  

As a **Logistics \& Inventory Ops Associate**, you'll be a key player in ensuring smooth inventory flow and back\-of\-house operations for Wayfair's Physical Retail team. Your responsibilities will include unloading shipments, managing inventory movement, and maintaining product accuracy to create a seamless shopping experience for customers. You will also support our customer facing operations, when there is business need. This role requires attention to detail, comfort with warehouse environments, and the ability to handle heavy merchandise efficiently. The ideal candidate is highly organized, thrives in a fast\-paced setting, and is eager to contribute to operational excellence.


**What Does a Logistics \& Inventory Associate Do?**


* **Demonstrates Reliability:** Attendance and commitment to being present and on time for your full shift each day is crucial. This ensures we’re prepared to support our customers when they need us most. For unexpected events or issues, we require our team members to be proactive in their communications and planning whenever possible.
* **Receive and Process Shipments:** Unload and receive inbound furniture and other products, including manually moving large, heavy goods. Ensure inventory is accurately processed and documented.
* **Customer Engagement:** You will be responsible for owning and delivering a positive customer\-facing experience for curbside transactions, carry\-out, pickups, returns, and effectively using POS.
* **Ensure Inventory Accuracy:** Use scanning technology to record carton\-level details, including product condition, quantity, and location within the store.
* **Monitor Order Management Systems:** Track in\-store and online orders processed through back\-of\-house operations to ensure timely fulfillment.
* **Manage Inventory Movement:** Pick, stage, and move products from storage to the sales floor while maintaining proper organization and placement.
* **Support Operational Excellence:** Collaborate with store teams to resolve inventory discrepancies, maintain accurate stock levels, and uphold Wayfair’s commitment to efficiency.
* **Adhere to Safety Standards:** Follow safety guidelines for lifting, equipment use, and warehouse operations to create a secure work environment.

#### **What are the Job Requirements?**


* **Education:** High School Diploma or equivalent is required.
* **Retail or Warehouse Experience:** At least 6\+ months of experience working in a retail backroom, warehouse, distribution, or logistics environment is preferred.
* **Physical Capability:** Ability to lift up to 50 lbs unassisted and move items 150 lbs\+ with equipment or a team lift. Comfortable working in a warehouse/back\-of\-house environment for the majority of the shift.
* **Technical Skills:** Familiarity with scanning technology and order management systems is preferred.
* **Adaptability \& Problem\-Solving:** Ability to adjust to evolving processes and take initiative in troubleshooting inventory or logistics challenges.


**Additional Physical and Environmental Requirements**:


* Physical Demands
* + Frequent movement including standing, stooping, kneeling, crouching
	+ Occasional lifting, carrying, pushing, and pulling up to 50 lbs
	+ Frequent repetitive motions and coordination
	+ Constant handling, grasping, and communication (talking/hearing)
	+ Ability to ascend/descend stairs and balance
* Working Environment
* + Some exposure to cold, heat, and humidity
	+ Occasional noise and vibrations
	+ Minimal hazards and seasonal temperature changes

**What are the Benefits\*?**


* **Competitive Pay:** Earn competitive compensation with regular opportunities for performance\-based increases.
* **Career Growth:** Access professional development and advancement opportunities to help you grow with us.
* **Health Benefits from Day One:** Medical, dental, and vision insurance coverage starts on your first day.
* **Time to Recharge:** Start accruing paid time off immediately—because work\-life balance matters.
* **401(k) with Company Match:** We’ll match up to 4% to help you plan for your future.
* **Tuition Reimbursement:** Eligible after 6 months of employment—learn, grow, and get support along the way.
* **Wayfair Employee Discount:** Save big on the pieces you love—plus get 10% off at our in\-store restaurant ️.
* **Parental Leave Options:** Choose from paid and unpaid leave plans to support your growing family.
* ✨ **And So Much More: \***We’ve got more good stuff where that came from! NOTE: our full\-time roles receive the full benefits package above, while part\-time or seasonal team members may have modified offerings. Your recruiter or in\-store team can help with any questions!

**About Wayfair Inc.**



Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry\-leading technology and creative problem\-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. title: Logistics Specialist, Full-Time - Perigold Luxury
description:
**Logistics Specialist**



Location: West Palm Beach, Florida

  


**Brief Overview of Position**



Perigold, the destination for luxury home, is opening its first physical retail stores, first\-of\-their\-kind retail destinations of 20\-30K square feet, with the best products in all styles and from across our catalog including furniture, decor, housewares, and home improvement categories. Come be a part of it! We are looking for a Logistics Lead to oversee all back of house store operations, and report directly into the Store Manager. If you are driven, collaborative, and determined with strong attention to detail and communication skills and thrive on constant learning and dynamic challenges, this may be the perfect fit.

  


**What you’ll do**


* Maintain luxury experience standards by supporting an authentic, inviting guest experience that exemplifies our commitment to customer satisfaction and passion for luxury design.
* Oversee full store inventory accuracy, all inbound and outbound flows, all store replenishment, and fulfillment.
* Support the Store Manager and team with receiving and stockroom organization and supply levels to maximize inventory accuracy, inventory reconciliation and restocking efficiency, safety and productivity to support sales floor replenishment, returns and other related processes.
* Maintain and communicate comprehensive operations reporting for the store vs goals established for the business and by the store manager.
* Report on inventory position to store manager and leads on a regular basis.

title: Warehouse Industrial Mechanic - Night Shift
description:
**\*\*You must submit an updated resume when applying to this role in order to be considered for the role\*\***

***The pay for this position is $36\.18******/hr \+ $2\.00/hr shift differential***


We are Wayfair; we deliver a best\-in\-class customer experience in the furniture and home space because of people like you, who are driven, determined, collaborative, and thrive in a fast\-paced environment. In order to maintain our high level of delivery standards and meet our customer’s needs, the Wayfair Distribution team plays a key role in improving customer satisfaction and driving repeat business. We’ve been busy building a best\-in\-class logistics network that allows us to delight customers by speeding up deliveries, adding services, and reducing damage using our own physical, asset\-based warehouses. We are looking for talented hard\-working individuals to join our growing team – your professional home awaits you at Wayfair!


The Mechanic II will be a highly self\-motivated, customer\-centric team player with the ability to work with little to no supervision solving difficult problems, managing outside contractors, being on call for emergencies and handling multiple projects and daily activities under tight timelines.

 **Shifts available:**

* **3rd shift:** Sunday \- Tuesday; 6pm\-6am
* **3rd shift:** Wednesday \- Saturday; 5pm\-3:30am

**Benefits (Start Day 1!)**

* $2\.00/hr shift differential for hours worked between 6:00pm \- 6:00am
* Referral bonuses
* Overtime hours \& pay
* 401(k) with company match with company match
* Wayfair company discount
* Benefits start day one
* Growth opportunities (Conversions, Promotions, and more!)

**What You’ll Do**

* Work independently and with little to no supervision to troubleshoot all conveyor material handling systems, electrical, plumbing, mechanical, and fire protection systems
* Execute departmental and operational goals
* Assist in the design, layout, and reconfiguration of existing systems as necessary
* Utilize CMMS system to create and maintain the work schedule and workflow
* Work regularly on aerial platform lifts, boom/snorkel lift, and powered industrial trucks (reach, order picker, stand up, pallet runners, stock chaser, etc.)
* Mentor team members by motivating, providing guidance and direct feedback to help them achieve their goals and improve individual performance
* Develop and maintain good working relationships across all levels of the organization
* Responsible for keeping and maintaining tools, supplies, and a clean, organized work area
* Will perform emergency repairs in high pressure circumstances

 **What You’ll Need**

* Minimum 3 years experience in industrial maintenance and/or combined certification(s)
* Proficient reading and comprehending electrical schematics and using associated tools such as volt/ohm meter, etc. (120,240,480VAC, 24VDC)
* Ability to install, maintain, \& troubleshoot relay logic, ladder diagrams, control components, photo eyes, motor starters, relays, limit switches, proximity sensors, timers, solenoids, servo drives, frequency inverters, linear drives, and encoders
* Proficient using hand \& power tools and electrical testing equipment including PLC systems
* Experienced safely using warehouse equipment such as order pickers, pallet jacks, forklifts and aerial lifts
* Proficient using computer systems and CMMS software
* Will be required to wear applicable personal protective equipment including arc flash protection and safety shoes
* Ability to regularly bend, lift, stretch, crawl and reach, engage in full manual dexterity in both hands and wrists and stand and walk for long periods
* Must be comfortable repeatedly lifting up to 75 lbs unassisted
* Ability to access all areas of the building by climbing ladders and gangways safely and without limitation
* Ability to work in a non\-climate controlled environment that can be noisy and have a low lighting levels
* Follow all company safety policies, procedures, and guidelines
* Ability to work independently, as part of a team and take directions
* Must be a safety conscious, motivated, detail oriented, self\-starter with a positive attitude
* Must be flexible on working hours and willing to work scheduled \& unscheduled overtime

title: Associate Designer, Full-Time - Perigold Luxury
description:
**Sales Product Specialist (Full\-Time)**



Location: West Palm Beach, Florida

  


**Brief Overview of Position**



Perigold, the destination for luxury home, is opening its first physical retail stores, first\-of\-their\-kind luxury retail destinations of 20\-30K square feet, with the best products in all styles and from across our catalog including furniture, decor, housewares, and home improvement categories. Come be a part of it! We are looking for motivated individuals to join our sales team who are passionate about luxury and/or design, relentlessly focused on boosting sales, building personalized connections, and creating an environment that invites and inspires our guests.

  


**What you’ll do**


* Maintain luxury experience standards by providing an authentic, inviting guest experience that exemplifies our commitment to customer satisfaction and passion for luxury design.
* Drive sales in store by building personalized connections with customers through thoughtful questions to understand their needs..
* Become an expert on Perigold products and services to help guide guests thru their questions and provide product options both in store and online thru our endless aisle and store application.
* Demonstrate confidence in closing the sale and educating guests on various ways to purchase including through POS, Online, and our app.
* Collaborate with Design team, generating and referring leads as appropriate or supporting product inquiries coming from the design process.
* Contribute effectively as needed in all operational aspects of the store including but not limited to: processing new products, floor sets, replenishment, backfill substitutions, and general upkeep of the store.
* Exemplify a positive and professional attitude on a daily basis with customers and team members.
* Bring a willingness to share innovative ideas and solutions to continuously improve team operations.
* Engage in a high energy, focused and dynamic work environment where there can be rapid changes in products, promotions, and operations.

  


**What you’ll need**


*Experience*


* Retail sales experience (Design related environment and/or luxury sales experience a plus)
* Flexibility availability (including mornings, nights, weekends, some holidays).


*Skills and Abilities*


* Excellent verbal and written communication skills. (High proficiency)
* Multi\-tasking skills and presentation skills. (High proficiency)
* Possess excellent organizational skills, with attention to detail and accuracy. (Medium proficiency)
* Strong time management skills.

  


**Physical Demands**


* Stationary Position \- Constantly
* Move/Traverse \- Constantly
* Stationary Position/Seated \- Rarely
* Transport/Lifting \- Occasionally (50\)
* Transport/Carrying \- Occasionally (50\)
* Exerting Force/Pushing \- Occasionally (50\)
* Exerting Force/Pulling \- Occasionally (50\)
* Ascend/Descend \- Occasionally (50\)
* Balancing \- Occasionally
* Position Self/Stooping \- Frequently
* Position Self/Kneeling \- Frequently
* Position Self/Crouching \- Frequently
* Position Self/Crawling \- Occasionally
* Reaching \- Occasionally
* Handling \- Constantly
* Grasping \- Constantly
* Feeling \- Constantly
* Communicate/Talking \- Constantly
* Communicate/Hearing \- Constantly
* Repetitive Motions \- Frequently
* Coordination \- Frequently

  


**Working Environment**


* Extreme cold \- Rarely
* Extreme heat \- Rarely
* Humidity \- Rarely
* Wet \- Rarely
* Noise \- Occasionally
* Hazards \- Rarely
* Temperature Change \- Rarely
* Atmospheric Conditions \- Rarely
* Vibration \- Rarely

  


**Compensation \& Benefits:**


* Compensation starting at $24\.00 per hour
* Medical benefits, financial benefits, and a generous employee discount

  


**About Perigold**



Perigold is the destination for luxury home. Established in 2017, Perigold offers an unmatched selection of the world’s best design brands, with unique pieces for every style and space. The brand offers the highest quality pieces for home, backed by a quality guarantee and expert concierge support. They also offer free white\-glove delivery and 30\-day returns on most items. Headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts, Perigold is part of the Wayfair Inc. (NYSE:W) brand portfolio.

title: General Maintenance
description:

title: Transportation Specialist
description:
***The pay for this position is $23\.00/hr***


We are Wayfair; we deliver a best\-in\-class customer experience in the furniture and home space because of people like you, who are driven, determined, collaborative, and thrive in a fast\-paced environment. In order to maintain our high level of delivery standards and meet our customer’s needs, the Wayfair Distribution team plays a key role in improving customer satisfaction and driving repeat business. We’ve been busy building a best\-in\-class logistics network that allows us to delight customers by speeding up deliveries, adding services, and reducing damage using our own physical, asset\-based warehouses. We are looking for talented hard\-working individuals to join our growing team – your professional home awaits you at Wayfair!


Transportation Specialists are responsible for inventory fidelity and back\-end warehouse support. Transportation Specialists ensure that POs are in their proper inventory states, leading to streamlined scheduling and delivery. Transportation Specialists are also responsible for reconciling exceptions, reverse logistics, and driver paperwork.

 **Shift**

* Sunday \- Tuesday 6:00am \- 6:00pm

**Benefits (Start Day 1!)**

* $1\.50/hr shift differential for hours worked between 6:00pm \- 6:00am
* Referral bonuses
* Overtime hours \& pay
* 401(k) with company match with company match
* Wayfair company discount
* Benefits start day one
* Growth opportunities (Conversions, Promotions, and more!)

**What You'll Do**

* Use Wayfair inventory systems and tools to ensure "perfect" orders run smoothly from receipt at the terminal to dispatching for delivery
* Identify exceptions such as damage, short shipments, mis shipments, overweight/oversized cartons, etc., and reconcile these issues, engaging Customer Service and other partner teams as needed
* Inventory freight returning after a missed or refused delivery, escalating reports of missing freight to terminal leadership
* Set up schedules for outgoing freight (returns, liquidation, donation, disposal) and maintain relationships with reverse logistics carriers
* Print any necessary paperwork for delivery teams, correcting any errors
* Write and distribute an "end of shift" report to all terminal staff and any necessary partner teams
* Provide feedback on processes and tools
* Support Customer Service and other partner teams in efforts to maintain high customer satisfaction

**What You'll Need**

* 2\+ years of relevant experience in a similar role
* Ability to lift 75\+ lbs to assist the warehouse team as needed
* Strong written and verbal communication skills with a strong customer\-centric approach
* Ability to multitask and navigate through various systems and tools
* Well organized and detail oriented
* Comfort with Microsoft Office and learning new technologies
* Proactive in identifying opportunities for improvement and driving solutions
* Experienced in Logistics or Transportation
* BA/BS preferred
