title: Product Manager, Freight Management Technology
description:
**Who We Are \[Freight Management Technology]**



We are looking for a passionate Product Manager to join the Freight Management Technology(FMT) team. The FMT team is responsible for ensuring reliable and cost effective movement of goods from our suppliers to Wayfair's warehouses and onward to the last mile hubs. This role will support a step change in Wayfair management of the network through Transportation Management System(TMS) implementation across North America and Europe. The successful candidate will be responsible for managing relationships with our third\-party TMS teams as well as design easy\-to\-use, relevant, and insightful user experiences for our planners along with the underlying technical platform across geos and channels.

  


**What You’ll Do**


* **Drive a deep understanding** of Wayfair’s internal users and carriers, supply chain metrics, financial drivers, and business outcomes to inform product strategy.
* **Lead cross\-functional programs** with internal stakeholders and third\-party consultants to successfully migrate transportation movements into a third\-party TMS..
* **Collaborate** with Business and Operations stakeholders to prioritize and develop impactful solutions that drive key business value.
* **Execute an Agile roadmap** by collaborating closely with engineering, design, and analytics teams to deliver user\-centric, data\-driven solutions
* **Communicate the** roadmap progress to stakeholders at all levels, including senior leadership, ensuring transparency and buy\-in.
* **Align and track OKRs** for key product initiatives to ensure alignment with stakeholder objectives.

  


**What You’ll Need**


* **4 \+ years building products at scale from concept to launch and beyond,** preferably with Supply Chain domain expertise
* **Experience building internal platforms** or enterprise\-scale tools used by multiple teams.
* Strong **analytical** and data\-driven decision making skills
* Strong ability to **deliver results** in a fast\-paced environment while utilizing good mechanisms for planning and execution
* **Technical fluency** to effectively communicate with engineering. A technical degree is a plus.
* **Excellent communication** and stakeholder management skills at the senior partner level.
* **Collaborative**, team\-oriented mindset with a bias for action.
* Prior Experience in logistics, operations heavy domain, TMS implementation(e.g., Manhattan Associates) or consultant experience.
* Familiarity with EDI formats (e.g., EDI 204, 210\) used by carriers to communicate with TMS systems.
* Basic SQL/BigQuery for self\-service analysis.

**About Wayfair Inc.**



Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry\-leading technology and creative problem\-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. title: Warehouse Associate
description:
***The pay for this position is $19\.25/hr***

  

We are Wayfair; we deliver a best\-in\-class customer experience in the furniture and home space because of people like you, who are driven, determined, collaborative, and thrive in a fast\-paced environment. In order to maintain our high level of delivery standards and meet our customer’s needs, the Wayfair Distribution team plays a key role in improving customer satisfaction and driving repeat business. We’ve been busy building a best\-in\-class logistics network that allows us to delight customers by speeding up deliveries, adding services, and reducing damage using our own physical, asset\-based warehouses. We are looking for talented hard\-working individuals to join our growing team – your professional home awaits you at Wayfair!
**Shift**


* Sunday \- Wednesday 8:30am \- 7:00pm


**Benefits (Start Day 1!)**


* $1\.50/hr Shift differential for hours worked between 6:00pm \- 6:00am
* Referral bonuses
* Overtime hours \& pay
* 401(k) with company match
* Wayfair company discount
* Growth opportunities (Conversions, Promotions, and more!)
* Dozens of discounts and perks with partners!

  

The ideal candidate will be detail\-oriented and conscientious with a passion for protecting the customer. The primary role will be to perform product inspections during the inbound process to identify incoming damage or defects to prevent them from entering our network. This involves delicate unpacking and repackaging to ensure no impact to the product or its protection. Flexibility is also important as this role and the department as a whole evolves over time. The associate will also be a valued member of the team whose ideas and suggestions will be leveraged to continue improving the process. Inbound quality is dedicated to continuous improvement and seeks associates who are thoughtful and take initiative to solve problems and escalate issues. **What You'll Do**
* Unpack and inspect inbound product to identify damage or defects
* Perform repairs on boxes such as taping, reboxing when needed, repalletizing and using banding material to strap boxes to pallets
* When the repair area is clean, you will walk the floor to inspect freight to see if it needs to be repaired. Any freight needing repair will need to be brought to the repair area
* Document the results of inspection through RF gun scans
* Collect evidence of failures by capturing key attributes (location, failure mode, etc.) and images via a google form
* Manage product flow through their workstation and the department as a whole
* Identify opportunities for improvement and collaborate with supervisor, lead, peers and support staff to implement
* Assist the warehouse floor as needed by the Supervisor
* Be cross trained in other departments and perform additional responsibilities as assigned

 **What You'll Need**
* Must be comfortable repeatedly lifting up to 75 lbs. unassisted and moving product 150\+ lbs. unassisted or via team lift
* Must be able to work on the warehouse floor 8 hours a day or more
* Strong, consistent work ethic
* Excellent time management and punctuality; Regular and reliable attendance is an essential function of this position
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
* Comfortable using hardware technology (RF Guns, Android devices, etc.)
* Able to solve problems by thinking analytically and creatively
* Experience in Distribution or Logistics is a plus
* Able to read and comprehend English to ensure your safety and the safety of those working around you
* Must be at least 18 years of age

title: Supplier Relationship Manager
description:
***At this time, Wayfair will not sponsor applicants for this position for the following work visas: F1\-OPT, STEM OPT EAD, H\-1B, H\-1B1, E\-3, O\-1, J\-1, or TN.***



We are seeking a detail\-oriented and driven individual with proven analytical skills to join our Category Management team as a Senior Category Associate. This role will be instrumental in contributing to enhanced customer satisfaction through data\-driven assortment decisions. You will be responsible for driving sales growth and improving profitability, as well as identifying new business opportunities, developing internal and external relationships, and negotiating with key suppliers. Further responsibilities may include expanding the assortment and developing a competitive market strategy. You will collaborate closely with a Senior Category Manager to establish and execute product category strategies, nurture supplier relationships, drive process improvements, and negotiate pricing and inventory. We encourage applications from high\-caliber professionals with transferable skills developed in generalist business settings. While an interest in style, home fashion, and decor is beneficial, we also value candidates with strong business acumen and a proven ability to apply their skills across various product categories.


**Who We Are**



The Category Management team at Wayfair drives strategic growth for key product categories through strong internal and external partnerships. We leverage data to optimize supplier relationships and enhance the platform experience. Our team members are strategic thinkers, effective negotiators, and skilled project managers who define category goals and execute tactical plans.


**How is this opportunity unique?**



This role offers opportunities to build and manage collaborative external partnerships. It's a data\-driven environment where analytical skills are highly valued and used to inform strategic decisions. We provide a dynamic and evolving work environment that encourages innovation and calculated risk\-taking. We foster a collaborative and engaging environment that values work\-life balance and offers opportunities for continuous professional development and mentorship.


**What You’ll Do**


* Lead the development and execution of strategic category plans to achieve revenue and profitability goals.
* Leverage event and category performance data to generate actionable insights and drive business adjustments.
* Conduct competitive and product category analysis to evaluate market trends.
* Collaborate cross\-functionally to proactively identify and capitalize on assortment opportunities.
* Negotiate favorable terms with suppliers, including selection, price, and quantity.
* Establish and strengthen relationships with brands, partnering effectively to achieve mutual business objectives.
* Conduct competitive and product category analysis to identify new designers and brands to increase and expand selection across product categories.
* Collaborate with numerous cross\-functional partners (Pricing, Promotions, Operations, Merchandising, and more!).


**What You’ll Need**


* 4\+ years of experience within an e\-commerce or corporate retail organization is preferred.
* A strong interest in developing a career in buying, merchandising, and/or supplier relationship management.
* Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
* Proven ability to build and maintain strong relationships with business partners.
* Ability to communicate effectively and comfortably with C\-suite level suppliers from large companies.
* Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects simultaneously (with attention to detail).
* Solid understanding of or aptitude for learning retail math concepts.
* Adept at analyzing data to identify trends and inform decisions.
* Demonstrated ability to work independently, take initiative, and achieve set goals effectively.
* Proactive and solution\-oriented approach to challenges and opportunities.
* Familiarity with Microsoft Excel and Google Suite is preferred.
* A drive to achieve growth with the ability to think creatively and overcome limitations.
* Demonstrated potential to work effectively as part of a cross\-functional team.
* Desire to develop business plans and contribute to strategic initiatives.

  



**Wayfair's In\-Office Policy:** All Boston\-based interns, co\-ops, and corporate employees will be in office in a hybrid capacity. Employees will work in the office on Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday, and work remotely Friday.

**About Wayfair Inc.**



Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry\-leading technology and creative problem\-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If you’re looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then you’ll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking.

title: Specialist, Retail Logistics Operations
description:
**Specialist, Logistics \& Inventory Ops**


**$19/hour**



Location: Wilmette, IL


**Overview:**

  


As a **Logistics and Inventory Specialist**, you’ll play a critical role in ensuring seamless operations as Wayfair's Physical Retail team reimagines the shopping experience. From managing inventory flow and conducting audits to processing shipments and resolving discrepancies, your work will directly support an exceptional customer shopping experience. With a keen eye for detail and a proactive approach to problem\-solving, this role will focus on maintaining inventory accuracy, resolving logistical exceptions, and optimizing efficiency. The ideal candidate thrives in a fast\-paced environment, collaborates effectively with partner teams, and is passionate about owning and creating a flawless operational foundation reflecting Wayfair’s commitment to a top\-tier experience and retail excellence.

  

**What Does a Logistics \& Inventory Specialist Do?**


* **Demonstrates Reliability:** Attendance and commitment to being present and on time for your full shift each day is crucial. This helps ensure we're ready and available to help our customers when they need us most. For unexpected events or issues, we require our team members to be proactive in their communications and planning whenever possible.
* **Ensure Inventory Accuracy:** Perform daily audits and maintain a robust Cycle Count Program to safeguard the integrity and accuracy of inventory records. Leverage scan technology to document carton\-level details like condition, quantity, and location.
* **Manage Inventory Performance:** Monitor aging inventory, process markdowns, and execute damage write\-offs to maintain accuracy and efficiency. Handle vendor returns for recalls, dead stock, and overstock inventory while leveraging experience in inventory management or e\-commerce to optimize processes.
* **Receive and Process Shipments:** Unload and receive inventory with care, including the manual handling of large and heavy goods. Ensure all inventory is processed correctly, capturing detailed records of overages, shortages, or damages.
* **Proactively Monitor Systems:** Use order management tools and Warehouse Management Software to track inventory movement, troubleshoot discrepancies, and maintain up\-to\-date records. Regularly review Cycle Count data using Google Sheets to identify and address gaps.
* **Audit Operations:** Conduct regular and triggered audits for inbound and outbound trucks to ensure accurate processing and shipment flow.
* **Support Operational Excellence:** Use a ticketing system to manage exceptions, resolve issues, and provide input on improving existing processes and tools based on your day\-to\-day experience.
* **Collaborate Across Teams:** Partner with logistics leaders and other teams to streamline operations, share insights, and uphold Wayfair’s commitment to operational excellence.
* **Adapt and Problem\-Solve:** Thrive in a fast\-paced environment by taking ownership of inventory challenges, driving solutions, and ensuring smooth coordination between warehouse and retail operations.

  


**What are the Job Requirements?**

  


**Education:** High School Diploma or equivalent is required.


**Inventory Control Experience:** 1 to 3 years of inventory control experience, preferably in a retail environment, is required.


**Distribution or Logistics Experience:** 1\+ year ofexperience in distribution or logistics is preferred.


**Open Schedule Availability:** You may be required to work a flexible schedule that in many cases may include nights, weekends, and holidays.


**Customer Service Skills:** Must possess excellent customer service skills, with the ability to communicate effectively and work well under pressure in a fast\-paced environment.


**Adaptability and Problem\-Solving:** Demonstrates the ability to adapt to evolving tools, systems, and processes to ensure operational excellence.


**Technical Proficiency:** Strong computer skills with experience in Microsoft Office or Google Suite are preferred.


**Detail Orientation:** Must be highly detail\-oriented and organized, with a proven ability to manage complex inventory systems and workflows.

 **Additional Physical and Environmental Requirements**:

  

* Physical Demands
* + Frequent movement including standing, stooping, kneeling, crouching
	+ Occasional lifting, carrying, pushing, and pulling up to 50 lbs
	+ Frequent repetitive motions and coordination
	+ Constant handling, grasping, and communication (talking/hearing)
	+ Ability to ascend/descend stairs and balance
* Working Environment
* + Some exposure to cold, heat, and humidity
	+ Occasional noise and vibrations
	+ Minimal hazards and seasonal temperature changes

**What are the Benefits\*?**



**Competitive Pay:** Earn more based on your experience—starting at $19/hour!  

**Career Growth:** Access professional development and advancement opportunities to help you grow with us.  

**Health Benefits from Day One:** Medical, dental, and vision insurance coverage starts on your first day.  

**Time to Recharge:** Start accruing paid time off immediately—because work\-life balance matters.  

**401(k) with Company Match:** We’ll match up to 4% to help you plan for your future.  

**Tuition Reimbursement:** Eligible after 6 months of employment—learn, grow, and get support along the way.  

**Wayfair Employee Discount:** Save big on the pieces you love—plus get 10% off at our in\-store restaurant ️.  

**Parental Leave Options:** Choose from paid and unpaid leave plans to support your growing family.  

✨ **And So Much More:** We’ve got more good stuff where that came from! Our full\-time roles receive the full benefits package, while part\-time or seasonal team members may have modified offerings. Your recruiter or in\-store team can help with any questions!



Wayfair Employee discount and much more!  

* *These benefits may vary or change for part\-time or seasonal status employees. Detailed benefit guides will be issued to anyone who is offered a position with Wayfair for further insights into all of the great offerings available. If you’re curious to learn more about a specific benefit detail, your recruiter or a member of our team onsite can help with this information!*
**About Wayfair Inc.**



Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry\-leading technology and creative problem\-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If you’re looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then you’ll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking.



No matter who you are, Wayfair is a place you can call home. We’re a community of innovators, risk\-takers, and trailblazers who celebrate our differences, and know that our unique perspectives make us stronger, smarter, and well\-positioned for success. We value and rely on the collective voices of our employees, customers, community, and suppliers to help guide us as we build a better Wayfair – and world – for all. Every voice, every perspective matters. That’s why we’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, genetic information, or any other legally protected characteristic.

title: Senior Associate, Global Sales Revenue Operations - Category Sales
description:
***At this time, Wayfair does not provide sponsorship for employment authorization for this position.***



Wayfair’s Business to Business (“B2B”) and Business to Consumer (“B2C”) Sales team is seeking a collaborative analytical\-oriented Senior Associate to help drive the Global Sales agenda through effective project ownership and executive business reviews. The role will be a part of the Revenue Operations team that will help craft and execute against OKR strategies across global sales teams.



We seek a motivated Senior Associate who will partner with Sales and internal enablement teams to optimize sales workflows to consistently exceed sales targets and improve customer experience (enabled by process and tooling). The Senior Associate will manage, coach, and partner with a Category Sales Associate on the GRO team, allocating deliverables and collaborating on project execution.



This scope includes proactively partnering with Sales, Analytics, and Category Management teams (Supplier Relationship Managers) to monitor performance, create action plans to improve performance, and execute medium/long\-term program and channel\-level project initiatives.


**What You’ll Do:**


* Deeply understand both qualitative and quantitative trends in the business through active sales representative engagement and strong knowledge of short/long\-term KPI trends
* + Partner with associate to lead weekly B2C/B2B On\-Demand Category Sales Business Reviews by analyzing performance metrics and uncovering actionable insights
	+ Identify growth opportunities to optimize category strategy and drive revenue
* Scope and execute medium/long\-term projects and initiatives
* + Assist in scoping project initiatives, ensuring project management operational excellence through clear deliverables, resource needs, timelines, and cross\-functional involvement
	+ Drive execution to Category Sales project deliverables, including hitting stage gate milestones, preparing / delivering updates to senior sales and cross\-functional teammates, incorporating feedback
	+ Coordinate cross\-functional teams and resources, assessing and acting on tradeoffs across the business (e.g., across sales programs, tech resources)
* Provide short\-term operational support to improve performance
* + Scope data requests for analytics teams to execute, and interpret results to understand business trends (validating qualitative feedback)
	+ Create short\-term action plans to address underperformance and/or accelerate positive trends, with clear asks, milestones and deliverables
	+ Align and alert partner teams to execute, allocating deliverables/deadlines to the Category Sales associate
	+ Communicate progress and resolutions to partner teams and sales team members
* Manage and coach a Category Sales Associate responsible for executional tasks, ticket intake, low\-lift project management, and detailed analytical pulls
* + Coach and develop an associate to enhance their performance and skillset, aligning their growth with strategic category sales initiatives to drive business performance and long\-term success
	+ Remove roadblocks for an associate while coordinating with cross\-functional and complex stakeholders on behalf of the Category Sales team to ensure streamlined communication

**What You’ll Need:**


* 3\+ years of experience in sales enablement, project / program management, strategy \& operations, consulting, or similar roles supporting Sales, Customer Service, or Marketing teams
* Ability to understand and empathize with diverse stakeholders across functions, and tailor messaging / communication appropriately to ensure resonance
* Ability to break down complex, ambiguous problems into logical objectives, translating sales needs into discrete, actionable steps for partner teams to execute
* Ability to create consistent messaging about complex projects, flexing to audience needs but creating cohesion on the objective and guiding principles
* Passion for working collaboratively across functions to drive operational improvements and projects
* Ability to manage processes efficiently by scoping logical steps from ideation to project completion
* Ability to manage and coach an associate to drive performance, while removing roadblocks and coordinating the teams needs with stakeholder leads
  


**An Important Note about Wayfair's In\-Office Policy:**



All Boston\-based interns, Co\-ops, and corporate employees will be in office in a hybrid capacity. Employees will work in the office on designated days, Monday \- Thursday, and work remotely Friday.


**Massachusetts Applicants:**



I understand that it is unlawful in Massachusetts to require or administer a lie detector test as a condition of employment or continued employment. An employer who violates this law shall be subject to criminal penalties and civil liability.

title: Head of Global HR Shared Services
description:
**About the Team:**



The Employee Resource Center (ERC) is Wayfair's global HR shared service center. The team is central to our Talent team’s transformation from a decentralized model to a tiered service delivery model. This evolution aims to deliver significant improvements in service quality, customer satisfaction, compliance, and efficiency across Wayfair. The ERC focuses on streamlining processes, enhancing service quality through centralization and automation, managing an offshore program, and leveraging technology like GenAI to drive excellent operations and employee experience.


**About the Role:**



We are seeking a strategic and experienced leader to be the Head of the Employee Resource Center (ERC). This is a critical global role based in Boston, responsible for leading the ERC team and driving the ongoing transformation of Wayfair's HR service delivery. You will oversee a global team and be responsible for setting the strategic direction, managing operations, and ensuring the successful implementation of key initiatives like knowledge management and the application of generative and agentic AI to the talent processes. You will play a pivotal role in shaping the employee experience and driving operational excellence within the Talent organization.


**What You'll Do:**


* **Strategic Leadership:** Lead the transformation to a tiered service delivery model, setting the vision and strategy to enhance quality, compliance, and efficiency.
* **Talent Leadership Partnership:** Develop strong, collaborative working relationships with the Talent leadership team including the CPO to understand needs, align on priorities, and jointly drive a strategic agenda for HR service delivery transformation and operations.
* **Operational Management:** Oversee the operations of the global ERC team, ensuring consistent service delivery and achievement of key performance indicators (KPIs) related to service levels (SLAs), time\-to\-resolution (TTR), and customer satisfaction (NPS).
* **Process Improvement \& Centralization:** Drive the continuous improvement, standardization, and centralization of Talent processes into the ERC, identifying opportunities for automation and efficiency gains. Oversee the absorption of additional Talent workstreams.
* **Tech Innovation:** Thinking AI\-first, lead the strategy and implementation of new technologies, including generative and agentic AI. Have a strong handle on evolving options in the market, lead RFPs and evaluate options, decide whether to build vs. buy, and ultimately implement AI\-driven solutions, ensuring accuracy, strong customer experience, compliance and security. Additionally, work with the Tech team to optimize our Workday configuration, and ensure strong knowledge management and ticketing functionality.
* **Team Leadership \& Development:** Manage and develop a global team of Talent Ops professionals, fostering a culture of continuous improvement and customer focus.
* **Vendor \& Offshore Management:** Oversee relationships with external vendors, including the offshore service provider (OSL), ensuring performance standards are met, and scale the program effectively.
* **Stakeholder Collaboration:** Partner closely with leaders across Talent (including HRIS, Total Rewards, Talent Business Partners), Tech, Finance, and other departments to align on priorities, manage dependencies, and ensure successful execution of ERC initiatives.
* **Reporting \& Analytics:** Oversee the development and automation of operational and customer experience reporting and capacity modeling to track performance, identify trends, and inform strategic decisions. Ensure key metrics are centralized and accessible.
* **Risk Management:** Identify and mitigate risks associated with ERC operations and strategic initiatives, particularly concerning technology dependencies and implementation complexities.


**What You'll Need:**


* Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Human Resources, or a related field. Master's degree preferred.
* Significant experience (typically 15\+ years) in HR operations, shared services, or a similar environment.
* Proven track record of leading large\-scale transformations and process improvement initiatives within an HR or other business function.
* Strong understanding of HR service delivery models, technologies (including HRIS like Workday, case management like ServiceNow, and AI/Chatbots), and best practices.
* Demonstrated experience in managing successful vendor relationships, including offshore partners.
* Excellent analytical and problem\-solving skills, with the ability to use data to drive decisions.
* Strong project management and change management skills.
* Exceptional communication, influencing, and stakeholder management abilities.
* 10\+ years of experience leading large global teams (40\+) and experience leading managers.

**About Wayfair Inc.**



Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry\-leading technology and creative problem\-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. title: Visual Merchandising Department Supervisor - Perigold Luxury
description:
**Brief Overview of Position**



Perigold, the destination for luxury home, is opening its first physical retail stores, first\-of\-their\-kind luxury retail destinations of 20\-30K square feet, with the best products in all styles and from across our catalog including furniture, decor, housewares, and home improvement categories. Come be a part of it! We are looking for a Senior Associate in Visual Merchandising who will be responsible for the execution of all in\-store Visual Merchandising initiatives (e.g. Presentation, Marketing/Signage, Merchandise Flow, Visual Operations) as we bring the in\-store experience for the Perigold brand to life. This position will play a significant role in helping build and shape the internal Visual Merchandising team structure and execution of processes for all future Perigold stores. This position will report directly to the Assistant Store Manager, Guest Experience. This may be the perfect role for you if you are a driven individual with a strong skill set in Visual Merchandising, interpreting floorsets and basic planogram directives, ensuring in\-store presentations align with the seasonal strategy for the Perigold organization, communication, time\-management, driving results with the ability to pivot based on business needs.


**What you’ll do**


* Maintain luxury experience standards by supporting an authentic, inviting guest experience that exemplifies our commitment to customer satisfaction and passion for luxury design.
* Execute Visual Merchandising tasks such as floorsets, signage and marketing placement, lighting installations, maintaining brand visual standards, basic electrical wiring, installing wall decor, and wallpapering as needed.
* Attract, hire, coach, and retain top\-performing talent for the Visual Merchandising team in alignment with business priorities and cultural norms.
* Collaborate effectively with teammates in all departments to share knowledge regarding luxury Visual Merchandising standards and efficiencies, floorset execution, daily maintenance and adapting presentations based on sell\-through and sales opportunities.
* Complete daily and weekly store walk\-throughs to ensure all presentations meet Perigold luxury standards and create a plan for addressing opportunities.
* Deliver results with agility and a sense of urgency when executing all Visual Merchandising tasks.
* Use good judgment when adapting the merchandising of presentations to support inventory replenishment and drive sales while aligning with seasonal strategies and Perigold standards.
* Bring a willingness to share ideas in order to innovate and improve Visual Merchandising and operational processes in all departments throughout the store.
* Be open to receiving feedback and direction from store leaders around brand presentation to deliver on Perigold standards on a daily basis.
* Relay guest and operational feedback to corporate office team in order to together identify opportunities to optimize floor plan / set.
* Engage in a high energy, focused and dynamic work environment where there can be rapid changes in products, promotions and store operations.
* Perform key holder and Manager On Duty duties.
* Comfortability utilizing a 10ft. ladder as needed for the store.


**What you’ll need**


*Experience*


* 2\-5 years Visual Merchandising experience in a retail setting.
* 2\-5 years Retail experience; preferably in a home or furnishings space.
* 1\-3 years Interior design, furniture or home goods experience preferred.
* 1\-3 years Reading, interpreting and executing a sales floor design layout map or basic planogram preferred. Experience with planogram software preferred.


*Skills and Abilities*


* Passion for exceeding sales targets through Visual Merchandising. (High proficiency)
* Passion for operational excellence, great Customer Service and consistent efficiencies to meet company goals. (High proficiency)
* Track record of thriving in a fast paced and changing environment while demonstrating professional maturity. (Medium proficiency)
* Strong organization, self\-motivation, communication and relationship management skills. (High proficiency)
* Technical acumen to learn necessary software; proficiency in Google Suites and/or Microsoft Office applications preferred. (Medium proficiency)
* Flexibility availability (including mornings, nights, weekends, some holidays). (High proficiency)
* Candidates must be open to learning how to safely operate a pallet jack (also known as a pallet truck or pump truck) as part of their job responsibilities. Training will be provided to ensure proper handling and safety protocols are followed. Typically, this requires you to be able to lift at least 50lbs or more.


*Physical Demands*


* Stationary Position \- Constantly • Move/Traverse \- Constantly
* Stationary Position/Seated \- Rarely
* Transport/Lifting \- Occasionally (50lbs)
* Transport/Carrying \- Occasionally (50lbs)
* Exerting Force/Pushing \- Occasionally (50lbs)
* Exerting Force/Pulling \- Occasionally (50lbs)
* Ascend/Descend \- Occasionally (50lbs)
* Balancing \- Occasionally
* Position Self/Stooping \- Frequently
* Position Self/Kneeling \- Frequently
* Position Self/Crouching \- Frequently
* Position Self/Crawling \- Occasionally
* Reaching \- Occasionally
* Handling \- Frequently
* Grasping \- Frequently
* Feeling \- Frequently
* Communicate/Talking \- Constantly
* Communicate/Hearing \- Constantly
* Repetitive Motions \- Frequently
* Coordination \- Frequently


**Compensation \& Benefits:**

  


* Competitive Compensation \+ substantial quarterly bonuses

  


* Medical benefits, financial benefits, and a generous employee discount.


**About Perigold**



Perigold is the destination for luxury home. Established in 2017, Perigold offers an unmatched selection of the world’s best design brands, with unique pieces for every style and space. The brand offers the highest quality pieces for home, backed by a quality guarantee and expert concierge support. They also offer free white\-glove delivery and 30\-day returns on most items. Headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts, Perigold is part of the Wayfair Inc. (NYSE:W) brand portfolio.

title: Assistant Store Manager of Sales - Perigold Luxury
description:
**Brief Overview of Position**



Perigold, the destination for luxury home, is opening its first physical retail stores in West Palm Beach, FL, first\-of\-their\-kind luxury retail destinations of 20\-30K square feet, with the best products in all styles and from across our catalog including furniture, decor, housewares, and home improvement categories. Come be a part of it! We are looking for an Assistant Store Manager, Sales Lead to oversee all Sales functions for the store. This role will lead a team of in\-store Designers and Product Specialists, collaborate closely with the store Guest Experience Lead, and report directly into the Store Manager. If you are passionate about luxury and/or design, looking for rapid growth, and thrive on constant learning and dynamic challenges, this may be the perfect fit.

  


**What you’ll do**


* Oversee all in\-store sales operations including supervision of Zone Leads and Designer team, adherence to sales floor presentation standards, and in\-stock replenishment needs.
* Collaborate with General Contractors on bath and kitchen design implementation in client spaces.
* Understand and deliver on the compatibility of appliances within client spaces.
* In collaboration with the Store Manager, establish goals for the Sales team (Zone Leads, Product Specialists and Designers) in alignment with overall business sales targets and guest experience standards.
* Attract, hire, coach, and retain top\-performing talent.
* In collaboration with corporate field enablement lead and in partnership with our supplier base as needed, develops and executes training curriculum and schedule to drive results in alignment with sales targets and guest experience goals.
* Analyze Sales metrics via reporting tools on a regular basis, share out to Store Manager, and translate to training and process improvement needs for Sales team.
* Communicate regularly with the Sales team on store performance and improvement needs in order deliver an exceptional luxury experience and achieve sales goals; inspire team excellence.
* Fosters a culture of collaboration across Product Specialists and Designers to ensure the store guests gets the appropriate level of support for their shopping needs and we maximize our impact on the guest’s home via lead generation, upselling, and design support.
* Maintain close communication and collaboration with the Regional Design Manager to support guests across channels (virtual, in\-store) and optimize Designer utilization.
* Partner with the Store Manager and other store Leads including Logistics and Guest Experience to ensure alignment with greater business requirements and expectations (eg maintaining luxury experience standards, new season planning and execution).
* Perform key holder and Manager On Duty duties.

  


**What you’ll need**


*Experience \& Qualifications*


* 3\+ years of management experience, including overseeing a successful sales team.
* Demonstrated ability to recognize and maintain a high bar for luxury design.
* Demonstrated ability to thrive in a fast\-paced, startup environment, including willingness to explore and test innovative ideas and pursue continuous improvement.
* Client\-centric mindset.
* Strong business acumen as well as exceptional analytical, problem\-solving, and decision\-making skills as it relates to managing a sales funnel.

title: Senior Accountant
description:
*This position is a hybrid in\-office role that works out of our Boston HQ.*


*Monday\-Thursday will be working in office and Friday is WFH. This is not a virtual / remote position.*



Wayfair’s Finance group is looking for a Senior Accountant to join our team! This role will reside on the financial reporting team within the Wayfair Finance Department. This is a fast scaling position and will be able to offer a lot of career progression at a growing public company. This is a dynamic role and offers exposure to many areas of accounting and finance.  

  

The financial reporting team is responsible for the preparation of our financial statements and ensures they are in compliance with GAAP. Members of this team work closely with various other teams and departments to properly report the consolidated balance sheets and income statement to management monthly as well as public filings quarterly and annually.  

  

**What You'll Do:**


* Key player in the month\-end close process.
* Prepare reconciliations of various general ledger accounts.
* Analyze monthly balance sheet and income statement account variances.
* Prepare monthly and ad\-hoc financial reporting for senior management.
* Work with external auditors and prepare audit workpapers as requested.
* Review, recommend and implement best practices regarding accounting policies and procedures.
* Research emerging accounting and reporting issues to ensure the company is in compliance with US GAAP.
* Work with other members of the financial reporting team and product management to identify ways to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of financial reporting and assist in initiatives to implement improvement.
* Cross\-train members of the financial reporting team.
* Assist in the documentation and compliance with SOX.

  

  

**What You Need**:


* Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or Finance, or any analytical field, such as economics, engineering, business, math, statistics, science, or analytics.
* 3\+ years’ experience in public or private accounting.
* Organized, self\-motivated, and a collaborative team player.
* Able to succeed in a fast\-paced and deadline driven environment.
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills including experience in translating financial concepts to individuals at all levels, including finance and non\-finance managers.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Solid analytical, problem solving and financial troubleshooting skills.
* Ability to quickly learn new systems, processes and procedures and adapt local practices to global standards.


**Nice to Haves:**


* CPA certification preferred.
* Experience with SQL or Google BigQuery (GBQ).
* Experience in cost accounting, inventory accounting, or manufacturing/Supply Chain Finance.


***You must be authorized to work in the United States without visa sponsorship by Wayfair now or in the future.***


**Massachusetts Applicants:** I understand that it is unlawful in Massachusetts to require or administer a lie detector test as a condition of employment or continued employment. An employer who violates this law shall be subject to criminal penalties and civil liability.


**About Wayfair Inc.**



Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry\-leading technology and creative problem\-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If you’re looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then you’ll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking.

title: Sales Department Supervisor - Perigold Luxury
description:
**Brief Overview of Position**



Perigold, the destination for luxury home, is opening its first physical retail stores, first\-of\-their\-kind luxury retail destinations of 20\-30K square feet, with the best products in all styles and from across our catalog including furniture, decor, housewares, and home improvement categories. Come be a part of it! We are looking for a Sales Department Supervisor who will lead a sales team of product specialists for a major Department within the store. This role will work closely with the in\-store Design team and report directly into the Assistant Store Manager \- Sales. If you are passionate about luxury and/or design, looking for rapid growth, and thrive on constant learning and dynamic challenges, this might be the perfect fit for you.


**What you’ll do**


* Maintain luxury experience standards by providing an authentic, inviting guest experience that exemplifies our commitment to customer satisfaction and passion for luxury design.
* Collaborate with General Contractors on design implementation in client spaces.
* Understand and deliver on the compatibility of appliances within client spaces.
* Work with the Assistant Store Manager \- Sales to attract, hire, coach, and retain top\-performing talent for the Sales team, in alignment with business priorities and cultural norms.
* With direct reports, be a strong visible presence in the designated work area to drive sales and strong guest service.
* Provide brand and product information to support guest purchase inquiries.
* Support store leaders in development and execution of training to build product specialist team knowledge of our product, selling, guest service, operations, visual, and other aspects of their roles. .
* Deliver against individual and team sales and service KPIs, productivity standards and store goals.
* Collaborate with the Design team, generating and referring leads as appropriate or supporting product inquiries coming from the design process.
* Lead the use of design tools, CRM software and client accounts for consistent guest experience and record keeping.
* Master selling essentials, sales analytics tools, and other training resources to educate the team on our wide array of product assortment.
* Manage and monitor stock levels, merchandise adjacencies, presentations, signing, and assortment in all departments to ensure the sales\-floor is adequately stocked. Maintain visual standards of the store, per home office directive.
* Work with the Guest Experience team to ensure the store meets visual, replenishment, cleanliness, safety and back of house standards during floor leadership shifts.
* Engage in a high energy and dynamic work environment where there can be rapid changes in products, promotions, offerings and operations.
* Perform key holder and Manager On Duty duties.


**What you’ll need**


*Experience \& Qualifications*

* 2\-5 years experience motivating a team to achieve sales goals (preferably as a store Leader or Trainer)
* Understanding of luxury design.
* Experience with appliance fitting and specifications.
* Passion for great customer service and a drive to exceed sales targets.
* Strong organization, self\-motivation, communication and relationship management skills
* An ability to handle customer escalations and demonstrate professional maturity.
* Ability to learn details of a vast product catalog.
* Demonstrated ability to work within a team sales environment.
* Technical acumen to learn necessary software; proficiency in Google Suites and/or Microsoft Office applications preferred.
* Track record of thriving in a fast paced and changing environment, with an ability to adapt and grow.
* Flexibility availability (including mornings, nights, weekends, some holidays).

***Physical Demands***
----------------------


* While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to stand, walk, talk and hear. The employee frequently is required to handle, or feel and reach with hands and arms. The employee is occasionally required to sit; regularly climb or balance; and frequently stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must regularly, frequently or occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 lbs
* Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.


**Compensation \& Benefits**


* Competitive compensation \+ substantial quarterly bonuses
* Medical benefits, financial benefits, and a generous employee discount


**About Perigold**



Perigold is the destination for luxury home. Established in 2017, Perigold offers an unmatched selection of the world’s best design brands, with unique pieces for every style and space. The brand offers the highest quality pieces for home, backed by a quality guarantee and expert concierge support. They also offer free white\-glove delivery and 30\-day returns on most items. Headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts, Perigold is part of the Wayfair Inc. (NYSE:W) brand portfolio.

title: Associate Project Manager, Creative Operations
description:
***At this time, Wayfair will not sponsor applicants for this position for the following work visas: F1\-OPT, STEM OPT EAD, H\-1B, H\-1B1, E\-3, O\-1, J\-1, or TN.***



Wayfair is seeking a highly organized and agile Senior Associate to join our Creative Operations team, supporting project and production operations across both Performance Creative (paid social, search, programmatic) and our expanding Owned \& Operated channels (email, push, SMS). This role is central to scaling our creative output through sprint\-based planning, test\-and\-learn execution, and close collaboration with both marketing and creative stakeholders. You will lead fast\-paced creative workstreams from intake through delivery, adapting to shifting priorities, coordinating across teams, and ensuring projects stay on track. While this role is project\-management forward, we’re also looking for someone who’s tech\-savvy and open to growing with our evolving creative systems, including exposure to AI, automation, and experimentation platforms.


### **Who We Are**

  

The Creative Operations team serves as the business owner of our Creative Group. This team drives the long\-term strategy, scaling and day\-to\-day workflow for our diverse set of brands. With hundreds of initiatives a month spanning all mediums, channels and disciplines, we are the driving force enabling our Creative talent to efficiently and effectively bring our brands to life with eye\-catching visuals, strong messaging, and engaging storytelling.


### **What You’ll Do**


* Manage creative sprints supporting Performance Marketing and other high volume test \& learn initiatives, ensuring projects are briefed, resourced, reviewed by appropriate parties, and delivered correctly and on time
* Translate business goals and creative direction into executable timelines and workflows across a variety of asset types and channels
* Act as a key cross\-functional partner to Creative, Marketing, and Operations, facilitating day\-to\-day delivery while aligning on larger priorities and testing roadmaps
* Collaborate with team leads on roadmap planning, sprint prioritization, and resource forecasting
* Own project management systems (e.g., Airtable), driving usage, visibility, and data hygiene
* Identify and escalate risks, blockers, or misalignments early, and help problem\-solve in real time
* Contribute to improving operational processes, sprint cadences, and creative testing systems
* Act as a super user and power collaborator across our core tools and platforms, bringing a tech\-forward mindset to every sprint
* Support the development and maintenance of scalable creative systems (e.g., naming conventions, asset versioning protocols, metadata tagging) to enable performance reporting and automation

  


### **What You’ll Need**


* 3\+ years of experience in project or production management, preferably in a creative, marketing, or content\-led organization
* Proven success executing fast\-turn sprint based creative workflows, ideally in paid media, email, and mobile channels
* Experience supporting test\-and\-learn cycles or campaign iteration using performance data or structured feedback loops
* Proficiency navigating PM platforms (e.g., Airtable, Jira, Trello, Monday.com); experience onboarding teams or maintaining these systems is a plus
* Demonstrated ability to manage concurrent projects with multiple stakeholders, deliverables, and timelines across teams
* Familiarity with creative asset development processes, including brief intake, production tracking, QA, and delivery

title: Assistant Store Manager of Guest Experience - Perigold Luxury
description:
**Assistant Store Manager, Guest Experience Lead**



Location: West Palm Beach, FL

  


**Brief Overview of Position**



Perigold, the destination for luxury home, is opening its first physical retail stores, first\-of\-their\-kind retail destinations of 20\-30K square feet, with the best products in all styles and from across our catalog including furniture, decor, housewares, and home improvement categories. Come be a part of it! We are looking for an Assistant Store Manager, Guest Experience Lead to oversee the end\-to\-end guest experience in the store. This role will oversee a team of in\-store Hosts, Visual Merchants, and Service team members , and report directly into the Store Manager. If you are passionate about luxury experience and/or design, looking for rapid growth, and thrive on constant learning and dynamic challenges, this may be the perfect fit.

  


**What you’ll do**


* Oversee store facility and guest service experience elements, including visual merchandising, hosts, community liaison (and events), and guest service agents.
* Maintain a high bar for luxury experience and service excellence in the store environment at all times, and establish this culture with direct reports and broader store team.
* Attract, hire, coach, and retain top\-performing talent.
* Collaborate with Store Manager to monitor Guest Experience performance metrics, share out to store team, and translate to training and process improvement needed within the store.
* Communicate regularly to team on store performance and improvement needs in order deliver an exceptional luxury experience; inspire team excellence.
* In collaboration with corporate field enablement lead and in partnership with our supplier base as needed, develops and executes training curriculum and schedule to drive results in alignment with sales targets and guest experience goals.
* Maintain close communication and collaboration with Corporate visual merchandising and physical retail marketing leads as well as, Guest Service SWAT team, to ensure alignment with standards and troubleshoot issues.
* Partner with Store Manager and Leads including Logistics and Sales leads to ensure alignment with greater business requirements and expectations (eg new season planning and execution, stock room organization and supply levels).
* Perform key holder and Manager On Duty duties.

*Experience \& Qualifications*


* 3\+ years of management experience in a retail or hospitality environment.
* Demonstrated ability to thrive in a fast\-paced, startup environment, including willingness to explore and test innovative ideas and pursue continuous improvement.
* Client\-centric mindset.
* Strong business acumen, and exceptional analytical, problem\-solving, and decision\-making skills.
* Flexibility availability (including mornings, nights, weekends, some holidays).

Training will be provided to ensure proper handling and safety protocols are followed. Typically, this requires you to be able to lift at least 50lbs or more.

title: Senior Specialist, Visual Merchandising
description:
**Senior Specialist, Visual Merchandising \- Wayfair Branded Stores**



Location: 3232 Lake Ave Suite 1, Wilmette, IL 60091



The pay rate for this position is $21/hour


**Overview:**



As a **Senior Specialist of Visual Merchandising**, you’ll play a critical role in bringing the Wayfair brand to life in our physical retail stores. Reporting to the Department Manager, you’ll drive the in\-store shopping experience by developing and executing compelling visual merchandising strategies to inspire our customers and elevate store engagement.


* Blending creativity with data\-driven insights, you’ll craft impactful displays, optimize product presentation, and lead key initiatives that enhance store performance. You'll also serve as a mentor to Visual Specialists and Sales Associates, fostering a culture of innovation, collaboration, and excellence in visual storytelling. The ideal candidate thrives in a fast\-paced, ever\-evolving environment and has a keen eye for design, a strong grasp of retail trends, and a passion for creating immersive shopping experiences.
  


**What Does a Senior Visual Merchandising Specialist Do?**


* **Develop \& Execute Visual Merchandising Strategy:** Implement and refine seasonal merchandising strategies that align with brand standards, marketing campaigns, and sales goals. Use data and industry trends to enhance in\-store experiences.
* **Project Leadership:** Take ownership of key visual merchandising projects, including new store setups, seasonal refreshes, and promotional displays. Develop project plans, manage timelines, and coordinate with cross\-functional partners to ensure seamless execution.
* **Optimize Product Placement \& Store Layouts:** Analyze sales trends, customer behavior, and inventory flow to make data\-driven recommendations that enhance product visibility and drive engagement.
* **Uphold Brand Consistency \& Operational Excellence:** Conduct regular store walk\-throughs to assess merchandising execution, troubleshoot challenges, and implement solutions that uphold brand standards in a fast\-paced retail environment.
* **Demonstrate Reliability \& Professionalism:** Maintain strong attendance and communication to support business needs. Proactively address scheduling or operational challenges to ensure consistent store coverage.
* **Provide Training \& Collaborate Across Teams:** Mentor Visual Specialists and Sales Associates, providing hands\-on training and best practices in visual merchandising. Collaborate with marketing, sales, and operations teams to align merchandising with business goals.
* **Analyze Performance \& Innovate:** Track key performance indicators (KPIs) and use customer feedback to refine strategies. Stay ahead of emerging trends in visual merchandising and introduce innovative ideas to enhance brand presence.
* **Adapt to Rapid Change \& Problem\-Solving:** Quickly adjust to shifting priorities and evolving business needs. Take a solution\-oriented approach to merchandising challenges and maintain high execution standards.
* **Drive Customer Experience \& Engagement:** Create an inspiring shopping environment through thoughtful visual storytelling. Engage with customers to understand their needs and ensure merchandising decisions contribute to a seamless retail experience.


**What are the Job Requirements?**


* **Education:** Bachelor's degree in Visual Merchandising, Fashion Merchandising, Retail Management, or a related field preferred or equivalent work experience/tenure.
* **Visual Experience:** 3\+ years of progressive experience in visual merchandising, preferably in a retail environment. Experience in home furnishings or interior design is a plus. Demonstrated experience leading projects or initiatives.
* **Availability:** Must have open availability, including nights, weekends, and holidays.
* **Visual Merchandising Expertise:** Strong knowledge of composition, color theory, lighting, space planning, and display execution.
* **Creative \& Strategic Thinking:** Ability to develop innovative merchandising solutions based on business needs.
* **Project Management:** Skilled in planning, organizing, and executing merchandising projects on time and within scope.
* **Communication \& Leadership:** Strong verbal and written communication skills; ability to train, mentor, and collaborate across teams.
* **Data\-Driven Decision\-Making:** Ability to analyze sales trends and customer insights to optimize merchandising strategies.
* **Technical Proficiency:** Experience with visual merchandising tools; familiarity with planogram software is a plus.
* **Physical Requirements:** Ability to perform frequent movement, repetitive motions, and occasional lifting/carrying up to 50 lbs.

  


**Additional Physical and Environmental Requirements**:


* Physical Demands
* + Frequent movement including standing, stooping, kneeling, crouching
	+ Occasional lifting, carrying, pushing, and pulling up to 50 lbs
	+ Frequent repetitive motions and coordination
	+ Constant handling, grasping, and communication (talking/hearing)
	+ Ability to ascend/descend stairs and balance
* Working Environment
* + Some exposure to cold, heat, and humidity
	+ Occasional noise and vibrations
	+ Minimal hazards and seasonal temperature changes

**What are the benefits?**


* **Competitive Pay:** Earn competitive compensation with regular opportunities for performance\-based increases.
* **Career Growth:** Access professional development and advancement opportunities to help you grow with us.
* **Health Benefits from Day One:** Medical, dental, and vision insurance coverage starts on your first day.
* **Time to Recharge:** Start accruing paid time off immediately—because work\-life balance matters.
* **401(k) with Company Match:** We’ll match up to 4% to help you plan for your future.
* **Tuition Reimbursement:** Eligible after 6 months of employment—learn, grow, and get support along the way.
* **Wayfair Employee Discount:** Save big on the pieces you love—plus get 10% off at our in\-store restaurant ️.
* **Parental Leave Options:** Choose from paid and unpaid leave plans to support your growing family.
* **✨ And So Much More: We’ve got more good stuff where that came from!**

***PLEASE NOTE:*** *our full\-time roles receive the full benefits package above, while part\-time or seasonal team members may have modified offerings. Your recruiter or in\-store team can help with any questions!*

**About Wayfair Inc.**



Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry\-leading technology and creative problem\-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If you’re looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then you’ll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking.



No matter who you are, Wayfair is a place you can call home. We’re a community of innovators, risk\-takers, and trailblazers who celebrate our differences, and know that our unique perspectives make us stronger, smarter, and well\-positioned for success. title: Visual Merchandising Specialist
description:
**Specialist, Visual Merchandising (Full\-Time) \- Wayfair Branded stores**



Location: 3232 Lake Ave, Wilmette, IL 60091



The pay of this position is $19\.00/hr


**Brief Overview of Position**



Wayfair's Physical Retail team is reinventing the shopping experience for Home, curating our portfolio of furniture, decor, housewares, and home improvement categories into one store\- come be a part of it! The Visual Specialist role is responsible for the execution of all in\-store Visual Merchandising initiatives (e.g. Presentation, Marketing/Signage, Merchandise Flow, Visual Operations) as we bring the in\-store experience for the Wayfair brand to life. We are seeking a driven individual with a strong skillset in Visual Merchandising, interpreting floorsets and basic planogram directives, ensuring in\-store presentations align with the seasonal strategy for the Wayfair organization, communication, time\-management, driving results with the ability to pivot based on business needs. This position will play a significant role in helping build and shape the internal Visual Merchandising team structure and execution of processes for all future Wayfair stores. This position will report directly to the Visual Merchandise Lead \& Visual Merchandise Manager.


**Essential Functions**


* Execute Visual Merchandising tasks such as floorsets, signage and marketing placement, lighting installations, maintaining company visual standards, basic electrical wiring and wallpapering as needed.
* Collaborate effectively with teammates in all departments to share knowledge regarding Visual Merchandising standards and efficiencies, floorset execution, daily maintenance and adapting presentations based on sell\-through and sales opportunities.
* Complete daily and weekly store walk\-throughs to ensure all presentations meet Wayfair standards while using the Visual Merchandising Checklist to create a strategic plan for addressing opportunities.
* Deliver results with agility and a sense of urgency when executing all Visual Merchandising tasks.
* Use good judgment when adapting the merchandising of presentations to support inventory replenishment and drive sales while aligning with seasonal strategies and Wayfair standards.
* Bring a willingness to share ideas in order to innovate and improve Visual Merchandising and operational processes in all departments throughout the store.
* Be open to receiving feedback and direction from store leaders around brand presentation to deliver Wayfair standards on a daily basis.
* Provide an authentic and friendly customer experience that exemplifies the Wayfair commitment to relentless customer focus.
* Engage in a high energy, focused and dynamic work environment where there can be rapid changes in products, promotions and store operations.


**Experience Qualifications**


* 1\-3 years Visual Merchandising experience in a retail setting. Required
* 1\-3 years Retail experience; preferably in a home or furnishings space. Interior design, furniture or home goods experience preferred. Preferred
* 1\-3 years Reading, interpreting and executing a sales floor design layout map or basic planogram. Preferred


**Skills and Abilities**


* Passion for exceeding sales targets through Visual Merchandising. (High proficiency)
* Passion for operational excellence, great Customer Service and consistent efficiencies to meet company goals. (High proficiency)
* Track record of thriving in a fast paced and changing environment while demonstrating professional maturity. (Medium proficiency)
* Strong organization, self\-motivation, communication and relationship management skills. (High proficiency)
* Technical acumen to learn necessary software; proficiency in Google Suites and/or Microsoft Office applications preferred. (Medium proficiency)
* Ability to work a flexible schedule, including nights, weekends and some holidays. (High proficiency)

* Stationary Position \- Constantly
* Move/Traverse \- Constantly
* Stationary Position/Seated \- Rarely
* Transport/Lifting \- Occasionally (50lbs)
* Transport/Carrying \- Occasionally (50lbs)
* Exerting Force/Pushing \- Occasionally (50lbs)
* Exerting Force/Pulling \- Occasionally (50lbs)
* Ascend/Descend \- Occasionally (50lbs)
* Balancing \- Occasionally
* Position Self/Stooping \- Frequently
* Position Self/Kneeling \- Frequently
* Position Self/Crouching \- Frequently
* Position Self/Crawling \- Occasionally
* Reaching \- Occasionally
* Handling \- Frequently
* Grasping \- Frequently
* Feeling \- Frequently
* Communicate/Talking \- Constantly
* Communicate/Hearing \- Constantly
* Repetitive Motions \- Frequently
* Coordination \- Frequently

 * **Competitive Pay:** Earn competitive compensation with regular opportunities for performance\-based increases.

title: IC Team Lead
description:
We are Wayfair; we deliver a best\-in\-class customer experience in the furniture and home space because of people like you, who are driven, determined, collaborative, and thrive in a fast\-paced environment. In order to maintain our high level of delivery standards and meet our customer’s needs, the Wayfair Distribution team plays a key role in improving customer satisfaction and driving repeat business. We’ve been busy building a best\-in\-class logistics network that allows us to delight customers by speeding up deliveries, adding services, and reducing damage using our own physical, asset\-based warehouses. We are looking for talented hard\-working individuals to join our growing team – your professional home awaits you at Wayfair!

**Hourly Pay**

* up to $22/hr (Depending on shift/dept)

**Shift**

* Wed\-Sat 6am\-4:30pm

**Benefits (Start Day 1!)**

* Referral bonuses
* Overtime hours \& pay
* 401(k) with company match with company match
* Wayfair company discount
* Benefits start day one
* Growth opportunities (Conversions, Promotions, and more!)

 **What You'll Do**

* The Warehouse Team Lead will assist your supervisor with managing and overseeing all functions of the warehouse, and ensuring smooth operations of all activities.
* Lead the receiving department and ensure the functions are used correctly.
* Delegate and assign work to keep a 100% fill rate.
* Help manage the inventory and conduct necessary training within the department.
* Ensure the proper use and accountability of tools.
* Ensure hours and functions are recorded correctly (e.g. Time clocks)
* Be responsible for answering email and verbal questions in a timely manner.
* Keep product moving and oversee the cleanliness of the department. This includes daily trash compacting.
* Additional responsibilities as assigned.

**What You’ll Need**

* Working understanding of WMS system.
* Leadership and motivational skills, and the ability to make decisions with little to no guidance based on policies or common sense.
* This is a floor position, and will involve physically moving/processing products in addition to leading a team of warehouse associates
* Must be comfortable repeatedly lifting up to 75 pounds unassisted and maneuvering product 150\+ pounds unassisted or via team lift.
* Experienced in more than one department. Work areas include: receiving, inventory control, pick, pack, ship and return of product.
* Experience with composing and replying to emails.
* Power Equipment experience – Must be able to operate or willing to be trained on Powered Industrial Truck Operations (PITO).
* Experience with creating and updating systems such as trouble tickets.
* 2\+ years working experience. Must have excellent attendance.
* Understanding of High Jump is a plus.
* Able to read and comprehend English to ensure your safety and the safety of those working around you.


**Assistance for Individuals with Disabilities**  

Wayfair is fully committed to providing equal opportunities for all individuals, including individuals with disabilities. As part of this commitment, Wayfair will make reasonable accommodations to the known physical or mental limitations of qualified individuals with disabilities, unless doing so would impose an undue hardship on business operations. If you require a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, please let us know by completing our Accomodations for Applicants form.

title: Specialist, Retail Back of House Operations
description:
**Specialist, Logistics \& Inventory Ops**


**$19/hour**



Location: Wilmette, IL


**Overview:**

  


As a **Logistics and Inventory Specialist**, you’ll play a critical role in ensuring seamless operations as Wayfair's Physical Retail team reimagines the shopping experience. From managing inventory flow and conducting audits to processing shipments and resolving discrepancies, your work will directly support an exceptional customer shopping experience. With a keen eye for detail and a proactive approach to problem\-solving, this role will focus on maintaining inventory accuracy, resolving logistical exceptions, and optimizing efficiency. The ideal candidate thrives in a fast\-paced environment, collaborates effectively with partner teams, and is passionate about owning and creating a flawless operational foundation reflecting Wayfair’s commitment to a top\-tier experience and retail excellence.

  

**What Does a Logistics \& Inventory Specialist Do?**


* **Demonstrates Reliability:** Attendance and commitment to being present and on time for your full shift each day is crucial. This helps ensure we're ready and available to help our customers when they need us most. For unexpected events or issues, we require our team members to be proactive in their communications and planning whenever possible.
* **Ensure Inventory Accuracy:** Perform daily audits and maintain a robust Cycle Count Program to safeguard the integrity and accuracy of inventory records. Leverage scan technology to document carton\-level details like condition, quantity, and location.
* **Manage Inventory Performance:** Monitor aging inventory, process markdowns, and execute damage write\-offs to maintain accuracy and efficiency. Handle vendor returns for recalls, dead stock, and overstock inventory while leveraging experience in inventory management or e\-commerce to optimize processes.
* **Receive and Process Shipments:** Unload and receive inventory with care, including the manual handling of large and heavy goods. Ensure all inventory is processed correctly, capturing detailed records of overages, shortages, or damages.
* **Proactively Monitor Systems:** Use order management tools and Warehouse Management Software to track inventory movement, troubleshoot discrepancies, and maintain up\-to\-date records. Regularly review Cycle Count data using Google Sheets to identify and address gaps.
* **Audit Operations:** Conduct regular and triggered audits for inbound and outbound trucks to ensure accurate processing and shipment flow.
* **Support Operational Excellence:** Use a ticketing system to manage exceptions, resolve issues, and provide input on improving existing processes and tools based on your day\-to\-day experience.
* **Collaborate Across Teams:** Partner with logistics leaders and other teams to streamline operations, share insights, and uphold Wayfair’s commitment to operational excellence.
* **Adapt and Problem\-Solve:** Thrive in a fast\-paced environment by taking ownership of inventory challenges, driving solutions, and ensuring smooth coordination between warehouse and retail operations.

  


**What are the Job Requirements?**

  


**Education:** High School Diploma or equivalent is required.


**Inventory Control Experience:** 1 to 3 years of inventory control experience, preferably in a retail environment, is required.


**Distribution or Logistics Experience:** 1\+ year ofexperience in distribution or logistics is preferred.


**Open Schedule Availability:** You may be required to work a flexible schedule that in many cases may include nights, weekends, and holidays.


**Customer Service Skills:** Must possess excellent customer service skills, with the ability to communicate effectively and work well under pressure in a fast\-paced environment.


**Adaptability and Problem\-Solving:** Demonstrates the ability to adapt to evolving tools, systems, and processes to ensure operational excellence.


**Technical Proficiency:** Strong computer skills with experience in Microsoft Office or Google Suite are preferred.


**Detail Orientation:** Must be highly detail\-oriented and organized, with a proven ability to manage complex inventory systems and workflows.

 **Additional Physical and Environmental Requirements**:

  

* Physical Demands
* + Frequent movement including standing, stooping, kneeling, crouching
	+ Occasional lifting, carrying, pushing, and pulling up to 50 lbs
	+ Frequent repetitive motions and coordination
	+ Constant handling, grasping, and communication (talking/hearing)
	+ Ability to ascend/descend stairs and balance
* Working Environment
* + Some exposure to cold, heat, and humidity
	+ Occasional noise and vibrations
	+ Minimal hazards and seasonal temperature changes

**What are the Benefits\*?**



**Competitive Pay:** Earn more based on your experience—starting at $19/hour!  

**Career Growth:** Access professional development and advancement opportunities to help you grow with us.  

**Health Benefits from Day One:** Medical, dental, and vision insurance coverage starts on your first day.  

**Time to Recharge:** Start accruing paid time off immediately—because work\-life balance matters.  

**401(k) with Company Match:** We’ll match up to 4% to help you plan for your future.  

**Tuition Reimbursement:** Eligible after 6 months of employment—learn, grow, and get support along the way.  

**Wayfair Employee Discount:** Save big on the pieces you love—plus get 10% off at our in\-store restaurant ️.  

**Parental Leave Options:** Choose from paid and unpaid leave plans to support your growing family.  

✨ **And So Much More:** We’ve got more good stuff where that came from! Our full\-time roles receive the full benefits package, while part\-time or seasonal team members may have modified offerings. Your recruiter or in\-store team can help with any questions!



Wayfair Employee discount and much more!  

* *These benefits may vary or change for part\-time or seasonal status employees. Detailed benefit guides will be issued to anyone who is offered a position with Wayfair for further insights into all of the great offerings available. If you’re curious to learn more about a specific benefit detail, your recruiter or a member of our team onsite can help with this information!*
**About Wayfair Inc.**

Through our commitment to industry\-leading technology and creative problem\-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career.
