title: Merchant - Early Careers (Summer 2025 Start)
description:
**Additional Details:**


* This is a Boston based opportunity with a 4 day in office expectation (Monday \- Thursday) with 1 day remote (Friday).
* At this time, Wayfair will not sponsor applicants for employment authorization for this position for the following work visas: STEM OPT EAD, H\-1B, H\-1B1, E\-3, O\-1, J\-1, or TN


As a Merchant, you will develop, execute and drive annual and seasonal assortment strategies for your categories. In this role, you will be responsible for category ownership and product curation, influencing how your category comes to life across all Wayfair marketing channels (catalog, digital, social media, and Physical Retail), ensuring accurate product representation and appropriate shelf placement. As a Merchant you will foster strong cross functional relationships to ensure all strategies and goals are achieved, acting as the representative of the customer in strategic decisions on the cross\-functional team. The Merchant will partner with teams across Brand Management, Category Management, Creative, Marketing, Analytics \& Operations, and external suppliers to ensure the strategic vision is executed all the way to the customer. Leveraging both data\-driven qualitative and quantitative insights, you'll make a direct impact on overall sales, Wayfair share gains, and inspire and empower customers to create a home just right for them.


**What you'll do on any given day as a merchant...**



As a Merchant, you will build, curate, and maintain category assortment strategies for our marketing channels, inclusive of developing a shelf space plan and actively selecting and iterating on the product offering (own identifying and filling assortment gaps from strategic supplier catalogs). You will ultimately decide what products should be highlighted and amplified across all marketing channels with crisp business justification to support your selections and in alignment with key stakeholders. You will study the competitive market and collaborate with cross\-functional partners in order to shape and solidify the direction for your category and to ensure it is competitive in product and price. You are the product expert \- you know our customer’s needs better than anyone else for your category and are constantly thinking about what tomorrow’s best sellers will be to continue to surprise and delight our target market.



Your success requires tenacity, agility, speed, an analytical mindset, collaboration, influence, and a competitive spirit. You'll use your executive presence to work with and influence stakeholders at all levels and navigate interesting, complex assortment challenges. You will own the performance results though regularly monitoring assortment health though various KPIs and OKRs.


**What You’ll Do**


* Build and maintain category assortment strategies, inclusive of developing a shelf space plan and actively selecting, developing and iterating on the product offering.
* Identify opportunities for category growth, utilizing competitive analysis, trend research, and internal performance monitoring as data points.
* Partner closely with Category Management, Creative, and Brand teams, as well as external suppliers, to determine how best to bring the selection to life in digital, print, and stores.
* Maintain a close pulse on trends and customer needs to identify new assortment opportunities. Find products that deliver compelling newness and have potential to be tomorrow’s best sellers.
* Own the financial outcomes for the performance of the products you placed on the premium shelf spaces. Regularly assess performance and revise assortment and shelf space allocation strategy as needed.
* Challenge the status quo and always be on the lookout for ways to streamline and improve the efficiency of existing processes while effectively managing multiple stakeholders.
* Support market research opportunities for category growth, utilizing competitive analysis, competitor shopping, and internal performance monitoring as data points.
* Manage sample requests to our retail lab and inspect products for quality control.
* Travel 2\-4 times per year to attend industry trade shows relevant to your categories to partner with strategic suppliers, visit Wayfair stores, and competitive shop.


**What You’ll Need**


**Basic Qualifications**


* 1\-3 years of transferable experience in a corporate environment, including internship and co\-op experience.
* Authorization to work in the United States without visa sponsorship by Wayfair now or in the future.


**Preferred Qualifications**


* Experience within a retail and/or omni\-channel buying role with demonstrated growth trajectory of P\&L size and scope of category/team responsibility.
* Experience buying trend\-driven categories, curating assortments from a wide range of vendors and classifications, and developing compelling assortment presentations are all highly preferred.
* Strong ability to analyze data and think critically about the business, understand and interpret performance trends, and apply learnings to the business.
* Strong creative sense, elevated taste level, and love of product. A genuine passion for industry trends, product design, and home decorating is a plus.
* Personable and energetic communication/persuasion skills and ability to influence internal and external stakeholders to align behind and execute against a common goal.
* Capable of thriving in a high\-growth environment in which defining clarity amidst ambiguity and operating in “scrappy start\-up building mode” are everyday activities. Demonstrated experience piloting and implementing new processes and hiring/staffing new teams are a plus.
* Self\-starter motivated by the potential to define a creative and strategic vision and have an outsized impact within a team and company.
* Ability to work from Wayfair’s Boston headquarters 4 days per week (remote 1 day a week), with travel for competitor diligence, trade shows, and/or vendor meetings.


**Possible Team Placements**


**Specialty Retail Brands**



Wayfair’s Specialty Retail Brands (AllModern, Birch Lane, Joss \& Main) target the $60B specialty furniture market and are incremental to Wayfair LLC. These brands provide a tightly curated assortment of highly stylish and elevated quality products for the style\-obsessed specialty customer. SRB Merchandising teams own the full category strategy for relevant verticals on one of the three brands below:


* **AllModern****:** AllModern is the destination for the best of modern design in a simple, streamlined experience. We believe good design should be the standard for all, not a luxury for the few – so we’re making modern simple.
* **Birch Lane****:** At Birch Lane, we curate a thoughtfully handpicked assortment of furniture \& decor that showcases our fresh take on traditional \- unlike anything else in the marketplace. We strive to bring our customers a breadth of classic styles made relevant for today and attainable for everyone.
* **Joss \& Main**: Joss \& Main is a specialty retail brand catering to home decor enthusiasts. It is the ultimate style edit for home – a curated mix of the latest looks and trends in home furnishings, made attainable via fast, free shipping and great prices.


**Wayfair's In\-Office Policy:**



All Boston\-based corporate employees will be in office in a hybrid capacity. Employees will work in the office on designated days, Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday, and work remotely the other 1 day of the week.


**Why You’ll Love Wayfair:**


* Time Off:
* + Paid Holidays
	+ Paid Time Off (PTO)
* Health \& Wellness:
* + Full Health Benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision, HSA/FSA)
	+ Life Insurance
	+ Disability Protection (Short Term \& Long Term Disability)
	+ Global Wellbeing: Gym/Fitness discounts
	+ Mental Health Support (Global Mental Health, Global Wayhealthy Recordings)
	+ Caregiver Services
* Financial Growth \& Security:
* + 401K Matching (Employee Matching Program)
	+ Tuition Reimbursement
	+ Financial Health Education (Knowledge of Financial Education \- KOFE)
	+ Tax Advantaged Accounts
* Family Support:
* + Family Planning Support
	+ Parental Leave
	+ Global Surrogacy \& Adoption Policy
* Professional Development \& Recognition:
* + Rewards \& Recognition
	+ Global Employee Anniversary Awards
	+ Paid Volunteer Work
* Unique Perks:
* + Employee Discount
	+ U.S. Bluebikes Membership
	+ Global Pod Outings
* Work/Life Balance:
* + Emphasizing a supportive \& flexible work environment that encourages a balance between personal and professional commitments

**Purpose \& Inclusion at Wayfair:**  

At Wayfair, we pride ourselves on fostering an environment where every individual experiences a fair and equitable employee journey. We are committed to developing targeted resources that raise awareness around inclusion and eliminate barriers, ensuring Wayfair provides a fair and inclusive workplace experience for everyone.


**Social Impact \& Responsibility:**  

At Wayfair, we focus on helping people on their journey to home \- specifically those who have lost their way from home. We do this by leveraging our best assets, such as collaborating with leading nonprofit organizations, coordinating in\-kind product donations, empowering our employees to get involved through paid volunteer time off programs, and encouraging our customers to donate. This multi\-faceted approach allows us to support communities in need in authentic ways that align with Wayfair's broader mission of helping everyone, anywhere create their sense of home.

Through our commitment to industry\-leading technology and creative problem\-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. title: Senior Analyst, Open Box Monetization
description:
*At this time, Wayfair does not provide sponsorship for employment authorization for this position.*



As a part of the Imperfect Inventory Monetization team, this individual will be responsible for owning Wayfair’s monetization strategy through our Open Box channel. While Wayfair Outlets serve as our physical retail presence, the Open Box program operates as our e\-commerce channel on Wayfair.com.



We are looking for an analytical, action\-oriented, and collaborative individual that can translate business problems to actionable insights and data driven solutions to influence operational results. The Senior Analyst will own end\-to\-end management of the Open Box channel, including pricing strategy, performance optimization, and cross\-functional collaboration to maximize profitability. Successful individuals in this role excel at both qualitative and quantitative analysis while also being eager to communicate upward and outward to tell a concise story.


**What You'll Do:**


* Manage processes and engagement with key cross\-functional partners
* Build dashboards, visualizations and prototypes to translate data sets into driving insights and actions
* Conduct ad hoc analyses and build advanced reports
* Present insights or analyses to a large audience with pointed business recommendations
* Communicate regularly with cross functional partners to understand business trends and new ways to break down problems into solutions
* Develop sustainable, long\-term performance management practices to assess and grow the business
* Build, operationalize, and iterate on key performance metrics and dashboards
* Engage in road mapping and prioritization through diligent opportunity sizing and scoping efforts
* Work cross\-functionally with a variety of teams including Analytics, Forecasting, and Technology


**What You'll Need:**


* Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field
* 2\+ years of professional experience
* Advanced experience with Microsoft Excel or Google Sheets, SQL or GBQ, and data visualization tools such as Google Data Studio (Looker, Tableau, or PowerBI)
* Team\-first attitude with enthusiasm for cross\-functional collaboration
* High attention to detail and proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously
* An entrepreneurial spirit and mindset; you must be adaptable and comfortable with change


**An Important Note about Wayfair's In\-Office Policy:**



All Boston\-based interns, Co\-ops, and corporate employees will be in office in a hybrid capacity. Employees will work in the office on designated days, Monday \- Thursday, and work remotely Friday.

title: Senior Product Manager, Post-Order Experience
description:
**Who We Are \[Post\-Order Experience]**



Wayfair believes everyone deserves a home they love, and that furnishing your home should be a source of fun, not anxiety. Our Product team plays a crucial role in making this vision a reality for millions of people around the world. Partnering with Engineering, Experience Design, Analytics and business leaders across Wayfair, our Product team ensures that we’re building technology that solves important customer problems in elegant, scalable, measurable ways.



The Post\-Order Experience team builds the systems that enable the customer to have confidence in Wayfair by providing timely, proactive information about the order lifecycle and easy paths to solutions when something goes wrong. With millions of impressions each month on pages like My Account and Track Package, we have immense potential to create better experiences that lead to both repeat revenue and cost savings.



We’re looking for a Senior Product Manager who not only enjoys getting into the details of their stakeholders’ needs, but also executing on their ideas through fruition on a global scale. As part of the Post\-Order team, you will develop and execute on the product roadmap across both revenue generation (upsell \& cross\-sell opportunities) and cost reduction (preventing the need for customers to contact us). You will drive business outcomes through strong stakeholder engagement and creative and testable solutions for metric improvements, while simultaneously supporting investments in technology transformation initiatives that simplify and modernize our code base.



You are customer and data\-obsessed, and love turning quantitative and qualitative findings into insights and strategy to drive product priorities. You have demonstrated success in inspiring and leading a cross\-functional team in rapidly delivering value to your customers. You’re one to aim high, calibrate constantly, and know when to double down or fold in pursuit of something even greater.

  


**What You'll Do**


* Create a product roadmap for a cross\-functional group of development teams across all platforms. You will own your roadmap, measure performance, keep your pulse on the customer, anticipate bottlenecks, make tradeoffs, and take acceptable risks to maximize the benefit for our customers and business
* Build strong relationships throughout the organization, ensuring transparency across our roadmaps and surfacing opportunities to improve our collective velocity, consistency and/or quality
* Autonomously establish and maintain collaborative, trusting relationships with stakeholders and manage expectations
* Partner closely with Engineering and Analytics teams to execute against your roadmap and continually improve team velocity
* Improve our product in ways that matter most to our users and have the biggest impact on our KPIs by using quantitative and qualitative data
* Work with your product peers and leadership to contribute to improving our product craft and processes throughout the extended Data Engineering team

  


**What You’ll Need**


* 5\+ years of product management experience, preferably in customer\-facing roles
* Strong technical background with a passion for breaking down challenging problems
* Excellent analytical skills with demonstrated experience turning data into actionable insights (preference for working with Google Cloud Platform products such as Google BigQuery, Looker or similar products experiences from another platform)
* Proficient with SQL and writing complex but efficient queries
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills at the senior leadership level, as well as with cross\-functional teams, especially ability to partner with engineering teams and explain technical terminology to non\-technical audiences
* Deep understanding of business strategy and metrics
* BA with strong academic record (strong preference for technical/engineering backgrounds)
* Positive, people\-oriented, and energetic attitude

 **About Wayfair Inc.**



Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry\-leading technology and creative problem\-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If you’re looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then you’ll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking.

title: Product Manager, Orchestration and Planning Tech
description:
**Who We Are \[Orchestration and Planning Tech]**



The Optimization team within the Orchestration and Planning Tech (OPT) STO is responsible for selecting the optimal fulfillment plan throughout the customer purchase journey at Wayfair. This involves designing algorithms and building scalable systems that select the fulfillment plan and optimize orders as they move through the fulfillment process to ensure the best possible customer outcomes.



Within Optimization, the Plan Outputs team plays a critical role as the interface between Supply Chain Technology and external consumers of the fulfillment plan. Once a fulfillment plan is selected, the Plan Outputs team ensures that this information is accurately and efficiently communicated to teams within and outside of Supply Chain Tech — including Storefront, Browse, and third\-party partners like Google.



By enabling real\-time fulfillment plan communication across these systems, the Plan Outputs team ensures that customers receive clear, reliable delivery expectations throughout their shopping journey, directly influencing trust, conversion, and satisfaction.

  


**What You’ll Do**


* **Fulfillment Plan Communication**: Act as the key bridge between Fulfillment Optimization and customer\-facing teams to ensure fulfillment selection decisions (e.g., shipping dates, delivery promises) are accurately and clearly represented to consumers.
* **Cross\-System Alignment**: Aligning fulfillment inputs with pricing and inventory management systems to drive better cost optimization and ensure consistent business logic across platforms.
* **Formalizing Fulfillability Criteria**: Defining clear criteria for when products are considered fulfillable or unfulfillable to improve product findability and maintain customer trust.
* **Leading Cross\-Functional Initiatives**: Acting as the primary product lead for major, time\-sensitive programs affecting the Wayfair’s customer journey and Delivery Experience.

  


**What You’ll Need**


* 5 \+ years building products or infrastructure at scale from concept to launch and beyond.
* Cross\-functional product leadership
* Understanding of supply chain, fulfillment, and logistics processes.
* Able to understand and map dependencies across tech and supply chain systems.
* Ability to define product roadmaps, prioritize features, and manage the product lifecycle.
* Excellent analytical, problem\-solving, and decision\-making skills.
* Experience with e\-commerce and customer facing products
* Deep understanding of how delivery speed, reliability, and promises impact customer behavior (conversion, NPS).
* Ability to balance customer\-centric goals with operational and cost considerations.

  


***An Important Note about Wayfair's In\-Office Policy:***


*Please note that this is a hybrid role based in Boston, and will require you to work in the office on Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays.*

title: Product Manager, Quality and Recovery
description:
**Who We Are \[Quality and Recovery]**



Wayfair believes everyone deserves a home they love, and that furnishing your home should be a source of fun, not anxiety. Our product team plays a crucial role in making this vision a reality for millions of people around the world. Partnering with engineering, UX design, analytics, and business partners across Wayfair, our product team ensures that we’re building technology that solves important customer problems in elegant, scalable, measurable ways. We have a modern tech stack including sophisticated capabilities around AI, data science, multivariate testing, and personalization. We’re a highly collaborative, supportive team that values learning, psychological safety, and intentional career development.



We are looking for a passionate Product Manager to join the Wayfair Quality and Recovery product team. Our team owns product development and roadmaps for all quality assessments and imperfect inventory monetization products for both the fulfillment and delivery operations within Wayfair CastleGate facilities and Physical Retail Stores. The successful candidate will be responsible for easy\-to\-use, relevant, and insightful experience in those user modules enabling the Wayfair associate to identify quality issues, assess any product for quality standards, and properly assign condition information to Live orders, Returns, or On Hand Inventory. Efficient operations will enhance the quality of the customer experience with Wayfair by reducing any exposure to damages, defects, or other customer\-facing negative experiences.

  


**What You’ll Do**


* Develop a deep understanding of the metrics used to measure the customer experience related to damages, defects, and returns, and how those relate to our fulfillment and transportation operations.
* Work to develop best in class tooling to standardize assessment of products that range from ornaments to outdoor sets.
* Partner across multiple operations to understand nuances in different stages of the supply chain, from our factory partners to our delivery drivers.
* Partner with business stakeholders to understand their businesses and co\-develop impactful solutions that drive key business value.
* Use Agile processes to collaborate with partnering teams (engineers, experience designers, analytics) to execute the roadmap.
* Communicate and promote the product vision and progress throughout Wayfair including senior partners.
* Develop and monitor OKRs for key product initiatives and ensure alignment with stakeholder objectives.
* Work with management to improve product craft and processes throughout your workgroup.

  


**What You’ll Need**


* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent combination of education and experience is preferred.
* 4 \+ years building products or infrastructure at scale from concept to launch and beyond.
* The ability to focus on customer problems and solutions
* To have demonstrated success in creating products that drive business impact.
* Sufficient industry literacy to participate in making key choices as well as effectively communicate with technical partners such as engineering.
* Strong analytical and data\-driven decision making skills
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills at the senior partner level.
* Positive, people\-oriented, and collaborative attitude.
* A mentality that pushes through issues with creative solutions and tenacity, while maintaining a grace\-under\-pressure demeanor.

  



***An Important Note about Wayfair's In\-Office Policy:***


*Please note that this is a hybrid role based in Boston, and will require you to work in the office on Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays.*

title: Warehouse Team Lead
description:
***The pay for this position is $20\.75/hr \+ $2\.75/hr SEO Premium when applicable***  

  



We are Wayfair; we deliver a best\-in\-class customer experience in the furniture and home space because of people like you, who are driven, determined, collaborative, and thrive in a fast\-paced environment. In order to maintain our high level of delivery standards and meet our customer’s needs, the Wayfair Distribution team plays a key role in improving customer satisfaction and driving repeat business. We’ve been busy building a best\-in\-class logistics network that allows us to delight customers by speeding up deliveries, adding services, and reducing damage using our own physical, asset\-based warehouses. We are looking for talented hard\-working individuals to join our growing team – your professional home awaits you at Wayfair!


**Shift**


* Wed \- Sat 5 PM \- 3:30 AM

 **Benefits (Start Day 1!)**


* $1\.50/hr Shift differential after 6:00pm
* Referral bonuses
* Overtime hours \& pay
* 401(k)
* Wayfair company discount
* Benefits start day one
* Growth opportunities (Conversions, Promotions, and more!)


**What You'll Do**


* The Warehouse Team Lead will assist your supervisor with managing and overseeing all functions of the warehouse, and ensuring smooth operations of all activities
* Lead the receiving department and ensure the functions are used correctly
* Delegate and assign work to keep a 100% fill rate
* Help manage the inventory and conduct necessary training within the department
* Ensure the proper use and accountability of tools
* Ensure hours and functions are recorded correctly (e.g. Time clocks)
* Be responsible for answering email and verbal questions in a timely manner
* Keep product moving and oversee the cleanliness of the department. This includes daily trash compacting
* Additional responsibilities as assigned


**What You’ll Need**


* Working understanding of WMS system.
* Leadership and motivational skills, and the ability to make decisions with little to no guidance based on policies or common sense
* This is a floor position, and will involve physically moving/processing products in addition to leading a team of warehouse associates
* Must be comfortable repeatedly lifting up to 75 pounds unassisted and maneuvering product 150\+ pounds unassisted or via team lift
* Experienced in more than one department. Work areas include: receiving, inventory control, pick, pack, ship and return of product
* Experience with composing and replying to emails
* Power Equipment experience – Must be able to operate or willing to be trained on Powered Industrial Truck Operations (PITO)
* Experience with creating and updating systems such as trouble tickets
* 2\+ years working experience. Must have excellent attendance
* Understanding of High Jump is a plus
* Able to read and comprehend English to ensure your safety and the safety of those working around you

title: Senior Associate, B2B Partnership Enablement
description:
**Must be Onsite in Boston, MA (Monday\-Thursday)**


***At this time, Wayfair will not sponsor applicants for this position who need sponsorship now or in the future. That includes, but is not limited to, the following work visas: F1\-OPT, STEM OPT EAD, H\-1B, H\-1B1, E\-3, O\-1, J\-1, or TN.***



Wayfair Professional’s North American Business to Business Sales (“B2B”) team is seeking a collaborative, analytical\-oriented thought leader to help drive Wayfair Professional’s B2B agenda. Wayfair’s B2B and Global Sales teams support Wayfair Professional and high\-value Sales customers. The Customer Enablement (CE) team designs and implements customer\-centric experiences that add value for our B2B and Sales customers. We serve customers via a ‘gated’ site experience that is tailored based on a given customer’s vertical (e.g., Commercial Office, Interior Design, Contractor).



We seek a motivated Senior Associate with a leadership mindset who will partner with vertical leaders and sales team members to optimize the customer journey to consistently exceed revenue targets and improve the customer experience. **The Partnership Enablement role scopes/ develops and implements transformative partnerships with high\-value customers as well as defines where there are scalable opportunities for partnership improvement across the sales channel.** The role will report to the CE Team Lead and partner directly with cross\-functional teams (B2B CM, Design Services, Marketing, Revenue Operations, Sales Channel Teams) to drive overall customer partnership improvements. This includes proactively partnering with analytics to monitor performance and improve how we identify / prioritize customers, designing and implementing step\-change improvements to the customer experience, and driving cross\-functional projects that optimize the site\-, sales\-, or marketing treatment.


**What You’ll Do**


* Deeply understand both qualitative and quantitative trends in the business through active “voice of customer” engagement, strong knowledge of short/long\-term KPI trends
* Scope discrete project initiatives, ensuring operational excellence from problem definition through execution
* Drive execution to project deliverables, including hitting stage gate milestones, preparing / delivering updates to cross\-functional teammates, incorporating feedback
* Support development of mid\- and long\-term (6\+ month) roadmap to accelerate vertical performance, in conjunction with overall B2B OKRs and cross\-functional resources
* Partner with analytics team to incorporate new data signals to improve how we identify and segment new and existing B2B customers
* Plan, design, and execute new partnership experience with high\-value customers that allow for scalable growth with that customer and other like customers. Experiences could include: new site experiences, service improvements and overall improvements to the way the customer accesses, engages and interacts with WF Professional.


**What You’ll Need:**


* 2\+ years of experience in sales enablement, project / program management, strategy \& operations, consulting, or similar roles supporting Sales, Customer Service, or Marketing teams
* Ability to understand and empathize with diverse stakeholders across functions, and tailor messaging / communication appropriately to ensure resonance; ability to create consistent messaging about complex projects, flexing to audience needs but creating cohesion on the objective and guiding principles
* Ability to break down complex, ambiguous problems into logical objectives, translating sales needs into discrete, actionable steps for partner teams to execute
* Passion for working collaboratively across functions to drive operational improvements and projects
* Empathetic with stakeholder (sales team) and partner (sales tech, analytics, sales performance and training, customer experience and journey) needs and perspectives to drive cohesive vision and execution
* Ability to manage processes efficiently by scoping logical steps from ideation to project completion, organizing data / materials for broad understanding, synthesizing stakeholder feedback, ensuring project interim steps are on time, and delivering results on time with high quality
* Ability to collect, analyze, and distill insights from data, understanding trends that affect performance in the short\-term and identifying long\-term opportunities for improvement


**An Important Note about Wayfair's In\-Office Policy:**



All Boston\-based interns, Co\-ops, and corporate employees will be in office in a hybrid capacity. Employees will work in the office on designated days, Monday \- Thursday, and work remotely Friday.


**Massachusetts Applicants:** I understand that it is unlawful in Massachusetts to require or administer a lie detector test as a condition of employment or continued employment. An employer who violates this law shall be subject to criminal penalties and civil liability.

title: Mechanic 2
description:
***The pay for this position is $32\.72/hr***



We are Wayfair; we deliver a best\-in\-class customer experience in the furniture and home space because of people like you, who are driven, determined, collaborative, and thrive in a fast\-paced environment. In order to maintain our high level of delivery standards and meet our customer’s needs, the Wayfair Distribution team plays a key role in improving customer satisfaction and driving repeat business. We’ve been busy building a best\-in\-class logistics network that allows us to delight customers by speeding up deliveries, adding services, and reducing damage using our own physical, asset\-based warehouses. We are looking for talented hard\-working individuals to join our growing team – your professional home awaits you at Wayfair!



The Mechanic II will be a highly self\-motivated, customer\-centric team player with the ability to work with little to no supervision solving difficult problems, managing outside contractors, being on call for emergencies and handling multiple projects and daily activities under tight timelines.

  


**Shift**


* Wednesday \- Saturday 6:00am \- 4:30pm


**Benefits (Start Day 1!)**


* $1\.50/hr shift differential for hours worked between 6:00am \- 6:00pm
* Referral bonuses
* Overtime hours \& pay
* 401(k) with company match with company match
* Wayfair company discount
* Benefits start day one
* Growth opportunities (Conversions, Promotions, and more!)


**What You’ll Do**


* Work independently and with little to no supervision to troubleshoot all conveyor material handling systems, electrical, plumbing, mechanical, and fire protection systems
* Execute departmental and operational goals
* Assist in the design, layout, and reconfiguration of existing systems as necessary
* Utilize CMMS system to create and maintain the work schedule and workflow
* Work regularly on aerial platform lifts, boom/snorkel lift, and powered industrial trucks (reach, order picker, stand up, pallet runners, stock chaser, etc.)
* Mentor team members by motivating, providing guidance and direct feedback to help them achieve their goals and improve individual performance
* Develop and maintain good working relationships across all levels of the organization
* Responsible for keeping and maintaining tools, supplies, and a clean, organized work area
* Will perform emergency repairs in high pressure circumstances

  


**What You’ll Need**


* Minimum 3 years experience in industrial maintenance and/or combined certification(s)
* Proficient reading and comprehending electrical schematics and using associated tools such as volt/ohm meter, etc. (120,240,480VAC, 24VDC)
* Ability to install, maintain, \& troubleshoot relay logic, ladder diagrams, control components, photo eyes, motor starters, relays, limit switches, proximity sensors, timers, solenoids, servo drives, frequency inverters, linear drives, and encoders
* Proficient using hand \& power tools and electrical testing equipment including PLC systems
* Experienced safely using warehouse equipment such as order pickers, pallet jacks, forklifts and aerial lifts
* Proficient using computer systems and CMMS software
* Will be required to wear applicable personal protective equipment including arc flash protection and safety shoes
* Ability to regularly bend, lift, stretch, crawl and reach, engage in full manual dexterity in both hands and wrists and stand and walk for long periods
* Must be comfortable repeatedly lifting up to 75 lbs unassisted
* Ability to access all areas of the building by climbing ladders and gangways safely and without limitation
* Ability to work in a non\-climate controlled environment that can be noisy and have a low lighting levels
* Follow all company safety policies, procedures, and guidelines
* Ability to work independently, as part of a team and take directions
* Must be a safety conscious, motivated, detail oriented, self\-starter with a positive attitude
* Must be flexible on working hours and willing to work scheduled \& unscheduled overtime

title: SEO Manager
description:
**This position is a hybrid in\-office role that is based out of our Mountain View, CA office. Tuesday\-Thursday will be working in office.**



*The salary range for this position is $133,100 \- $145,200 however, base pay offered may vary depending on location, job\-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Restricted stock units may be provided as part of the compensation package in addition to a full range of medical, financial and/or other benefits, dependent on the position offered.*



**Who We Are:**



Wayfair is a dynamic, cutting\-edge technology company operating in the ecommerce space. We’re committed to providing our customers with a best\-in\-class experience for all things home. For this newly created role, we are looking for an experienced SEO Manager to help shape and drive our organic growth strategy. In this role, you'll leverage technical SEO expertise and data driven analysis to identify performance drivers and use these insights to drive a strong experimentation agenda. You’ll also work closely with a dedicated SEO engineering team and have the opportunity to influence that team’s roadmap. For a strong motivated individual, there is an opportunity to make a meaningful impact to a critical growth lever for the company from day one.


**What You'll Do**


* Develop and own the overarching SEO strategy and roadmap to drive significant organic traffic and revenue growth for key business areas.
* Lead and mentor SEO analysts (if applicable) or influence cross\-functional partners through data\-driven insights and strategic direction.
* Define, monitor, and report on key SEO performance indicators (KPIs) to senior leadership, translating complex data into actionable business insights.
* Drive the SEO experimentation agenda, prioritizing tests based on potential impact and aligning efforts with broader business objectives.
* Collaborate closely with Engineering, Product, and Content teams to champion SEO best practices, prioritize technical SEO initiatives, and ensure seamless integration of SEO requirements into product roadmaps.
* Stay ahead of search engine algorithm updates, industry trends, and competitive landscape changes, proactively developing strategies to mitigate risks and capitalize on opportunities.
* Oversee advanced competitive analysis and market research to identify strategic opportunities and maintain a competitive edge in SERPs.
* Champion scalable SEO solutions, working with technical partners to automate processes and enhance platform capabilities.


**What You'll Need**


* 5\+ years of dedicated SEO experience, with a proven track record of developing and executing successful SEO strategies for large\-scale websites, preferably in eCommerce.
* Demonstrated experience leading SEO initiatives, managing projects, and influencing cross\-functional teams (direct management experience is a plus).
* Expert\-level understanding of technical SEO (crawlability, indexation, site architecture, rendering, structured data, site speed), on\-page optimization, and off\-page strategies.
* Strong strategic and analytical skills; ability to derive insights from large datasets using tools like Google Analytics / Search Console, Screaming Frog, Semrush, Ahrefs, etc., and proficiency with Excel, Google Bigquery/SQL, and/or Python for data analysis.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to articulate complex SEO concepts and performance to diverse audiences, including senior stakeholders.
* Experience influencing product and engineering roadmaps to prioritize SEO initiatives.
* Proven ability to adapt to a fast\-paced, data\-driven environment and manage multiple priorities effectively.
* Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, Computer Science, or a related field; Master's degree is a plus.

* 5\+ years of dedicated SEO experience, with a proven track record of developing and executing successful SEO strategies for large\-scale websites, preferably in eCommerce.
* Demonstrated experience leading SEO initiatives, managing projects, and influencing cross\-functional teams (direct management experience is a plus).
* Expert\-level understanding of technical SEO (crawlability, indexation, site architecture, rendering, structured data, site speed), on\-page optimization, and off\-page strategies.
* Strong strategic and analytical skills; ability to derive insights from large datasets using tools like Google Analytics / Search Console, Screaming Frog, Semrush, Ahrefs, etc., and proficiency with Excel, Google Bigquery, SQL, and/or Python for data analysis.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to articulate complex SEO concepts and performance to diverse audiences, including senior stakeholders.
* Experience influencing product and engineering roadmaps to prioritize SEO initiatives.
* Proven ability to adapt to a fast\-paced, data\-driven environment and manage multiple priorities effectively.
* Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, Computer Science, or a related field; Master's degree is a plus.

title: Operations Facility Admin
description:
**\*\*You must submit an updated resume when applying to this role in order to be considered for the role\*\***


***The pay for this position is $24\.25/hr***


**Shift:**

  

* **1st shift:** Monday \- Friday; 7:30am \- 4:30pm



We are Wayfair; we deliver a best\-in\-class customer experience in the furniture and home space because of people like you, who are driven, determined, collaborative, and thrive in a fast\-paced environment. In order to maintain our high level of delivery standards and meet our customer’s needs, the Wayfair Distribution team plays a key role in improving customer satisfaction and driving repeat business. We’ve been busy building a best\-in\-class logistics network that allows us to delight customers by speeding up deliveries, adding services, and reducing damage using our own physical, asset\-based warehouses. We are looking for talented hard\-working individuals to join our growing team – your professional home awaits you at Wayfair!


**Benefits (Start Day 1!)**


* $2\.00/hr Shift differential for hours worked between 6:00pm \- 6:00am
* Referral bonuses
* Overtime hours \& pay
* 401(k) with company match
* Wayfair company discount
* Benefits start day one
* Growth opportunities (Conversions, Promotions, and more!)
* Dozens of discounts and perks with partners


**What You’ll Do**


* Maintain a close working relationship with all warehouse functions; provide support as directed.
* Maintain a close working relationship with Talent Management (HR); provide support as directed.
* Gather data to compile productivity and operational reports for warehouse management; audit for content and accuracy.
* Perform extensive data entry into various business systems; complete tickets, compile reports, and conduct audits.
* Provide general office support (file, create POs, order supplies, manage mail, etc.).
* Assist with timekeeping activities (enter/adjust data and schedules, create and audit reports, resolve discrepancies, manage points systems).
* Assist with new hire onboarding activities including creating packets, new hire data entry, supporting new hire orientation.
* Manage time cards and ID badges.
* Assist with planning and executing employee engagement and wellness activities
* Assist with distribution of employee communication material.
* Manage safety logs and reports; actively participate on the safety committee.
* Assist warehouse employees with computer usage, questions, etc.
* Provide support for other company locations as needed.
* Help with travel, site events and/ or training events.
* Complete other duties as requested by the management team.

  


**What You’ll Need**



* High School diploma or equivalent.
* Excellent MS Office skills, particularly Outlook and Excel (logic and data functions, macros, VBA, pivot tables, etc.); ability to learn new systems quickly
* Excellent communication skills and ability to communicate clearly in English (verbal and written).
* Previous experience within a warehouse, logistics, distribution, or related environment preferred
* Ability to use a computer keyboard, computer screen, telephone headset and telephone system.
* Previous experience with ticketing systems
* Previous involvement with event planning a plus
* Demonstrated ability to multitask, and provide a high level of detail

title: Luxury Brand Marketing Manager, Perigold
description:
Perigold is seeking a Brand Marketing Manager to join the Perigold Marketing team. In this role, you’ll be responsible for ensuring brand integrity and consistency across the entire consumer journey to drive consideration, recall, and awareness. You’ll develop a deep understanding of the Perigold customer (B2C and B2B), the competitive landscape, and the core brand offering to inform creative briefs, marketing plans and drive best\-in\-class execution. You’ll oversee how the Perigold brand comes to life across key initiatives, including loyalty programs, B2B, and prospecting across the Wayfair family of brands.


**This role is based in Boston (4 days in office) and reports to Perigold’s Chief Marketing Officer, with significant cross\-functional exposure across our Marketing, Retail, Content, Creative, and Category Management teams.**


**What You’ll Do**


* Own the brand strategy with the CMO and manage its execution and consistency across customer touch points, inclusive of both B2C and B2B and across the Wayfair Family of Brands
* Develop, test, and measure Perigold’s B2B marketing strategy, in partnership with the B2B CMO and Marketing teams
* Own Perigold’s loyalty strategy, inclusive of launch strategy, execution, and ongoing management and measurement
* Centralize and evangelize consumer insights, including management of annual Brand Health survey through our external insights vendor
* Ensure Brand Communications Calendar reflects a cohesive cross\-channel strategy, inclusive of brand and merchandising priorities; work with cross\-channel partners to bring to life through GTM process
* Partner with Performance Marketing lead and Integrated Marketing Analyst to concept, execute, and measure integrated Brand Campaigns
* Partner with marketing channels and Creative teams to ensure brand positioning is effectively integrated into all creative assets
* Manages a team of 3 direct reports, including oversight of Promotions \& Offers, Supplier Marketing \& Advertising, and Curation
* Oversee our Supplier Marketing and Advertising function, ensuring our strategy to market our supplier brands ladders up to overall Brand Strategy and maximizes monetization potential
* Oversee our Promotions function, including promotional calendar and campaign execution and measurement
* Oversee Curation, ensuring our product curations in marketing and onsite events reflect our SOV priorities and storytelling goals


**What You’ll Need**


* 5\+ years of experience working in brand marketing in a consumer brand, agency, and/or consulting capacity
* Luxury retail experience highly preferred
* A deep understanding of and curiosity about consumer behavior
* Demonstrated balance of being highly analytical and originally creative
* Critical thinking including the ability to break down complex ideas and generate insights and solutions or strategically build a story from large data sets
* Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to influence senior\-level and cross\-functional stakeholders
* Ability to communicate a high\-level brand vision as well as give tactical creative feedback
* Strong verbal and written skills including distilling data into compelling, insight\-led presentations
* Superb project management skills including the ability to work on multiple projects at once
* An ownership mindset with the ability to streamline processes and thrive in a highly ambiguous and fast\-paced environment with a “get stuff done” attitude
* Collaborative team player who wants to see the whole team succeed and thrive
* Familiarity with the latest market trends and best practices especially as it relates to the target consumer

description:

title: Sr. Benefits Associate
description:
*This position is a hybrid in\-office role that works out of our Boston HQ. Monday\-Thursday will be working in office and Friday is WFH. This is not a virtual / remote position.*



We are seeking a Senior Benefits Associate to support the administration, compliance, and cost management of our U.S. health, welfare and absence programs. This role will play a critical part in ensuring compliance with federal, state, and provincial regulations, analyzing key cost drivers, and implementing strategic interventions to optimize healthcare spend.



The ideal candidate is an analytical, detail\-oriented professional with a strong understanding of health plan design, regulatory compliance, and benefits analytics. This position offers an opportunity to take ownership of complex projects, collaborate with senior stakeholders, and drive cost\-effective, consumer driven benefits strategies.


**What You'll Do**


***Health Plan Administration \& Operations***


* Support the administration of U.S. health \& welfare plans, ensuring compliance, efficiency, and a seamless employee experience.
* Act as a subject matter expert for escalated benefits issues, partnering with vendors and internal teams to drive resolution.
* Lead annual benefits enrollment efforts, including communication strategies, vendor system testing, and employee education initiatives.
* Conduct in\-depth analyses of claims data, plan performance, and utilization trends to guide program enhancements.


***Health Plan Analytics \& Cost Containment***


* Analyze health plan cost drivers, including claims trends, high\-cost claimants, and utilization patterns.
* Develop and present data\-driven recommendations to optimize plan design, reduce unnecessary costs, and enhance employee engagement.
* Support negotiations with vendors and insurers to ensure cost\-effective benefits solutions.
* Stay informed on industry benchmarks, regulatory changes, and emerging trends to proactively manage risks and opportunities.


***Compliance \& Regulatory Oversight***


* Ensure ongoing compliance with ERISA, ACA, HIPAA, COBRA, and state\-specific regulations.
* Lead efforts on 5500 filings, PCORI, RxDC and other mandated reporting
* Partner with legal and external counsel to stay ahead of regulatory updates affecting U.S. benefits programs.


***Absence Program Management***


* Design and optimize absence programs to ensure legal compliance, alignment with company values and business needs
* Serve as the subject matter expert (SME) on leave of absence programs and related employment practices.
* Provide guidance to the leave administration team, ensuring consistent communication and a high\-quality experience.
* Maintain compliance with federal and state regulations including FMLA, ADA, HIPAA, and local leave laws


***Vendor \& Stakeholder Collaboration***


* Manage vendor relationships, ensuring adherence to contracted service levels, reporting accuracy, and cost containment goals.
* Support RFPs, plan renewals, and implementation of new benefits programs
* Collaborate cross\-functionally with Talent, Finance, Legal, and Procurement teams to align benefits programs with business needs.
* Provide strategic insights and recommendations to senior leadership on benefits trends and plan performance.


**What You'll Need**


* 3\+ years of experience in benefits administration, compliance, or benefits analytics.
* Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources Management or related field preferred \- equivalent experience and proven results in HR Management, Benefits, FMLA, ADA will also be strongly considered.
* Strong knowledge of U.S. benefits regulations (ACA, ERISA, HIPAA, COBRA, etc.).
* Experience with health plan data analysis, claims reporting, and cost containment strategies.
* Strong problem\-solving skills with the ability to interpret complex data and make strategic recommendations.
* Ability to work independently in a fast\-paced team environment while managing multiple priorities.
* Experience working with HRIS systems and benefits platforms (Workday / Alight preferred).
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.

title: Executive Assistant
description:
*This position is a hybrid in\-office role that works out of our Boston HQ. Monday\-Thursday will be working in office and Friday is WFH. This is not a virtual / remote position.*



Wayfair, one of the largest retailers of home furnishings and housewares in the United States, has an immediate need for an Executive Assistant to manage the day\-to\-day activities for leaders across our Marketing and Specialty Retail Brand teams. This is a fantastic opportunity for the right individual to support the senior leaders of one of the fastest\-growing companies in Boston. The ideal candidate will have strong organizational and planning skills, a sense of urgency, be detail oriented, and have problem\-solving abilities. This person should be smart, engaging, fun, curious, and unflappable.



Wayfair’s team of Executive Assistants play a crucial role in supporting executives. Their responsibilities include scheduling and coordinating meetings, managing travel arrangements, and opportunities to own projects across different operational functions. This position offers a unique opportunity for an experienced executive assistant looking to elevate their career.


**What You’ll Do:**


* Executive Support: Provide support for 3\-6 leaders in Marketing and Specialty Retail Brands. Enhance the executives' efficiency and effectiveness through comprehensive support.
* Calendar Management: Organize and manage all aspects of internal and external meetings with the ability to schedule and prioritize meetings, resolve schedule conflicts, collaborate with other team members, and stay several steps ahead to maintain efficiency.
* Travel Management: Arrange all travel details, both domestic and international, with the ability to make frequent revisions as necessary.
* Expense Management: Handle monthly business expense reports, ensuring timely and accurate processing.
* Event Planning: Support with planning, coordination and execution of team events.
* Customer Focus: Maintain a customer\-centric approach, ask pertinent questions in meetings, and readily adapt to new challenges.
* Teamwork and Positivity: Foster a collaborative team environment, keep a positive attitude, and proactively support colleagues and company events.
* Admin Coverage: Provide coverage for members of the leadership support team as needed.
* Thrive in a fast\-paced workplace by effectively multitasking and managing competing priorities.


**What You’ll Need:**


* At least 2\+ years of experience as Administrative Assistant/Executive Assistant for senior level executives.
* Ability to be assertive and give push\-back as needed.
* Meticulous attention to detail and strong planning and forward\-thinking capabilities.
* Flexible and be able to adapt quickly to last\-minute changes, taking them in stride while maintaining a pleasant manner and motivating spirit.
* Demonstrated ability to anticipate needs and situations before they are fully developed.
* Advanced proficiency in Google Enterprise Suite tools (calendar, mail drive, docs, sheets, slides, meet).
* Excellent written, verbal, and presentation skills.
* Extremely high level of discretion pertaining to confidential information.


**Massachusetts Applicants:** I understand that it is unlawful in Massachusetts to require or administer a lie detector test as a condition of employment or continued employment. An employer who violates this law shall be subject to criminal penalties and civil liability.

title: Sr. Marketing Cross Channel Analyst
description:
*This position is a hybrid in\-office role that works out of our Boston HQ. Monday\-Thursday will be working in office and Friday is WFH. This is not a virtual / remote position.*


* **At this time, Wayfair does not provide sponsorship for employment authorization for this position.**



The Sr. cross channel analyst is a marketing generalist who supports the CMO function for Wayfair Canada, specifically to drive performance marketing success. This person is the resident expert on marketing channel performance for the brands, steers the marketing strategic planning process (i.e., forecasting and roadmap collaboration), and leads the thinking on multi\-channel marketing strategies (e.g, targeting) that improve channel effectiveness and customers health.


**What You’ll Do:**


* Marketing Performance: Own the marketing performance narrative in all formal and informal touchpoints. Execute deep\-dive investigations that span across channels (in partnership with marketing channel teams) to deliver actionable insights to department leadership. Own all formal reporting.
* Channel Effectiveness: Deep understanding of full marketing funnel to serve as strategic thought partner to marketing channel teams. Hold individual channels accountable for test rigor and business results. Draw connections across channel roadmaps (e.g., between prospecting \& email) to improve overall customer experience to amplify channel\-specific performance. Promote a balanced focus on operational excellence.
* Strategic Planning: Drive the ad spend forecasting process with the channel leads to ladder up into the broader quarterly P\&L process, in partnership with Brand Finance. Intra\-quarter, lead the monitoring and management of performance metrics against the forecast.
* Strategic Projects: Support investigation into cross\-channel levers (e.g., personalization, targeting, retargeting) to improve customer growth / customer health. Serve as a project manager for complex multi\-channel projects, ensuring scalability / sustainability of initiatives, knowledge\-sharing and impactful results.


**What You Need:**


* Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business Analytics, or related fields.
* 3\+ years of experience in a performance marketing role.
* Strong analytical skills with experience using tools such as SQL and Looker.
* Experience developing roadmaps and informing marketing strategies.
* Highly organized with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously .
* Strong verbal and written communication skills, with an ability to tailor updates to the appropriate audience (senior stakeholders, peers, analysts, etc.).
* An entrepreneurial mindset with the ability to thrive in a highly ambiguous and fast\-paced environment with a dynamic bias for action.


**Massachusetts Applicants:** I understand that it is unlawful in Massachusetts to require or administer a lie detector test as a condition of employment or continued employment. An employer who violates this law shall be subject to criminal penalties and civil liability.

title: Senior Marketing Analyst
description:
*This position is a hybrid in\-office role that works out of our Boston HQ. Monday\-Thursday will be working in office and Friday is WFH. This is not a virtual / remote position.*


* **At this time, Wayfair does not provide sponsorship for employment authorization for this position.**



The Sr. cross channel analyst is a marketing generalist who supports the CMO function for Wayfair Canada, specifically to drive performance marketing success. This person is the resident expert on marketing channel performance for the brands, steers the marketing strategic planning process (i.e., forecasting and roadmap collaboration), and leads the thinking on multi\-channel marketing strategies (e.g, targeting) that improve channel effectiveness and customers health.


**What You’ll Do:**


* Marketing Performance: Own the marketing performance narrative in all formal and informal touchpoints. Execute deep\-dive investigations that span across channels (in partnership with marketing channel teams) to deliver actionable insights to department leadership. Own all formal reporting.
* Channel Effectiveness: Deep understanding of full marketing funnel to serve as strategic thought partner to marketing channel teams. Hold individual channels accountable for test rigor and business results. Draw connections across channel roadmaps (e.g., between prospecting \& email) to improve overall customer experience to amplify channel\-specific performance. Promote a balanced focus on operational excellence.
* Strategic Planning: Drive the ad spend forecasting process with the channel leads to ladder up into the broader quarterly P\&L process, in partnership with Brand Finance. Intra\-quarter, lead the monitoring and management of performance metrics against the forecast.
* Strategic Projects: Support investigation into cross\-channel levers (e.g., personalization, targeting, retargeting) to improve customer growth / customer health. Serve as a project manager for complex multi\-channel projects, ensuring scalability / sustainability of initiatives, knowledge\-sharing and impactful results.


**What You Need:**


* Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business Analytics, or related fields.
* 3\+ years of experience in a performance marketing role.
* Strong analytical skills with experience using tools such as SQL and Looker.
* Experience developing roadmaps and informing marketing strategies.
* Highly organized with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously .
* Strong verbal and written communication skills, with an ability to tailor updates to the appropriate audience (senior stakeholders, peers, analysts, etc.).
* An entrepreneurial mindset with the ability to thrive in a highly ambiguous and fast\-paced environment with a dynamic bias for action.

title: Furniture Repair Tech III
description:
***The pay for this position starts at $37\.82/hr***  

  



We are Wayfair; we deliver a best\-in\-class customer experience in the furniture and home space because of people like you, who are driven, determined, collaborative, and thrive in a fast\-paced environment. In order to maintain our high level of delivery standards and meet our customer’s needs, the Wayfair Distribution team plays a key role in improving customer satisfaction and driving repeat business. We’ve been busy building a best\-in\-class logistics network that allows us to delight customers by speeding up deliveries, adding services, and reducing damage using our own physical, asset\-based warehouses. We are looking for talented hard\-working individuals to join our growing team – your professional home awaits you at Wayfair!

 **Shift**
* Sun \- Wed 6 AM \- 4:30 PM

 **Wayfair Benefits**
* $1\.50 Shift differential after 6:00pm
* Referral bonuses
* Overtime hours \& pay
* 401(k)
* Wayfair company discount
* Benefits start day one
* Growth opportunities (Conversions, Promotions, and more!)

 **What You'll Do**
* Work independentlyto evaluate damages and defects of items and determine if items can be repaired. Make any required adjustments to items ahead of delivery and ensure item is in perfect condition to be delivered to the customer
* Prioritize and execute on daily, weekly, and monthly tasks (repairs) to ensure completion in a effective and timely manner
* Accurately reports outcomes of work in progress, completed, \& past due work
* Monitors inventory, and orders replacement parts and complete installs as needed
* Ask clarifying questions when appropriate
* Administer appropriate repair methods for various product types including, but not limited to:
* + Evaluate each piece of furniture to determine the type of wood and/or upholstery repairs, parts, and materials needed to complete the job
	+ Case Goods: Burn\-ins, refinishing, joinery, match colors, and simulate wood grain
	+ Refinishes and patches damaged furniture including paint, stain, enamel or lacquers; mixes paints and stains to match existing finish
	+ Repairs, replaces and rebuilds damaged wood, leather or upholstery furniture or mechanical parts
	+ Operates tools such as power drills, sanders, saws, and other tools required for repair
* Use scan technology to document pertinent carton level information, including condition, quantity, warehouse location and detail repair completed
* Provide direct input into the existing user tools and make recommendations for improvements based on expertise \& experience
* Be a vocal contributor on the team
* Contribute to the building and development of training materials for applicable functions
* Must understand that this role will require you to work cooperatively with others, adjust to change, be a reliable team member, and work with other towards a common goal

 **What You'll Need**
* At least 5\+ years prior experience in furniture repair/construction
* Advanced understanding of repairing wood items including: color and stain matching, damage/defect repair
* Ability to use power and hand tools as needed
* Advanced understanding of repairing upholstery and multiple fabric types a plus
* High attention to detail and prioritizes quality to deliver a perfect item to the customer.
* Must be comfortable lifting up to 75 lbs. unassisted and moving product 150\+ lbs. unassisted or via team lift
* Must be able to work on warehouse floor 8 hours a day or more
* Strong, consistent work ethic and ability to manage time effectively
* Comfort with scanning technology.
* Able to read and comprehend English to ensure your safety and the safety of those working around you.
* Must be at least 18 years of age.
* Certification in Furniture Repair/Restoration, preferred

 **Safety**

The safety of employees remains our \#1 priority and is at the heart of every decision made. We have taken a variety of steps to ensure that Wayfair is one of the safest places to work by:
* Providing Guidelines to help employees maintain proper social distancing
* Providing and requiring suitable PPE such as masks, gloves, and safety vests.
* Increased sanitizing stations, as well as, improved professional sanitization of each facility.
* Team stretches at the start of each shift \- if you've come to flex your muscles, you first have to stretch them!

title: Full-Time Visual Merchandising Associate - Perigold Luxury
description:
**Associate, Visual Merchandising**



Location: West Palm Beach, FL


**Brief Overview of Position**



Perigold, the destination for luxury home, is opening its first physical retail stores, first\-of\-their\-kind luxury retail destinations of 20\-30K square feet, with the best products in all styles and from across our catalog including furniture, decor, housewares, and home improvement categories. Come be a part of it! We are looking for a Visual Merchandising Associate who will be responsible for the daily maintenance of all in\-store Visual Merchandising initiatives (e.g. Presentation, Marketing/Signage, Merchandise Flow, Visual Operations) as we bring the in\-store experience for the Perigold brand to life. We are seeking an individual with strong organizational, multitasking and time\-management skills with great attention to detail while ensuring in\-store presentations align with the seasonal strategy for the Perigold organization. This position will play a significant role in helping build and shape the internal Visual Merchandising team structure and execution of processes for all future Perigold stores. This position will report directly to the Visual Merchandising Senior Associate.


**What you’ll do**


* Maintain luxury experience standards by supporting an authentic, inviting guest experience that exemplifies our commitment to customer satisfaction and passion for luxury design.
* Assist with Visual Merchandising tasks such as floorsets, product replenishment, signage/marketing and maintaining company visual standards (including folding \& steaming textiles, bed making and basic cleanliness tasks as needed).
* Ensure store presentations are as close to the directive as possible.
* Use of company provided technology related to Visual Merchandising and Store Operations.
* Be open to receiving feedback and direction from store leaders around brand presentation to deliver Wayfair standards on a daily basis.
* Assist all customers in store by providing helpful information, guidance, and support in sales transactions.
* Assist with replenishment efforts in store to address store instocks.


**What you’ll need**


*Experience*


* 1\-3 years Visual retail experience, specific to maintaining presentations and resetting departments. Required
* 1\-3 years Customer experience in a retail setting. Preferred
* Demonstrated experience or interest in luxury a plus.


*Skills and Abilities*


* Highly skilled in understanding of how to use technology and a willingness to learn new programs. (High Proficiency)
* Ability to work a flexible schedule, including nights, weekends and some holidays. (High Proficiency)
* Capable of thriving in a fast\-paced environment while demonstrating professional maturity. (Medium Proficiency)
* Candidates must be open to learning how to safely operate a pallet jack (also known as a pallet truck or pump truck) as part of their job responsibilities. Training will be provided to ensure proper handling and safety protocols are followed. Typically, this requires you to be able to lift at least 50lbs or more.


*Physical Demands*


* Stationary Position \- Constantly
* Move/Traverse \- Constantly
* Stationary Position/Seated \- Rarely
* Transport/Lifting \- Occasionally
* Transport/Carrying \- Occasionally (50lbs)
* Exerting Force/Pushing \- Occasionally (50lbs)
* Exerting Force/Pulling \- Occasionally (50lbs)
* Ascend/Descend \- Occasionally (50lbs)
* Balancing \- Occasionally
* Position Self/Stooping \- Frequently
* Position Self/Kneeling \- Frequently
* Position Self/Crouching \- Frequently
* Position Self/Crawling \- Occasionally
* Reaching \- Constantly
* Handling \- Constantly
* Grasping \- Constantly
* Feeling \- Constantly
* Communicate/Talking \- Constantly
* Communicate/Hearing \- Constantly
* Repetitive Motions \- Frequently
* Coordination \- Frequently


**Compensation \& Benefits:**


* Compensation starting at $24\.00 per hour \+ substantial quarterly bonuses
* Medical benefits, financial benefits, and a generous employee discount


**About Perigold**



Perigold is the destination for luxury home. Established in 2017, Perigold offers an unmatched selection of the world’s best design brands, with unique pieces for every style and space. The brand offers the highest quality pieces for home, backed by a quality guarantee and expert concierge support. They also offer free white\-glove delivery and 30\-day returns on most items. Headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts, Perigold is part of the Wayfair Inc. (NYSE:W) brand portfolio.

title: Senior Designer Consultant, Full Time - Perigold Luxury
description:
**Retail Design Consultant \- West Palm Beach, FL**



Perigold, the destination for luxury home, is opening its first physical retail stores, first\-of\-their\-kind luxury retail destinations of 20\-30K square feet, with the best products in all styles and from across our catalog including furniture, decor, housewares, and home improvement categories. Come be a part of it! We are



hiring experienced Designers who will be responsible for working with both Trade and Consumer clients. If you are passionate about design, looking for rapid growth, and thrive on learning and dynamic challenges, this store might be the future home for your career.

  


**What you’ll do**


* Maintain luxury experience standards and provide an authentic, inviting guest experience that exemplifies our commitment to customer satisfaction and passion for luxury design.
* Own your book of business end\-to\-end, fostering long\-standing relationships with design clients and prospecting potential new design customers in the store and in the community.
* Meet the complex needs of the Perigold customer, including large\-scale luxury projects, trade projects, and intricate custom product development
* Leverage your interior design and sales expertise in the home furnishings space to help our customers navigate through their design needs and purchases.
* Share your expertise in fabric and finishes, bringing awareness to performance, texture and durability characteristics as well as market trends using digital and physical swatches
* Manage virtual, in\-home, and in\-store design appointments (including preparation of design deliverables, product curation, and follow up).
* Utilize sales analytics and design software tools and applications to drive store profitability and growth in a way that supports the success of the overall brand (moodboards, space plans, 2d/3d room views).
* Efficiently manage your time in design appointments and sales floor interactions by prioritizing the customer experience while keeping communication open with leadership.
* Meet or exceed sales and customer satisfaction targets, and other established KPIs.
* Participate in operational store activities as needed: bringing new products to the floor, floor sets, replenishment and substitutions.
* Bring a willingness to share innovative ideas and solutions to continuously improve team operations
* Engage in a high energy, focused and dynamic work environment where there can be rapid changes in products, promotions, offerings and operations

  


**What you’ll need**


*Experience \& Qualifications*


* 2\+ years of design experience within a design firm or high end furniture retailer.
* Professional portfolio required.
* Familiarity with Perigold supplier brands, materials and construction, and custom programs a plus.
* Proven track record of managing large\-scale projects for luxury B2C and trade customers.
* Passion for design, great customer service and a drive to exceed sales targets.
* Strong organization, self\-motivation, communication and relationship management skills.
* Technical acumen to learn necessary software; proficiency in Google Suites and/or Microsoft Office applications preferred.
* Experience leveraging CRMs/POS/ and design software such as Salesforce, DesignFiles, AutoCAD, Sketchup, Revit, etc. preferred
* Demonstrated ability to work within a team sales environment.
* Track record of thriving in a fast paced and changing environment.
* Bachelor’s degree or college diploma equivalent specializing in Art, Architecture, or Interior Design preferred.
* Flexibility availability (including mornings, nights, weekends, some holidays).


*Physical Demands*


* A valid driver's license is required for in home design visits.
* While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to stand, walk, talk and hear. The employee frequently is required to handle, or feel and reach with hands and arms. The employee is occasionally required to sit; regularly climb or balance; and frequently stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must regularly, frequently or occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 lbs.
* Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.

  


**Compensation \& Benefits**


* Compensation for this role is a base of $28\.00 per hour \+ substantial quarterly bonuses based on sales achieved and successful prospecting.
* Medical benefits, financial benefits, and a generous employee discount.

title: Product Manager, Driveway and Fleet Insights
description:
**Who We Are \[****Driveway and Fleet Insights****]**



Wayfair believes everyone deserves a home they love, and that furnishing your home should be a source of fun, not anxiety. Our product team plays a crucial role in making this vision a reality for millions of people around the world. Partnering with engineering, UX design, analytics, and business partners across Wayfair, our product team ensures that we’re building technology that solves important customer problems in elegant, scalable, measurable ways. We have a modern tech stack including sophisticated capabilities around AI, data science, multivariate testing, and personalization. We’re a highly collaborative, supportive team that values learning, psychological safety, and intentional career development.



The Driveway and Fleet Insights team is responsible for the Wayfair Delivery Network Driveway app (Android) and visibility tool. The Product Manager in this role would work to build friction\-free driver and dispatcher applications that facilitate the movement of goods across the Wayfair global network and enable visibility into every step of the driver journey. This role and the associated products help to uncover opportunities for the surrounding Wayfair ecosystem (e.g. Routing, Customer Notification, Special instructions) in order to address gaps/defects which enhance the customer delivery experience.


**What You’ll Do**


* Areas of responsibility include solutioning in the Order Processing and Order Lifecycle Management spaces in order to support Wayfair’s growth and partner strategies in the e\-commerce space.
* Responsible for managing cross domain projects from discovery to delivery.
* Manage and create technical API data contracts to support the, defining how users should interact with the platform
* Ensure we are building a reliable, scalable, and extensible platform that supports the post order customer shopping experience
* Partner with business stakeholders to understand their businesses and co\-develop impactful solutions that drive key business value.
* Communicate and promote the product vision and progress throughout Wayfair including senior partners.


**What You’ll Need**


* 4 \+ years building software products at scale from concept to launch and beyond.
* Strong technical background with a passion for breaking down challenging problems and drive value incrementally
* Sufficient industry literacy to participate in making key choices as well as effectively communicate with technical partners such as engineering.
* Excellent analytical skills with demonstrated experience turning data into actionable insights. Some SQL experience preferred
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills at the senior leadership level, as well as with cross\-functional teams
* Deep understanding of how API\-focused products support business strategy and metrics
* Highly entrepreneurial mindset, with a bias for action \& customer\-focused innovation
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent combination of education and experience is preferred.

  


**About Wayfair Inc.**



Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry\-leading technology and creative problem\-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career.
